12:00.race_name: Play Corals Free "Racing-Super-Series" Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hdl Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles after winning Class 3 Kelso handicap fairly comfortably this month
runners.name: Spectacularsunrise
runners.spotlight: Won Class 3 Kelso handicap (2m, soft) pretty comfortably this month and is now 2-3 over hurdles; should be suited by the less testing ground here and ought to be a tough nut to crack on return to novice company.

runners.comment: Impressive bumper winner; scored on recent hurdle debut and has significant potential
runners.name: Mossy Fen Road
runners.spotlight: Point and impressive bumper winner who gamely fended off useful rival in tactical novice hurdle at Lingfield (2m, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) last month; the bare form leaves him just shy of Spectacularsunrise on the figures but he's open to considerable improvement, particularly if this race is run at a stronger tempo.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Wetherby last year before running at Aintree, when he finished down the field. The ground was a bit quick for him. He'll start in a novice hurdle at Lingfield on November 27. He's a chaser, but I'd be disappointed if he wasn't a smart hurdler first. I'm thinking he could go for a Listed novice hurdle at Exeter in early February. He's smart. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Finished a long way behind Tennessee Tango when 100-1 for hurdling debut at Exeter
runners.name: Ahanaglogh
runners.owner: De La Haye Lewis Newman Lennon Appleby
runners.spotlight: Showed only minor promise in a bumper on rules debut in June and finished a long way behind Tennessee Tango when 100-1 for hurdling debut at Exeter (2m, good to soft) three weeks ago.

runners.comment: Did not achieve a great deal when well-held third of five on rules debut at Lingfield
runners.name: Could Be You
runners.spotlight: Placed in two Irish points last season but the form isn't anything to get excited about and he didn't achieve a great deal when well-held third of five on recent rules debut at Lingfield (2m3f, good to soft).

runners.comment: Dual Listed Flat winner in France; below form on both British Flat start hurdle debut
runners.name: Galashiels
runners.spotlight: Smart Flat racer when based in France (dual 1m4f Listed winner); both British Flat runs this year were underwhelming and this hurdling debut comes after a five-month break but it will be interesting to see how he fares.

stable_tour.quote: He had some fair Flat form in France and we also gave him a couple of runs on the Flat. He'd been on the go for a while, so we gave him a break and he's just come back. He wants winter ground and he jumps very nicely at home, so we'll go novice hurdling. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Yet to show any significant promise after three hurdle runs
runners.name: Getaway Sam
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider at first flight on stable/hurdle debut in October and a well-beaten outsider on next two outings.

runners.comment: Respectable third on recent hurdle debut (2m4f) but has quite a bit to find here
runners.name: Hillwalk
runners.spotlight: Placed in both bumpers last season (one here) and a respectable third on hurdle debut at Plumpton (2m4f, soft) this month, but he has quite a bit to find with the principals on this drop back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second in a bumper at Chepstow, then went to Fontwell and things just didn't click for him that day. It took him a while to get over that, but he's back going well and showed with that good first run that he's got the ability. He's a big horse who'll probably go straight hurdling - he knows how to gallop and jump. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Placed on hurdle debut but took a backward step when well-held fifth this month
runners.name: Phineas Bunce
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in good-ground Doncaster bumper last season and made a quite promising hurdle debut when third at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) last month, but took a backward step and finished behind Tennessee Tango when well-held fifth at Exeter (2m, good to soft) three weeks ago.

stable_tour.quote: A nice, big bumper horse with two placed efforts behind him, he'll go hurdling now and I'm sure we've got a nice horse on our hands. I'd be surprised if he didn't make a significantly better jumper than a bumper horse. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in two slow-ground hurdles this autumn and remains best watched
runners.name: Stay Hopeful
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point in the spring (good to yielding) but was soundly beaten in two slow-ground hurdles this autumn and remains best watched.

runners.comment: Showed promise in two Irish bumpers but faces tough task on stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Stone Cold
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in two Irish bumpers for Stuart Crawford this year but not enough to make him of strong interest on this stable/hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Sound effort when third at Exeter this month; can collect another minor prize here
runners.name: Tennessee Tango
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who shaped with significant promise on both hurdling starts, more recently when third of 16 at Exeter (2m, good to soft; first run after wind op) three weeks ago; should go well again but may have to settle for another minor role.

stable_tour.quote: He looks a smart type, and he ran okay in a hot race at Chepstow last week. He won his bumper first time out for us, which was a surprise as he's such a big horse, and in the Listed bumper at Ascot he was pretty much last off the bridle. He's a lovely, big baby by Affinisea, a sire I like. He'll get better and better as the season progresses. He's had a minor wind op, which could help. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Prevailed narrowly at Leicester last time; still nicely treated on historical data
runners.name: Kamaxos
runners.spotlight: Failed to show his form on stable/seasonal debut but bounced back at Leicester (1m7f, soft; prevailed narrowly) since and may remain competitive as he's still nicely treated on historical data.

runners.comment: Went close at Ludlow most recently; possibilities if taking another step forward
runners.name: Cheesy Icon
runners.owner: E Murchan, K Mcconnell, A & P Shaw
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who tends to take a good hold but has shown promise, most recently going close at Ludlow (2m, good); possibilities, provided he takes another step forward on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Veteran who has plenty of Chepstow form; could go well off a handy mark back here
runners.name: Zambezi Fix
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has plenty of Chepstow form, including three wins, the most recent in April 2024; not at his best in two starts elsewhere this season but could go well off a handy mark back here.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo who may resume progress with Leicester reappearance under his belt
runners.name: Close Combat
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who ended last season with a success at Exeter (2m, heavy); down the field at Leicester on handicap/seasonal debut but may do better with that outing under his belt.

runners.comment: Won juvenile event at Kempton on this day last year; today may be the time to catch him
runners.name: Knight Templar
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-4 in handicap hurdles but he ran well at Exeter on penultimate occasion; won the juvenile event at Kempton (good to soft) on this day last year and today may be the time to catch him.

runners.breeder: Dr A Bolte U Dr H H Leimbach
runners.comment: Opened his hurdles account in Hereford contest last month; may build on that ready win
runners.name: Oakley

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P Crampton & Oliver Crampton & Djcc Investments Limited
Mrs P Crampton & O Crampton & D A Cloudsdale & J Crampton

runners.spotlight: Opened his hurdles account in Hereford contest (2m3f, good; third start for new yard) last month, showing improvement; may build on that ready win, provided he's as effective back down in trip.

runners.comment: Mostly respectable form in handicaps, fifth at Chepstow in sole start this term
runners.name: Razzle Dazzle Boy
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in this race last year but that was out of character; has respectable form otherwise in handicaps, fifth in competitive field at Chepstow (2m3f) in sole start this term; could go well.

runners.comment: Ran okay last time but needs to raise his game; has never defied a mark this high
runners.name: Activist

quotes.race: West Buckland Primary Racing To School Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Activist is a horse in good form and he hasn't had a hard winter. He's taken a long time to get to his best but he's done it well - Jack Tudor, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

runners.spotlight: Beaten long way at Chepstow on reappearance, then had further wind surgery; fared better at Leicester since but needs to raise his game; has never defied a mark this high.

runners.comment: Successful at Warwick in most recent attempt over 2m and still has low mileage
runners.name: Another Fine Mess
runners.spotlight: Ended last term with a win at Warwick (2m, soft) and still has low mileage; trailed home last of five on reappearance (2m3f) but may do better back down in distance with the outing under his belt.

runners.comment: Has failed to back up the form of her Uttoxeter win; headgear is now applied
runners.name: Gower Spirit
runners.spotlight: Has failed to back up the form of her Uttoxeter maiden win (2m4f, heavy) in two starts since, latest on handicap debut; chance depends on how well she responds to first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Long way behind Oakley at Hereford; 0-11 since his May success
runners.name: Gavin
runners.spotlight: Suited by good ground; has performed well several times during a busy current campaign but was a long way behind Oakley at Hereford most recently; 0-11 since his May success.

runners.comment: Still a maiden and has weak claims on his form this term; headgear fitted
runners.name: Estate Planning

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P K Cooper & Millie Cooper & Sean Cooper & Alice Cooper

runners.spotlight: Still a maiden; some creditable efforts last term but has weaker claims on his form this season, beaten in a claimer most recently; first-time headgear needs to make a difference.

runners.comment: Defied a stone higher mark in 2022 but doesn't seem the same horse now
runners.name: Cogital

quotes.race: First Cafes Handicap
quotes.quote: Cogital usually runs over further, so I didn't want it to turn into a sprint and wanted to use his stamina up the straight. He's a lovely horse to be fair and ran well last time at Ascot. He was unlucky then and should have been a lot closer. I imagine he'll mix and match with the Flat and jumping - Jordan Williams, rider.

runners.spotlight: Defied a stone higher mark in 2022 but doesn't seem the same horse now; gained sole success this year in a low grade on the Flat; modest fourth in latest attempt over hurdles.

13:05.race_name: Coral Racing Club "Join For Free" Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage De Busset
runners.comment: Beat Passing Kate by just over 4l at Bangor last month; still unexposed over fences
runners.name: Jour Devasion

prev_owners.owner: Late Sir T Pilkington & Sir R Pilkington
Sir T Pilkington & R A Pilkington

quotes.race: Dragonbet The Independent Bookmaker Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jour d'Evasion is admirably consistent, and he probably suffers from it. He runs his race, regular as clockwork ? he's run two very nice races in defeat this year and keeps creeping up the weights, which is always frustrating. Luckily he got his head in front this time and it was a very nice prize, particularly considering it was an extra meeting. It wouldn't frighten me if there was a stiff two-mile race, or a two-mile-three on better ground, I don't think he's necessarily trip-dependent, we will factor in what races are available when he's next ready to run -  Henry Daly, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at second attempt, ridden out to beat Passing Kate by just over 4l at Bangor (2m1f, heavy) four weeks ago; may not be seen to quite the same effect on the less testing ground here but still features prominently in calculations.

runners.comment: Ran well over 2m5f on stable debut in October 2024; absent since; 2m not sure to suit
runners.name: Storminhome

quotes.race: Sky Bet EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Storminhome was lugging right and then left and has come up the home straight and shown his inexperience. He didn't travel as well as last time on tacky ground, which he didn't love. He's a lovely horse who holds some exciting entries - whether we go or not I don't know - Ben Pauling, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 0-7 over fences; gave very good account when close third on stable debut at Wetherby (2m5f, good to soft) in October 2024, but not seen since and not sure to be suited by this drop back to 2m.

runners.comment: Made all at Plumpton last month and now 4-6 over fences; may still be improving
runners.name: Siam Park
runners.spotlight: Made all to win readily at Plumpton (2m1f, good) last month and is now 4-6 over fences; latest 7lb rise demands more from him but he might still be improving and the forecast slower ground here won't be a problem.

stable_tour.quote: He'll take a step forward from his first start of the season. We'll look to get him out soon and I expect he won't be far away. He loves it around Taunton, so we'll be looking to go back there soon. 12-11-25

He's nice and a lovely prospect for Brocade Racing, who allow us all the time we need. It was a good run from him at Wincanton before Christmas when he finished fourth after just getting tired and then he finished third there last week. I thought he ran well and he travelled nicely. I think that's decent form and he improved from his first run, although he probably wants slightly better ground. 18-01-24

runners.comment: Not disgraced in good Cheltenham handicap on seasonal debut; respected back at this track
runners.name: Ballybreeze
runners.spotlight: 3-9 over fences, with two of the wins gained over C&D; not disgraced in good-quality Cheltenham handicap on last month's seasonal debut and can make his presence felt on his return to this track; versatile gound-wise.

runners.comment: Second to a big improver at Ayr this month; has travelled from Scotland for this
runners.name: Heads Or Harps
runners.spotlight: Not fully exposed over fences and left his disappointing seasonal debut behind when second to a big improver at Ayr (2m, heavy) at start of this month; should be fine on the faster ground here and has travelled from Scotland for this race (his stable's only runner on the card).

runners.comment: Ended last season with a course win and ran well in defeat on both outings this term
runners.name: Passing Kate
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late David M Richards
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a course win from off the pace (2m3f, soft) and ran well from the front when second on both outings this term, more recently behind Jour d'Evasion at Bangor (2m1f, heavy) four weeks ago; remains on career-high mark but Ned Fox claims a useful 5lb today; can give another good account.

stable_tour.quote: She'll go to Leicester on December 5 for a mares-only 0-100 handicap hurdle. She's a course winner and the softer the ground the better for her. She's been consistent, winning twice and finishing in the first three in each of her last seven starts. 28-11-24

runners.comment: Did well last season but made low-key return in October and off for another 11 weeks since
runners.name: Ideallko
runners.spotlight: Began last season with three wins (two chases and a hurdle) and runner-up on next three outings (once over C&D); seems versatile regarding ground but made a low-key reappearance here in October and has been off for another 11 weeks since; needs to get back in the groove.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned it around. Adam Wedge came back after his win at Plumpton in October saying he's a different horse all of a sudden. He's got the hang of it over fences with two wins from three starts. I can see that being a catalyst for him to improve again. 02-11-23

He won at Ffos Las and Plumpton and was running a good race when he turned over at Sedgefield on Boxing Day. He took a fair whack, so we haven't rushed him back, and he doesn't want deep ground either. He'll be out when it dries a bit and he showed last time he'll be more than competitive off his mark, wherever he goes, whatever the trip. 28-02-24

runners.comment: Manner of Sandown win suggests he's a smart prospect; yard won this race in 2021 and 2023
runners.name: Macktoad

quotes.race: Daily Tips On Betting.Betfair "Introductory" Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What Macktoad has beaten no one knows, but I did like that. He won on good to soft in France and he hasn't got a rounded action, so whether he went on soft or not I didn't know. It was all a guessing game until we got here. I don't know what we'll do now, we'll get him home first and then make a plan. We could look for an introductory hurdle but there's the Finale [at Chepstow] too to consider. He ain't too bad at all - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bought for 125,000euros after French bumper win; easily followed up in juvenile hurdle at Sandown (soft) where he cruised past the line, looking a smart prospect; yard landed this prize in 2021 and 2023; strong credentials.

runners.comment: Unable to lay a glove on Macktoad at Sandown but remains open to improvement
runners.name: Kaldoun Des Rocs

prev_owners.owner: Claude Olivier Corral & Mme Elodie De Lageneste

runners.spotlight: Has shown promise with placed efforts at Compiegne (sole French start) and Sandown; unable to lay a glove on Macktoad last time but was similar odds and may get closer in the rematch as he remains open to improvement.

stable_tour.quote: A young horse from France who was placed in a juvenile hurdle that's working out very well. He doesn't exactly jump off the page at you as a juvenile hurdler, so I'm surprised he ran as early in his life as he did. But he's obviously smart, with a real future, and we'll probably see him out around Christmas. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Game winner last week but seems held by two of these rivals on earlier Sandown form
runners.name: Klycot
runners.spotlight: Gamely made all at Exeter (heavy) last week, adding to his French Flat win; however, may struggle to reverse earlier Sandown placings with Macktoad and Kaldoun Des Rocs who both appear to have greater potential.

runners.comment: Powered clear for 14l win at Kempton on the switch to this code; interesting prospect
runners.name: Sonic Pioneer

quotes.race: Live Racing Streaming At CopyBet Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: From the first day we schooled Sonic Pioneer he took to it amazingly well. For a three-year-old with that size and scope, he could jump a fence. He was a strong stayer on the Flat and seems to go on any ground. It was very impressive. You don't want to get too carried away, although it's quite hard not to, because there are a few nice horses in the division. But the way he's won, maybe he could be a Triumph hurdler -  trainer Martin Keighley, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Reached a fair standard on Flat for previous yard; has the potential to develop into a better hurdler, having powered clear for 14l success under Sean Bowen at Kempton (good) on the switch to this code; interesting upped in class.

stable_tour.quote: He's come from Jack Morland and has some very good form on the Flat. He stays well. He won impressively at Beverley over 1m2f on soft ground and then pulled away from the rest when second over 1m4f at Pontefract. With juvenile hurdlers, they must be strong stayers and go with cut in the ground, and he ticks those boxes. We've been doing plenty of schooling with him and I really like him. I think he could be above average and I'm looking forward to him running. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Scored readily at Auteuil in sole French outing; promising filly for major new connections
runners.name: Manlaga
runners.spotlight: Scored readily at Auteuil (heavy) in sole French outing and the form has substance, with one of her pursuers a dual Grade 3 scorer since; promising filly for her major new connections and warrants respect even with a 5lb penalty.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very nice filly who has come from France and has had one run in a juvenile hurdle at Auteuil, which she won impressively. She's got a Class 2 penalty, but we've got options. She looks to have a lovely temperament. 21-10-25

runners.breeder: Haras De Lhotellerie, Meridian Int, Seb
runners.comment: Gained her Exeter win in a race that threw up the winner of this contest in 2023
runners.name: Tenter Le Tout
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on her bumper effort with easy success in Exeter juvenile hurdle (good to soft) that was won in 2023 by Salver, who followed up in this contest; receives weight all round and brings potential; possibilities.

14:10.race_name: Join Coral "Bet £10 Get £50" Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well beaten on reappearance, which he's likely to build on; needs a career best
runners.name: Santos Blue

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers' Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Santos Blue has been crying out for three miles. I know he'd run his heart out for me and ran all the way to the line - Ben Sutton, jockey.  Santos Blue has been a fabulous horse for the Suttons - they bred him, own him and ride him! He's really getting through the line at three miles now and it opens up doors - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Santos Blue is so tough and tries his heart out every time. I look after him every day and that gives me an extra kick on days like this. It was a big performance with that weight and on that ground - Ben Sutton, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: All the way round Santos Blue jumped so slick and quick but that time he went one step too long and I lost my right iron. I've seen on the TV recently people riding with no irons and I thought 'I can't get it back.' When you're trying to fiddle around to get your iron, you're losing ground and holding the horse up. So I thought 'kick it out'. Harry always says 'hands and legs' so I just squeezed as tight as I could with my legs and he came for me. I was wishing and hoping he'd keep galloping and he did exactly that. He's an absolute legend. I got it all wrong on Boxing Day, I dropped him out. I gave him too much to do. This time I rode him up with the pace and he was a different horse - Ben Sutton, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won well on his only start here (2023); successful six times in all under regular rider Ben Sutton, including over 3m at Newbury in February on final start for Dan Skelton; well beaten there on reappearance four weeks ago, which he's likely to build on but to win this will require a career best.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good horse who wins a couple of races every year and I don't see why that should be any different this term. He loves soft ground and Wetherby and I'm sure we can find some good chances for him. 12-11-24

runners.comment: Worth a market check on this second hurdling start this term; stamina is not proven
runners.name: Crebilly
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on 2023-24 chase form; had a patchy campaign last season, when jumping fences seemed to be holding him back, and he's worth a market check on this second hurdling start this term; stamina is not proven.

stable_tour.quote: He picked up an injury after his first run of last season at Chepstow, which put him on the back foot. He's not always been the most fluent of jumpers over fences, which is why we started him back over hurdles at Aintree, but we're hoping a clear run can help him this season. 18-11-25

runners.comment: More than nine months off before clearcut win under C Pritchard at Newbury (3m, soft)
runners.name: Keable

quotes.race: Grosvenor Sport Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Keable is improving with every run and that was a tough ask off a much higher mark on this ground but he handled it well. I'm hopeful there's more to come as his confidence is running so high - Callum Pritchard, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Progressive last winter and he returned from more than nine months off with a clearcut win under Callum Pritchard at Newbury (3m, soft) four weeks ago; up another 5lb but probably had something in the tank that day; one query is that soft ground may suit him best.

runners.comment: His maiden win came here; needs a marked step forward but he's only a 5yo and low-mileage
runners.name: Royal Rambler
runners.spotlight: All starts have been at about 2m4f-2m5f on softer than good; won a maiden here in February but has been well held in mid-division when sent handicapping for his two starts this season; needs a marked step forward but he's only a 5yo and low-mileage, so that may yet be possible.

stable_tour.quote: He's nice and wants proper soft ground - he's a relentless galloper with a great attitude. He'll stay hurdling this season and we'll look forward to chasing next term. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on last two occasions he's tried this sort of trip, including latest start
runners.name: King Of The Lake

quotes.race: Howden Supporting West Berkshire Mencap Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: King Of The Lake travelled well, he's jumped well throughout and he's made lengths with every hurdle. He's kept on finding and has definitely improved for the wind-op. It's done the trick. He pinged three-out, landed with a good run and he's picked up nicely - Chad Bament, rider.

quotes.race: BetMGM Premier League Darts Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward and King Of The Lake has definitely improved for the wind op. He handled the ground well and trip - Chad Bament, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Seemingly transformed by a wind operation for his hat-trick under Chad Bament at Wincanton, Newbury and Exeter in February/March, stepping down in trip on each occasion (from nearly 2m6f down to 2m); has tried 2m7f/3m four times, soundly beaten on last two occasions including latest start, so others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Second in his only two handicaps; relatively unexposed, with new trip worth a go
runners.name: Ambion View
runners.owner: O C R Wynne & Mrs S J Wynne
runners.spotlight: Second-season hurdler who was sent handicapping for last three starts, runner-up at Newton Abbot (extended 2m6f) and Exeter (extended 2m2f) on his two runs this term; relatively unexposed, with new trip worth a go.

stable_tour.quote: He had a nasty fall at Wincanton last November and his form tailed off after. He had a lovely comeback run at Newton Abbot and I'm much happier with him, so we could go to Cheltenham for Saturday's intermediate handicap hurdle. It won't be long before we go chasing as he schools well over fences. 12-11-25

He's a lovely big baby and his owners are happy to be patient with him this season. He took a big step forward at Wincanton last time and James Tudor said he had a job to pull him up. We'll probably run him in another bumper and then he'll be turned away before coming back as what I hope is a smashing novice hurdler next autumn. 18-01-24

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Back to last season's winning mark and not a huge shock if he surges back to form
runners.name: Patriotik

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Patriotik is a good jumper and he enjoyed the drying ground. We ran him over three miles at Haydock and he unseated, and we've been desperate to try him again at the trip - Isabel Williams, rider.

runners.spotlight: Won at Doncaster (3m) in March and best form when never-nearer third of 17 at Uttoxeter (2m7f, again good to soft) two weeks later; three heavy defeats have followed (two this autumn) but he has crept back to last season's winning mark and it wouldn't be a huge shock if he surges back to form.

stable_tour.quote: He's entered in the 2m4f handicap hurdle at Aintree on Boxing Day and we're hoping the ground won't be too soft for him. There's a very good handicap over 2m4f at Windsor's Winter Millions meeting we might also go for, or the Lanzarote at Kempton. He hasn't won this season but did nothing wrong last time, or the time before, and I think he has a good handicap in him. 24-12-24

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on his latest four starts, three of them last winter; absent 302 days
runners.name: Ramo
runners.owner: C B Compton & L Di Franco

quotes.race: cornwallofficefurniture.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Plenty happened throughout the race, there was a bit of cutting up around the bends - all sorts really - but in Ramo I had plenty of horse to get me out of trouble - Ned Fox, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Form two winters back reads pretty well (including a reappearance win) but soundly beaten on his latest four starts, three of them last winter; absent 302 days and needs to return mightily refreshed.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go chasing this season and we know he likes it over three miles. He's not the biggest but that shouldn't be a problem to him. He's been schooling well. 23-10-24

runners.breeder: S C E A Du Haras Des Sablonnets Et Al
runners.comment: Tailed off at 4-9 with blinkers latest start but 2-2 in the tongue-tie/visor this autumn
runners.name: Doctor Kildare
runners.spotlight: Won in the tongue-tie/visor at Bangor and Hereford (on good over 2m7f/3m2f) in space of a week this autumn in his first two handicaps; tailed off at 4-9, however, when blinkers were tried in hat-trick bid four weeks ago (good to soft); the visor returns, so maybe that can be the difference.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Bangor in April and is ready for hurdles as he's been schooling well. He might not be the biggest but has talent. 22-10-24

runners.comment: Veteran who won this race in 2023 (soft) and also scored over C&D in February 2024 (heavy)
runners.name: Classic Concorde

quotes.race: Granite & Marble Crafts Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Classic Concorde lost his way last and after his last run we were wondering whether to give up on him, but we gave him a break and decided to have one more go. We might give him another one after that! We'll see what the handicapper does - Andy McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Greville Arms Hotel Mullingar Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought he was beaten four furlongs out and I switched him to the outside. Once there were no horses around him he started to pull on and he won very easily. He ran over 2m 4f at Downpatrick the last day and didn't have the boot to go but he stayed on at he end and stuck it out better today - Dillon Maxwell, jockey

runners.spotlight: Veteran who won this race two years ago (soft) and also scored over C&D in February 2024 (heavy);  while he's far more miss than hit these days, he did spark at this track once last winter; not totally dismissed.

14:50.race_name: Coral Welsh Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Could still be capable of better but softer ground and right-handed track may be ideal
runners.name: Intense Raffles

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It's a massive race to win and that was a good performance. It's unbelievable really. I thought they didn't go quick and I was comfortable where I was, we were just pottering away. I gave the fourth-last a right belt and I thought that'd knock the stuffing out of Intense Raffles. He stuck out his head and galloped all the way to the line - J J Slevin, rider. I'm buzzing. That's every bit as much as a thrill [as 2012] for different reasons. He came here as second favourite and we had huge confidence in him. He ran just like we expected he would. It's a very satisfying feeling - Thomas Gibney, trainer.

quotes.race: Book Your Advanced Tickets Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: It's easy to get carried away in a three-runner race. Good Time Jonny is probably much better dropped out in a big field and Henry's mare hadn't been in great form. If we didn't win it we would have been very disappointed but, at the same time, we couldn't have been happier with the way Intense Raffles did it. We could have gone for the novice race tomorrow in Naas, but we decided to come here today to test out the distance. We wanted to see if he'd stay and today it looks like he'd get every bit of it, so there is a good chance he'll come back on Easter Monday (for the Irish National) - Thomas Gibney, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Peak efforts at Fairyhouse on soft/heavy, winning the 2024 Irish National over 3m5f; the Grand National at Aintree this April did not work out from early stage, in which going left-handed seemed to play some part and there's still a nagging worry on that score, and about good to soft ground, after the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury last month in which he faded from four out; could still be capable of better but today's conditions may not be ideal.

runners.breeder: Dr V Simon, Mrs V Simon & Mr N Simon
runners.comment: Won last season's NH Chase and Irish National; something amiss in Grade 1 five weeks ago
runners.name: Haiti Couleurs

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I don't put it down to anything to do with grade of race or ability. I think it was just purely that, for whatever reason, Haiti Couleurs didn't show up. I knew from the start. Normally he'd be revving at the bit to try to get to the front and he'd be winging fences, but he didn't do any of that yesterday. It wasn't him at all. You can hear people say, 'he's just a handicapper' but that's absolute nonsense, it was nothing to do with ability yesterday, it just wasn't his day. I'm going to get a vet to do bloods, tracheal washes, back, everything, and maybe something will show up, but that definitely wasn't the normal Haiti Couleurs, so we can't take anything out of that race. We maybe ran him back too soon. We didn't think he had a hard race at Newbury, but he puts everything into his races and he'd had a gallop at Ffos Las not long before that run as well. That's a lot for a horse like him in a month. It's a shame we haven't taken anything out of yesterday as to the ceiling of his ability. We'll freshen him up and see where we go. He'll probably get an entry next week in the Welsh National, but he definitely won't run for a month or six weeks, maybe more, we'll just see how he is - Rebecca Curtis, trainer, speaking the following day.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I can't quite believe how easy it was all happening. Haiti Couleurs got into such a good rhythm, he jumped amazing and what a job Becky has done this season. He sweated up and it wasn't smooth beforehand but as soon as we jumped he got in such a good rhythm - Sean Bowen, rider. He's just so tough. I was a little bit worried as he likes to jump his way to the front and all the time I hoped he wasn't doing too much. After the second last I got excited and I knew he'd keep going. Could you ever imagine he can become a Gold Cup-type horse? He's not slow, I know he's won over three [miles] five [furlongs] in his last two races but he doesn't need to have that trip. He loves Cheltenham too - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

quotes.race: Princess Royal National Hunt Challenge Cup Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haiti Couleurs is such a tough horse. He wouldn't be overly speedy, he'll just gallop all day long. His jumping is so quick and accurate - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

quotes.race: Josh Wyke Birthday Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haiti Couleurs had a nice novice season last term before he struck into his leg quite badly, so we had to take our time with him. He's slightly backward for his age but with racing he's just kept improving. I don't know where he'll end up really, I really fancied him for the National Hunt Chase, as he stays all day, but Sean says he's improving that much from his Aintree win to this that you wouldn't know if he would make the Brown Advisory. We'll be looking at both of those. We'll see what the handicapper does for his next race but he's a lovely prospect - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haiti Couleurs has done that fairly easily, jumping and travelling well. He's a nice horse who's very versatile on the ground. I'd hope he'd be a Welsh National type for next season. It's nice they've changed the National Hunt Chase to a handicap, so maybe we'll look at something like that in the spring. He's relatively inexperienced and we'll see how he progresses - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Superbly progressive novice last term, winning the NH Chase at Cheltenham (3m6f, good to soft) and following up in the Irish National (3m5f, soft to heavy); reappeared with a promising hurdles win in November but something seemed amiss from an early stage in Grade 1 at Haydock 16 days later; highly respected for what he did last season but needs to resume progress.

stable_tour.quote: He was brilliant at Cheltenham and his form is looking good - Moon D'Orange was 18 lengths behind him in fourth and won back there on Trials day. We've had a hard decision thinking about where to go but the National Hunt Chase is the plan. I think it'll be the perfect race for him because I think the further he goes the better he'll be. We probably won't run before the festival to try to keep the mark of 135, although we have the option of a spin over hurdles. He's a really exciting horse as he keeps improving and is such a good jumper. He goes out in front, jumps aggressively and other horses find it hard to keep up. We'll go down the handicap route and if he ends up better than that we've got all that to look forward to. He'd be the best chaser we've had in a while. 10-02-25

runners.comment: The step back up in trip has to be a big help; rain would be too but he keeps digging deep
runners.name: Mr Vango

quotes.race: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Vango loved the fences and he's quite bright because he worked out that you don't have to give them too much air. I couldn't be more delighted with him as he wants all of the trip and slightly softer ground, then you've got a big chance. He's such a big horse you can't make definite plans, it's very much where is the ground and how is the horse. The Welsh National is in my mind, it probably won't go heavy enough for the Classic Chase and he loves the ground at Haydock so the Grand National Trial is a possible. We wouldn't come back here on anything that isn't softer than good to soft because they'll go too fast for him - Sara Bradstock, trainer.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Midlands Grand National (Handicap Chase) (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We ran Mr Vango with slight trepidation on slightly quicker ground but they've done a great job at Uttoxeter. He's the biggest thoroughbred I've seen - my measuring stick honestly isn't long enough but he's at least 18 hands - and he is only getting to full strength now. The National is the dream next season. He would need ease in the ground but hopefully he has the right attributes for the race. The way he jumps and everything he does suggests it should suit him. I'd love to be able to run him there - Sara Bradstock, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Peter Marsh Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Vango is such a fantastic horse because he can't go any faster than that, but he just keeps going and jumps beautifully. He's a giant and he has to try very hard. We're hoping and praying that we get the wettest spring ever and we can run him in the National, but I'd only run him on heavy ground. He'll go to the Midlands National if I don't think the ground is going to be soft for the Grand National - Sara Bradstock, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange London National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Vango is a star for us. He can't go very fast but he never knows when to stop. He's a big gentle giant really and it's a case of the softer the better for him. If all goes well he'll go for the Welsh National now. I wouldn't run him on good going, but if he gets his ground it would be perfect - Sara Bradstock, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Devon National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: If all races were like that, then it would be nice. Sara [Bradstock] said to get into a nice rhythm because Mr Vango has jumped loads of fences at home and staying chases are his game. I felt I went a nice gallop and it wasn't anything major, but down the back straight I slowed it up and expected them to come and get me. I looked round but he just galloped and jumped them into the ground - Ben Jones, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Hat-trick last term culminated in 4m2f Midlands National (good to soft; goes well in the mud); usually front-runner but he had to chase the leader at Aintree (3m2f, soft) on reappearance and, although it looked very hard work, he plugged on to such good effect that he went down by just a short head; this step back up in trip has to be a big help; rain would be too but he's on a good mark (due to go up 3lb) and keeps digging deep.

runners.breeder: S A R L Genetique Obstacle
runners.comment: Won 2023 Welsh National by 34l on heavy and he has the same mark today; grim since though
runners.name: Nassalam

quotes.race: Coral Welsh Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (Run In Memory Of Kim Gingell) (GBB)
quotes.quote: It's always been in the back of my mind would he stay and he stayed very well. Nassalam was given a great ride (by Caoilin Quinn). He's committed him a long way out and the horse has kept going for him. He's got a lot of faith in the horse - Gary Moore, trainer, speaking on ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a brilliant performance. Nassalam ran a good race at Aintree and we stuck the blinkers on for this as I schooled him with them and he was just a completely different horse. He travelled extremely well, considering the ground, and he definitely stays, which we questioned. We went a good gallop early which helped him travel and he kept on the whole way to the line - Jockey Caoilin Quinn, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Land & Power Ltd. Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The Josh Gifford Cup) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That will be his last run this season. Nassalam had a very hard race at Ascot to win first time. If the owners agree, we'll give him some time off. He was carrying lumps of weight. He's quite a nice horse and he's only a baby. After a summer off we'll have a nice horse on our hands. He's jumping left handed all the time. We checked him out after his run the other day but we need to make sure nothing is amiss - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Committed To Safer Gambling Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (The Berkshire) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We had luck on our side for a change with Nassalam. He was hating the ground; it was too quick for him and we got lucky. Whether we'd have got the same result I'm not sure, but I'm glad we won. It's all about jumping and that's the thing he does very well, but we won't be running him again on that ground - it's good ground and he's a slow-ground horse. I think we have to be patient with the weather and his handicap mark shouldn't change too much. I told Jamie to take his time because I wasn't sure he'd get two and a half miles in a true-run race. I think he's enough pace on soft ground for two miles. I think he's very talented and his greatest asset is his jumping. I'd love to go for the Scilly Isles, but he's better going left-handed and he may go to Cheltenham for the Dipper before that - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Ascot Underwriting Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When we schooled Nassalam he was deadly. He jumped so well that with his 10lb allowance we had to go this route. I don't really want to go right-handed again. He gave so much ground away today but he's a brave horse because he did make a slight mistake at the first ditch and could have thrown the towel in - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: One More For The Moore's Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nassalam jumped brilliantly. I really, really like this horse. I know the opposition probably wasn't the best, but it's the way he does it. It's all very easy for him - Jamie Moore, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won 2023 Welsh National by 34l on heavy going and has the same mark today; however, failed to shine in the Gold Cup or Grand National later in that campaign, before pulled up on last four starts and the latest was despite a return to soft ground (from good); a huge turnaround is needed.

stable_tour.quote: He picked up a bit of an injury last winter but he came back in looking great and I was actually delighted with his run at Cheltenham on Saturday. He jumped and travelled nicely, but the ground was on the quick side for him and, when the tempo of the race quickened and he missed a fence, it just got away from him. That race will bring him on and on heavy ground is where he ups his game. He's likely to head towards the Welsh National, which he won in 2023, with another run to get his eye in before. 28-10-25

He won well at Ascot on his first run of the season, when getting up by a nose and that took a lot out of him. He romped home in a Grade 2 after that at Newbury but his two subsequent runs at Plumpton have been very disappointing. The first of them was little more than a donkey race and he was beaten by a mile. He is having a break now and hopefully will come back in a better frame of mind when he returns as he was not playing the game with jumping. I could not really understand why as one of his strengths has been how he handles a fence. He is still a young horse and if we can get him right he will more nice races. 02-02-22

runners.comment: 13l fourth in 2024 Welsh National; better than result suggests behind Mr Vango at Aintree
runners.name: Monbeg Genius

quotes.race: Lisa Mitten Turns 60 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nick Scholfield gave Monbeg Genius a lovely ride and it's great to see him get the job done. The National weights are out Tuesday, so we'll see what happens there, but hopefully he'll get a run. He's good with cut in the ground but ran a nice race at Newbury last season. We've been waiting for this day with him as the form at Cheltenham worked out well. It's great to see him get his head in front - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They were going so fast over the first couple Monbeg Genius didn't get into a rhythm until halfway down the back. He'll be better with a bit slower ground but he ran a blinder. He's in the Welsh National and will hopefully be in the Grand National too. He'll have a go at all of those and let's hope we have a bit of luck in one of them - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monbeg Genius ran a cracker and I could not be more pleased with him, except of course, if he had won. He could now go for the Scottish National next month at Ayr but that will be ground dependent as he has to have soft ground. If it was on the quick side at Ayr he would not run and we would put him away for this season with a tilt at the Aintree Grand National next spring at the forefront of our minds - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dictated pace for Uttoxeter win (3m, soft; 2lb higher today) in February in a less demanding race than he's often appeared in; managed 13l fourth in last season's Welsh National and front-running sixth in the bet365 at Sandown, while shaping better than result suggests behind Mr Vango at Aintree on reappearance (bad mistake four out); however, others have stronger win claims.

stable_tour.quote: The ground wasn't soft enough for him when he was pulled up in the Grand National, but he seemed to enjoy the fences. He's got an entry in the Coral Gold Cup, but his main aim is the Becher Chase in December. That's a race that could really suit him. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Breezed home 11l ahead at Ascot (3m5f, good) five weeks ago; 9lb rise may underestimate it
runners.name: Rock My Way

prev_owners.owner: Nick Case, Syd Hosie, John Romans

quotes.race: Windsor Horse Rangers Berkshire National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Welsh National has always been the plan. The handicapper will have his say after that but Rocky My Way jumped like a stag and bolted up. He's always been consistent but he's never done anything like that. It was a beautiful performance to watch and he actually put himself in the Grand National picture after that - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Classic Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Speaking to Tom (Scudamore) there we will probably step Rock My Way up in trip. He wanted a bit more of a lead and he got to the front early enough and he had a look around. We could have done with a bit more of a pace there. We had Way Out in the race as well and at home he runs all over this horse every day. I might need to put a longer gallop on! I thought if we can get him in the top three I won't look stupid for the entries we have made for the Ballymore and the Albert Bartlett and I'm glad about that. We will get him home and see where he is really - Syd Hosie, owner-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Only 2-11 over fences but he was second to Haiti Couleurs in the 3m6f NH Chase at Cheltenham (good to soft; has won on soft) in March and latest win was at Ascot (3m5f, good) five weeks ago, breezing home 11l in front after going on two out; raised 9lb after that revelatory performance but it may well underestimate him and he can scale even greater heights today.

stable_tour.quote: He's a smashing horse. He got tired on his first run of the campaign at Cheltenham, having travelled into it well. I might just look to drop him in grade for his next run to get his head in front, and then aim him at the Welsh National. I'd like to think there's a big one in him - he ran extremely well behind Haiti Couleurs in the National Hunt Chase, and in the Scottish National. 12-11-25

runners.breeder: E A L Haras De Montaigu Et Al
runners.comment: Second to Mr Vango in 4m2f Midlands National; needs to bounce back from poor show latest
runners.name: Tanganyika

quotes.race: JenningsBet Midlands Grand National (Handicap Chase) (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We always thought Tanganyika wanted a complete trip. He was outsprinted in his first couple of chase starts but has appreciated stepping up in distance. The credit must go to the winner as I thought coming up the home straight we had every chance of winning but we couldn't get past him - Venetia Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Switched to chasing last season, winning twice over 3m in February before tenacious second to Mr Vango over 4m2f in the Midlands National (good to soft; 6lb higher today); however, while he shaped okay and as if in need of the race on reappearance, his subsequent performance in the London National at Sandown three weeks ago was poor; needs to bounce back in a huge way.

stable_tour.quote: They didn't go quick enough early on for him when he was beaten at Windsor but a greater test of stamina suited him when he won at Market Rasen and Carlisle, and he showed that all he does is stay when he was second in the Midlands National. He's still a young horse and those staying chases should suit him well this season. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Well treated with a 4lb penalty (due to go up another 4lb) and should stay beyond 3m1f
runners.name: Uncle Bert

quotes.race: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a pretty good performance. Uncle Bert needs three miles and the soft ground helps. His jumping wasn't quite right last season but he's matured and it's definitely back now. He's got an entry in the Welsh National and we'll go away and have a think -  Nigel Twiston-Davies, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Cheltenham Non-Runner No Bet Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I've got a good strike-rate on Uncle Bert. He's done it nicely, over three miles he just keeps going. It's easy on him, bounce him out and he just keeps going. He was tough - James Turner, rider.

quotes.race: Dragonbet Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a lovely pot to win. Uncle Bert is a very consistent horse and never seems to let us down. We're very pleased for owners James and Jean Potter, who support us a lot and also bred him, as well as standing his sire Pether's Moon - Willy Twiston-Davies, trainer's assistant.

runners.spotlight: January's win over hurdles came over nearly 3m1f on soft; first three chase starts (last autumn) did not set the world alight but he returned to this sphere with a seriously dominant performance at Aintree (2m4f, soft) three weeks ago, making most; well treated with just a 4lb penalty (due to go up another 4lb) and should stay beyond 3m1f; can't be comfortably ruled out.

runners.comment: Goes from strength to strength; London National win at Sandown (near 3m5f) from Hung Jury
runners.name: Oconnell

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange London National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: O'Connell looked like the winner the whole way round. We've taken our time with him and he'll be a good one for veterans' chases next year, but our next target is the Welsh National - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Pallinc Lincolnshire National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I'm really pleased with O'Connell. It looked like a matter of when he'd put the race to bed and he was given a fantastic ride as well. He's very keen, but he's not particularly difficult to train. It took a few runs earlier on in his career for him to get to grips with jumping, but once he did it's been a real asset. He's a natural National horse. I don't think you could find a trip too far. Going up in the ratings will open a few more doors for him - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: O'Connell winged four out and three out. I took advantage of Jonjo [O'Neill jr, rider of runner-up]'s peck on landing [at the second-last] but he did battle on well - Gavin Sheehan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Held up; his win last Christmas came in the Lincolnshire National at Market Rasen, the middle leg of a hat-trick before his remote second in the 4m1f Eider at Newcastle; progress was resumed with London National win at Sandown (near 3m5f, good to soft; from Hung Jury) three weeks ago, well on top from approaching the final fence, and it's probably rash to think that a 4lb penalty will get to the bottom of him; should go well again.

runners.comment: Second to Jubilee Express in the Trial; well handicapped and well worth a go at this trip
runners.name: Collectors Item

quotes.race: Hinton Workspace Somerset National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We're delighted with Collectors Item. Maybe something like the Eider could suit him, but there are plenty of options. Kev gave him a lovely ride with plenty of positivity, which he responds quite well to. His jumping was better towards the end and he didn't put in any short ones - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Get Closer To The Action Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Collectors Item is not the biggest but he looks like an athlete and he will gallop all day long for you. The ground has been too dry for him and Jonjo said how he won over two miles he will never know as this is his trip. The ground was too quick for him at Cheltenham last time but he stayed on all the way up the hill. He really pinged the last and he's run right to the line. We will look at the EBF Final at Sandown with him now but he needs to qualify for that so we will look at a little qualifier in February - John Goodman, spokesman for the winning owners.

quotes.race: Chepstow Plant International Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Collectors Item did it nicely, he jumped and travelled well. I'd say he's a nice horse to look forward to. He ran well in a nice bumper at Newbury and it's worked out quite well so you never know. He took to it well and he'll be a nice chaser - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won last season's Somerset National at Wincanton (3m3f, good to soft) and shaped well for even longer trips when second to Mr Vango over nearly 3m5f at Sandown (soft); flopped in the 4m1f Eider in February but second to Jubilee Express in the Trial here three weeks ago was a return to top form; well handicapped (due to go up 3lb) and well worth a go at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming towards the London National at Sandown on December 6, a race he finished second to Mr Vango in last season. He's best with some cut in the ground and is well suited to a test of stamina. 18-11-25

runners.comment: 3rd off this mark in 2024 Scottish National on soft; satisfactory over hurdles last month
runners.name: Git Maker

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Git Maker is certainly going the right way. He's learning with experience and it was another lovely ride from Gavin, so fingers crossed he progresses. These novice handicap chases seem to suit him well, and I might give him an entry into the Midlands National and have half an eye on that. It's taken a bit of time for him to take to his jumping, but he's improving and getting the hang of it - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Git Maker is a lovely young horse and we've been crying out to go three-mile chasing with him. It was great that he won three hurdle races last season but he's a proper staying chaser. Like Park This One, he's not flashy but the harder the race the better he'll be-Jamie Snowden, trainer

quotes.race: Play Coral Racing Super Series For Free Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: We've always really liked Git Maker and he finished second to Up For Parol, whom we like, in a point-to-point. Staying chasing is where he's going and on this testing ground as he's got a high-enough knee action. We'll tip away gently this season and go chasing in the autumn. He definitely wants to go up in trip, but the fact he can do that over two miles is a bonus. He's a nice horse and we'll probably keep him to two miles on galloping tracks - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Third off this mark in 2024 Scottish National over 4m on soft; last season didn't really get off the ground but he made a satisfactory return to action over hurdles last month and although softening rather than drying ground would be preferred, his last chase win (November 2023) was on good to soft.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a star for us. He was second to the subsequent Gold Cup winner in the Kim Muir last year and then came third in the Scottish National, but it didn't happen for him this spring. He'll have one run over hurdles and then go for the Welsh National. He loves soft ground. 05-11-25

This lad is a proper staying chaser and I expect races such as the Midlands Grand National to be right up his street. He had a niggle in his back last season so his campaign was cut short and he didn't run after winning at Catterick in January, but he's 100 per cent now. He'll be ready for the depths of winter as he loves soft ground and he'll stay any trip you want. 28-09-23

runners.comment: There's plenty of the thorough stayer about him yet this is his first venture beyond 3m
runners.name: Deafening Silence

quotes.race: Betfair Beacons Winter Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I got Deafening Silence out of an English point-to-point so it is nice to fly a flag for the English pointers. I think he is a horse with a massive future. I said beforehand that he didn't have to win today to think he has a big future, but that obviously cements that. You would have to go up to three miles with him. Two and a half miles around here is three and more at most venues. We will just pick and choose - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Deafening Silence had a little bone injury after he ran at Chepstow last season but it meant we could give him more time. He's come back a better horse but we won't be in a rush with him, I think that's good form. We'll be encouraging him to progress as a chaser - it's possible he'll come back here this time next season for the £40,000 novice chase here - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has tendency to jump to his right, which was not too pronounced however when he made a satisfactory reappearance behind a runaway winner at Newcastle (good to soft; peak efforts on softer); there's plenty of the thorough stayer about him yet this is his first venture beyond 3m, so this lightly raced 8yo from top yard is unexposed and could prove capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: He won a Warwick novice chase in February but doesn't do a lot when he hits the front, so you've got to be sharp when you're on him. He'll head for the Rehearsal Chase at Newcastle on Fighting Fifth day, which looks a really good type of race for him. We've done loads of work with him and have just been waiting for the right ground, but he goes well fresh. 10-11-25

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Finished strongest when second in this (soft) last year; won the Trial here; 4lb penalty
runners.name: Jubilee Express

quotes.race: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. Jubilee Express looks fat most of the time as he's a big, burly horse, so we were delighted to get some runs into him for the big one this time. It's all systems go now. We didn't manage to get a prep run in before last year, but we have got two in this time. Please God, he comes out of this okay as he's the perfect horse for a Welsh Grand National. He races behind the bridle and is so laid-back - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Welsh Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jubilee Express is tailor-made for these races and hopefully he'll compete in them for the rest of the season. I'm over the moon - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: Greyland 25th Annivesary Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a brave performance. We were frustrated Jubilee Express got beat last time but he's proved he's well up to staying these trips. The Welsh National next season would be the dream but with his rating you could always go for an Eider off a low weight because he does stay well - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

runners.spotlight: Finished strongest when second in this race (soft) last year and returned to that form when seeing off Collectors Item to win the Trial here (extended 2m7f, good to soft) three weeks ago; has 4lb penalty (due to go up 2lb on top of that); another for whom drying ground does not look ideal but he's proved his mettle for this contest and should be in the shake-up again.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a bit of a slow-burner. Sam Twiston-Davies gave him an unbelievable ride when he won on his hurdles debut in 2022 and he's probably been badly handicapped ever since. He's gone chasing this season and stays very well. He's safe with his jumping and could be the type of horse for a regional national. There should be plenty more to come from him. 05-01-24

runners.comment: Strong challenge in this last year only to be stopped in his tracks by an error four out
runners.name: Where It All Began

quotes.race: QuinnBet Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Where It All Began jumped great and never missed a beat the whole way. It probably looked turning in that I was going to finish third, but stamina really kicked in when we straightened up. I'm delighted with him. He's not reliant on heavy ground, just a test of stamina is what he wants. He'd been running well and threatened to do something like that - Jack Kennedy, jockey

quotes.race: Velvet Cap Whiskey Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Where It All Began is a grand horse - a big galloper. He loved that ground and he'll probably get further. He left his hind legs at the last - got in tight and lost his balance a little bit - and I nearly came off him. I'm not sure if he took his eye off it or what happened but he did well in the end - Jack Kennedy, rider.

runners.spotlight: Wide-margin winner of Punchestown's 3m3f Grand National Trial on heavy ground in February 2024; let down by his jumping in big staying handicaps last season and no show in another big race last month, but he's 5lb lower than in this race 12 months ago when he launched a strong challenge from the back only to be stopped in his tracks by an error four out; trainer reported this season that "all roads lead back to Chepstow for him".

stable_tour.quote: All he does is stay and I thought he was very unlucky in the Welsh National last Christmas. He looked to be coming there with a great chance when he sprawled on landing at the fourth-last. All roads lead back to Chepstow for him. We have some unfinished business over there. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Made all under Callum Pritchard in Southern National at Fontwell (extended 3m3f); up 7lb
runners.name: Livin On Luco

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Southern National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with Livin On Luco; he's possibly a horse who goes better fresh. He won first time out last season. He jumped particularly well, so we're delighted with him - Philip Hobbs, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made all under Callum Pritchard in the Southern National at Fontwell (extended 3m3f, good to soft) on reappearance six weeks ago, clear from four out and holding on by a neck from a strong finisher; 7lb higher today but he's probably not fully exposed for major stamina test such as this.

stable_tour.quote: It was a great win at Fontwell first time out - he's possibly a better horse fresh and won first time out last season as well. I'm not sure where we'll go with him next. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Strong finish took care of a faltering leader at Newcastle (3m6f, good to soft); up 5lb
runners.name: Dom Of Mary

quotes.race: BetMGM Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dom Of Mary galloped all the way to the line. I know the other horse missed the last but I was getting going. He gave me a great ride, he jumped, he handled the ground and he gets the trip so it was ideal - Richie McLernon, jockey.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Sussex National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought eight months ago Dom Of Mary would win this and for once I'm right! He ran really well last time at Cheltenham where he got squeezed up and made a mistake. He wants a trip and we'll see how much the handicapper puts him up then we'll see where we go from there - David Bridgewater, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Follow Fairyhouse On Facebook & Instagram INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Dom Of Mary loves soft ground and is improving the whole time. I thought he would be sold after his point-to-point  but I'd say he will be now. He's a tough horse and a winter horse, he jumps really well - Sam Curling, trainer

runners.spotlight: Trained by David Bridgwater when winning the 2024 Sussex National at Plumpton and nearly winning it last season, both on soft; has made a solid start for James Owen this term, back in top form when his strong finish took care of a faltering leader on the run-in at Newcastle (3m6f, good to soft) last time; 5lb higher today and more competitive races such as this have not so far seen him to best effect, but he needs a second look.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to the yard and looks to be well handicapped on what he's showing at home. He'll be ready to run in the next few weeks and is a nice prospect for staying handicap chases. 24-10-25

runners.comment: Stuck to his task very well when second to O'Connell at Sandown (near 3m5f, good to soft)
runners.name: Hung Jury

quotes.race: Debenhams Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hung Jury stays forever and won the four-miler here in May. He has got form pointing in real soft ground so all the rain that came was perfect for him. I thought if he's in with a chance coming down the hill, he'll be hard to beat because I knew he'd stay so well - Martin Keighley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 5-21 in points and two big days under rules at Cheltenham, winning a 4m hunter chase (good) in May and 16-runner handicap over 3m1f (heavy) in November; never looked like winning the London National at Sandown (near 3m5f, good to soft) last time but stuck to his task very well to take second of six to O'Connell; whether he's fluent enough to win a big race such as this is a question but this trip should help his bid for further improvement.

stable_tour.quote: He's another nice old boy. He won at the May meeting at Cheltenham. For whatever reason, he took ages to warm up with his jumping last time and he was tailed off on the far side. He finished really well and was beaten only just over 12 lengths, so it was a much better run than it looked. He might run in the 3m1f amateur chase at the November meeting. Off the back of that Cheltenham win in May he should be winning again this season. He stays forever and those 4m chases should be right up his street. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Best when strong-finishing 2nd at Cheltenham (3m1f); tough task from 6lb out of handicap
runners.name: Beaufort Scale

quotes.race: Hurley Family Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beaufort Scale didn't put a foot wrong anywhere today, he jumped brilliant. We went a really good gallop and when I asked him he picked up, and did it well at the line - Sam Ewing, rider

runners.spotlight: 0-7 over fences and not the most consistent, best when strong-finishing second in an amateurs' handicap over 3m1f at Cheltenham in October; some late headway with cheekpieces enlisted for two warm Irish races since (3m6f latest) but he needs a big advance to take this from 6lb out of the handicap.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran a cracker at Cheltenham on Friday. I'd say that was close to being the best run of his life so, hopefully, he can pick up a nice pot in a staying handicap chase this season. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Disappointing these days; tailed off in the Trial and is a long way out of the handicap
runners.name: Pats Fancy
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over the extended 2m7f here in December 2021 but lightly raced since and generally very disappointing; fourth in first-time cheekpieces (kept since) in October was his best show for a long time but he was tailed off in the Trial and is a long way out of the handicap.

stable_tour.quote: I was really pleased with his last run. It was about having a prep run before Cheltenham and I didn't expect him to beat Bravemansgame. The ground would have been on the good side for him, and Newbury's a speedy track, but he travelled and jumped well, and has come out of the race brilliantly. He's also run well at Cheltenham a few times. 25-02-22

He got an entry in the Grand National as I've always thought he'd be the right type for it. It's just a shame we've been unable to keep him right in the last couple of seasons. We ran him in the National Hunt Chase three years ago when the ground was quick and since then he's had little tendon injuries. We've given him a lot of time and he seems a lot better for it. He's on a good mark but would need to win a chase before April to get in the National, although unfortunately he never travelled when pulled up in testing ground at Sandown last Saturday. 10-02-25

15:25.race_name: Coral "Pipped-At-The Post" Payouts Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: C&D winner; career-best form when second at Exeter this month; respected
runners.name: Donnacha

quotes.race: Text Fitzdares On 07492 882213 Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Donnacha is improving all the time and is a great jumper. There's a possibility of that novice handicap chase at Cheltenham, but we'll see what the handicapper does or there's Sandown [March 8], we could go two and a half miles there. Because it's a new race, no one's got a guide of where the bottom line is, but if we get into it on a realistic mark it would have to be looked at for sure - Nigel Hawke, trainer.

quotes.race: Michael Costello Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: His form at Cheltenham is solid and it was good to get his head in front. Donnacha probably wasn't in love with that soft ground but he's a work in progress and improving all the time. He's in the Betfair Hurdle and we'll see how he comes out of this. The County Hurdle or Martin Pipe at Cheltenham could be other options - Nigel Hawke, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two wins, the latter over C&D (soft), and posted career-best form when clear second at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) this month; another 4lb higher today but may yet have a bigger run in him; respected.

runners.comment: Took very well to fences last season (three wins) but comes here with a point to prove
runners.name: Western General

quotes.race: BetMGM Who Wants A Nine-Darter Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Western General was very good. As soon as I got to the leader he pricked his ears, went on and won very nicely. This race was perfect as he's shown form on heavy ground and two miles is right for him. Hopefully we can find another nice race - Freddie Gingell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made excellent progress over fences last season, winning three times (1m7f-2m), but ended that campaign with a poor C&D run and failed to build on a satisfactory reappearance when well beaten four weeks ago; now has a point to prove.

stable_tour.quote: The handicapper was a bit harsh on him last season after two good wins. He looked as if he wanted two and a half miles on his comeback at Ascot, but he didn't look totally out of his depth off 137. We'll go up in trip and he'll improve for his first run; we might just drop him in grade slightly. 12-11-25

He stopped very quickly at Exeter last time, but had a little bleed and is much better than that. He hasn't shown his best form for whatever reason this season, but he's very well handicapped. Once he gets a bit of sun on is back, he should have a strong second half of the campaign. 18-01-24

runners.breeder: Margaret Treacy On His Own Stables
runners.comment: Bounced back to form with 2m7f win here on recent seasonal/stable debut
runners.name: Toss Of A Coin

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Toss Of A Coin might have one more run before the end of the season, but it would have to be somewhere on testing ground. He's got two penalties, so I'm not sure where that run would be, but he might one for that Listed, three-mile novice hurdle at Perth in April, and then he'll be chasing next season -  Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Kenn Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Toss Of A Coin ground his race out well and he's certainly a smart horse. I love the way he went through the race, he travelled well and he stayed well. Paul thinks there's a lot of improvement in him and we have two smart horses for the future - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who was pulled up on final two starts for Paul Nicholls but bounced back to form with 2m7f win here (good to soft; first run after wind op) for new stable three weeks ago; not sure to be ideally suited by this drop back in trip but further progress is possible.

stable_tour.quote: We always planned a low-key novice hurdle season for him, when his suitability for testing conditions saw him win twice from three starts. He looks the part for chasing and, being a half-brother to Becher Chase winner Highland Lodge, he should stay three miles. He could debut at Exeter or Newbury this week. 04-11-24

runners.comment: Well held on latest outing but was in career-best form beforehand; player if back on song
runners.name: Royal Jewel
runners.spotlight: Returned from break in career-best form this autumn, winning at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good to soft) before good second of four at Ascot (2m5f, good); reportedly ran flat when well behind Donnacha on latest outing but has a fighting chance if back on song.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with his win at Newton Abbot in October and he'll be back out in a handicap chase at Ascot on Friday. 20-11-25

He won his maiden hurdle at Exeter last December and then finished second in his next two runs, once in a novice and then in a handicap. He's been off since January but is now ready to run and is entered up at Newton Abbot on Wednesday. He is probably at his best on very soft ground. 30-10-24

runners.comment: C&D winner last month and ran another big race from the front when second here 21 days ago
runners.name: Ben Solo

quotes.race: Century Racing Club Free Horse Giveaway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Ben Solo is a big baby and he's a really nice horse - he'll be a proper chaser next season. He'd been working well at home and he has a really good attitude. I thought two miles might have been short enough for him but he got away with it at a track like this. Ben [Jones] said he was green as grass so he should improve a lot from this - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key seasonal/chase debut when making all over C&D last month and ran another big race from the front when second over C&D (also good to soft) three weeks ago; still lightly raced over fences; high on the list.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice horse and will be very exciting when we go over fences next season because he's a brilliant jumper. We'll look to win a novice hurdle under a penalty and then possibly a nice handicap hurdle later in the season. 10-02-25

runners.comment: Has a very good record when fresh and returns from latest layoff on a tempting mark
runners.name: Galop De Chasse
runners.spotlight: Failed to win and became inconsistent last season but has a very good record when fresh and returns from latest layoff on a tempting mark; will be suited by today's trip/ground; must be considered.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Newbury last November but picked up a nasty wound which took a long time to heal. The horse he beat at Newbury, Kandoo Kid, franked the form and is rated 145 now. He's in good shape, should be versatile from two to two and a half miles and will be running quite soon. 23-10-24

runners.comment: Course winner last season; needs to better recent efforts but worth a market check
runners.name: Dr T J Eckleburg
