runners.spotlight: Did not emerge from the rear division in three Cheltenham handicaps this autumn and needs to up his game today but he is now 2lb lower than when battling well for narrow win here (2m, soft; front pair clear) in February; worth a glance in the betting.

stable_tour.quote: A nice staying type who should make up into a lovely middle-distance horse. He went close going up in trip at Ripon despite not handling the track. He could improve throughout the year. 10-05-21

We bought him for a bit of sport during the summer and he's taken to fences well. He was possibly gifted the race by the runner-up at Worcester in September but it was a good performance. He'll be great fun throughout the winter. He's quietly going the right way and we're very happy with him. 02-11-23

We did have him in at the five-day entry stage at Haydock last Saturday but we didn't declare him and we'll wait for Chepstow on Friday. He's just a very consistent, genuine fellow - he's won his nice pot now at Haydock last time out, and we'll just continue to run him in those 2m, and maybe 2m4f, races throughout the season. Hopefully he'll continue to give a good account of himself. 24-12-24

runners.comment: 0-9 over fences but posted good effort when third over C&D three weeks ago
runners.name: Lunar Discovery

quotes.race: Seasons Greetings From Hexham Bookmakers Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Lunar Discovery didn't jump well the other day, but she jumped cleaner this time. She showed a blistering turn of foot when she won her first bumper. She obviously wants ease in the ground - Jimmy Moffatt, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 0-9 over fences but has posted some good efforts for new stable since September, most recently when third (6l behind Ben Solo) over C&D (good to soft) three weeks ago; probably won't be far away.

stable_tour.quote: She's the best mare I've trained. She's a half-sister to Bingoo and we won two bumpers with her last season. She just failed to shoulder a double penalty at Carlisle last week, but she's come out of it bucking and kicking. She was unlucky not to win there as the winner leaned on her up the straight, but afterwards her Racing Post Rating went up another 3lb from her Listed second at Haydock in December. We're looking for soft ground but her target could be the Mares' Novices' Hurdle at Cheltenham and we might enter her in one of the handicaps as well. We'd ride her prominently and the stiff track at Cheltenham will suit her. If she lines up there, I'm sure she'll acquit herself really well. She's a big, powerful mare and I'm so looking forward to her going chasing. She's going to stay three miles no problem - she could be anything over fences. 14-02-24

12:45.race_name: "Get Your Ladbrokes Free Kempton Bet" "Introductory" Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Easy winner of sole race in France in September; has joined top yard; big chance
runners.name: Maestro Conti
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of sole race in France (2m1f, heavy) in September, leading three out; has joined a top stable and looks likely to go well despite conceding weight all round.

runners.comment: 0-6 on Flat but some aptitude for hurdling when second at Fontwell; may improve
runners.name: Brave Guest
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all starts on Flat for Jack Channon, but showed an aptitude for hurdling when 5l second of seven on hurdling debut at Fontwell (2m1f, heavy; 80-1) three weeks ago; may improve but the form of that race is modest.

runners.comment: Tailed off on stable debut but best Flat form suggests he could make an impact here
runners.name: Chartwell Jock
runners.spotlight: 9.4f AW winner on Flat for Andrew Balding but was tailed off at Kempton on debut for current yard five weeks ago; that run needs to be forgiven but he'll certainly be a player here if taking well to hurdling.

runners.comment: 0-3 on Flat; new yard has modest strike-rate; Isabelle Ryder cannot claim usual allowance
runners.name: Provision
runners.spotlight: Ran three times on the Flat for Paul Midgley, finishing third at Newcastle (1m2f) in October before being sold for 10,500gns; new yard operates at a modest strike-rate and Isabelle Ryder cannot claim her usual allowance.

runners.comment: No great shakes on Flat and finished last of three finishers on hurdling debut
runners.name: Tenadaay
runners.spotlight: Five-race Flat maiden, beaten 43l at Epsom when last seen in that sphere; finished last of three finishers (and behind Brave Guest) in weak race at Fontwell on hurdling debut; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Best Flat effort when third in October; one of two runners for the Moore stable
runners.name: Tetsworth

prev_owners.owner: Blue Candi Lab Ltd & Julie Camacho

runners.spotlight: Trained by Julie Camacho on Flat, running best race when third at Redcar (1m2f, good to soft; led for long way in first-time visor) in October; sold for 16,000gns later that month; new yard (which won this race in 2018 and has had placed finishers in the last two years) runs two.

runners.comment: Useful Flat winner at up to 1m6f for Sir Mark Prescott; a likely type for juvenile hurdles
runners.name: Whatsgoingonmarvin
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat winner at up to 1m6f for Sir Mark Prescott; new connections acquired him for 115,000gns in October; a likely type for juvenile hurdles.

runners.comment: Fair 1m2f Flat winner; jumped left on C&D hurdling debut but still finished second; chance
runners.name: Zarakerjack
runners.spotlight: Fair 1m2f winner on Flat for Tom Clover and showed promise when runner-up over C&D (good ground; unraced on softer) on hurdle/stable debut last month; made mistakes and tended to jump left that day and will improve if his hurdling becomes more fluent.

runners.comment: Beaten out of sight at triple-figure odds in two Flat races; difficult to fancy
runners.name: Miss Raffles
runners.spotlight: Beaten out of sight at triple-figure odds in two Flat races; difficult to fancy.

13:20.race_name: "Join Ladbrokes Bet £5 Get £30" Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Had a slow 2025 but better latest and on the same mark as when winning this last year
runners.name: Della Casa Lunga

quotes.race: George Rickards Birthday Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Della Casa Lunga is a nice horse and likes Ludlow, she's got better as the season's gone on. We know how best to ride her now so hopefully she'll continue to go on from this - Clive Boultbee-Brooks, owner-trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Della Casa Lunga deserved that, she had been running well. She had a few hard races in bumpers and is probably only coming to herself. We will aim for the final at Punchestown and give her a run before then - Sam Curling, trainer

runners.spotlight: Below best in 2025 but she made all in this race (good to soft; from Holly Hartingo) last year off today's mark and things started to look up when she was a persevering third of six in a Listed race here (2m5f, good) in November; regular cheekpieces return and she's primed to go well.

runners.comment: Two 2m4f hurdle wins in the spring; well held over fences latest; first run over this far
runners.name: Greyval

quotes.race: Catesby Estates Mares' Challenger Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Greyval has been great. She was a good juvenile and then we lost her a bit last season. She's very fast at home but isn't the quickest on the track. I've forgiven Johnny for the two times she's been beaten at Stratford! - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Greyval was superb value at 36,000euros and I loved the stamp of her. She wasn't going to be in the Triumph but we popped her in this week, but I doubt she'll go for that. I don't do social runners but we can dream. She's in the Mares' Novice and I half prefer that, but there's a lot of water and bridges - Nick Brown, racing manager of the owners Oakley Partnership.

runners.spotlight: Better than ever in the spring when winning at Chepstow and Cheltenham (both around 2m4f on good); two inconclusive chase runs of late, finishing well adrift at Cheltenham 14 days ago, and even if making a swift readjustment to hurdles, she has stamina to prove on first attempt over this far.

runners.comment: Won two 3m1f hurdles in May; good ground suits but had a poor chase experience last week
runners.name: Musique De Fee

quotes.race: Molson Coors Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Musique De Fee is so tough. I never run horses that quickly again and she looked really green on Saturday and like she was not having it, but she came out of it lively. She doesn't know how to lose, but I thought turning in we'd be second. Josh [Bryan, jockey] was tactically brilliant, and she stuck her neck out and had her head down when it really mattered - Georgina Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: DragonBet: Oncourse And Online Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I must say a big thank-you to Sean Bowen, who rode Musique De Fee six days ago. I rang him this morning and all he said was to kick on with her and he was right - Finn Lambert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Two 3m1f hurdle wins (good and good to soft) in May and today's surface will be just right; soft going counted against her over fences at Cheltenham last week when she was pulled up but she needs to be tough to recover quickly from that; first-time visor replaces cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Has won at 3m and 3m2f; suited by good ground; in form but more exposed than some
runners.name: Porter In The Park
runners.spotlight: Has won at up to 3m2f; in good form and she was slightly impeded before the last before finishing a creditable third at Ascot (2m7f, good) last month under Cameron Johnstone-Baker; has a similar chance to the runner-up Star Walking on these terms but that one is less exposed.

stable_tour.quote: She scoped with mucus after running at Stratford last week, but Adam Wedge said she gave him a nice feel and he couldn't believe she stopped. She was treated for ataxia after the race, but I imagine that's because she was full of mucus and couldn't get any oxygen in. 02-11-22

She's one of those mares who wins when she comes down the handicap and struggles when she goes back up. She'll head back to Wincanton for the race in which she was second at a big price last year. I wouldn't rule out having another go over fences with her, although it scared her when she tried it before. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Close 5th in the 2023 running, then good 2nd last year; shouldn't be far away
runners.name: Holly Hartingo
runners.spotlight: Has run in the last two runnings, finishing a close fifth in 2023 and chasing home Della Casa Lunga last year when out of the weights; has more to do with that one on these terms but she ran well here last month on her first start since and shouldn't be far away.

stable_tour.quote: She's been rejuvenated and has really enjoyed going back over hurdles after going chasing last season. She's bounced back to form and ran really well at Kempton over Christmas in a nice race. She'll have a spring campaign and we'll look at the mares' races for her. 19-02-25

runners.comment: Mixed results since novice win last December; had wind op and good 2nd over 2m7f latest
runners.name: Star Walking
runners.spotlight: Has had some ups and downs since winning a Wincanton novice (2m5f, soft) last December but wind surgery may have helped as she returned from a break with an excellent second to an improver at Ascot (2m7f, good) in November; raised 4lb but looks capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: Another very smart mare. We were delighted to get her as we didn't think we'd be able to afford her at the sales in December. She won first time out at Fakenham in April, despite getting knocked sideways and the track being too sharp for her. She doesn't show much at home and you'll only see how good she is in the last half-mile of a race. She probably wouldn't have the size and scope of Metkayina or Jasmine Bliss, but she's a warrior. She'll start out next month and we don't know how good she can be, so the dream is alive. 24-10-24

runners.comment: Smart Listed Flat form in 2024; took well to hurdles; potential for better for new yard
runners.name: Miss Cynthia
runners.spotlight: Smart Flat stayer for Sir Mark Prescott, including in good-ground Listed races; promising hurdler for another yard, winning at Market Rasen (2m4f) then ran well on unfavourable terms in 3m Listed race; bled from the nose when pulled up in April; has had wind surgery since; now tongue tied for new yard that has won two of the last five runnings; can improve.

stable_tour.quote: She has some nice form to her name and looks like a staying hurdler for this season, hopefully competing with the better mares. We'll get her started in a handicap and hopefully she'll progress nicely. 10-11-25

She's a quality filly off the Flat and has never been out of the first two for us. She was a little bit sketchy with her jumping on her last run at Doncaster. The quicker pace on better ground just caught her out in that regard and she wasn't as fluent as I'd have liked. However, once the pace had settled turning in, she made up ground very nicely to finish second. I'm not sure where she'll go next but it might be Cheltenham for the April meeting. 19-03-25

runners.comment: Runner-up in the 2023 running; well beaten on reappearance and now goes in cheekpieces
runners.name: Gaye Legacy
runners.owner: Chase The Dream And Mrs R F Knipe
runners.spotlight: Good staying mare who finished runner-up in the 2023 running but she was well beaten on her reappearance and now goes in first-time cheekpieces; prefers soft ground and others make greater appeal.

runners.comment: Back to best when 2nd over 2m5f latest; up 3lb; needs more for new trip in a better race
runners.name: Audacious Annie
runners.spotlight: Yard has an excellent strike-rate this season and this one was back to her best when runner-up at Warwick (2m5f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) in November; raised 3lb and needs to push on for the new trip if she's to cope with this stiffer opposition.

stable_tour.quote: She's a half-sister to You Wear It Well, who was a Cheltenham Festival winner for us. She won a bumper and two novice hurdles but has been a bit disappointing in a couple of handicap hurdles. We haven't quite got her right, but there should be more to come from her - she goes well enough at home to think she can win races. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Won 2m hurdle in February; still going well when fell 2 out over C&D latest; of interest
runners.name: Ive Madeupmymind

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Herring Queen Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I should have won a bumper on I've Madeupmymind before this but she's a little terrier - Ben Jones, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Made all for Bangor maiden win (2m, heavy) in February; having only her second run since when taking a heavy fall two out over C&D last month but she hadn't been asked for an effort and remains of interest if her confidence hasn't been affected.

stable_tour.quote: Between myself and Ben Jones we've messed it up a few times with this filly, but she's going to make into a lovely novice hurdler this season. She has the ability to win two novices and then we'll see where we are. 21-11-24

13:55.race_name: Ladbrokes Wayward Lad Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won first 2 chase starts; blip in a G1 last time was forgivable; this C&D promises to suit
runners.name: Alnilam
runners.owner: Mrs A Williams And A Badri

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A Williams And Mr A Badri

quotes.race: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We might go straight to Sandown and I think Alnilam will be a better horse on slower ground. If you get into a good rhythm around there it can be hard to peg them back. He's a tough horse and he was brilliant there - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Daily Free Bet 'Chasing Excellence' Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Alnilam jumped well. I wasn't sure he'd take to it as well as he did, which is great. He won a big handicap last season and was second in the Morebattle, so he's not a slouch, and hopefully he can go on to bigger and better things over fences. I'm not sure where we'll go next. There are a few options at Sandown, Aintree or the Grade 2 [Arkle Trial] at Cheltenham. We want him to get plenty of experience and hopefully he might make up into a Graded novice chaser - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Left behind last season's useful form in novice hurdles when winning first two chase starts at Uttoxeter (2m, good) and Cheltenham (2m, good to soft) in October; made a chance-ending error five out in Grade 1 last time, so better judged on previous efforts and this C&D promises to suit.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good on his chase debut at Uttoxeter and we have declared him to run at the Showcase meeting on Friday. He was a good handicap hurdler and we'll be looking at all those good novice chases over two miles throughout the season. Hopefully he'll carry on improving. 23-10-25

runners.comment: Yet to match smart hurdles form over fences, but was at least more convincing last time
runners.name: Hansard

quotes.race: Bet In Race With Coral Intermediate Handicap Hurdle (Reg' As The Gerry Feilden) (Premier H'cap)(GBB)
quotes.quote: Hansard ran a very good race at Aintree last season, but is bigger and stronger now. I was slightly disappointed with him at Wincanton last time but he might have been beaten by a better horse, he was spot on today and looked sharper in the paddock, while his work had improved at home. He's a nice horse. There was pace in the race, which is what he wants as he's a strong traveller. He's in a valuable handicap hurdle at Ascot just before Christmas and he does all the right things so you'd think he could be a Graded horse, but he needs to improve again - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Looking Forward To HWPAs Tomorrow Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked a seriously hot race. When Hansard first went to Gary Moore's, the reports back were solid all the way through and I think we've got a very smart horse on our hands. Jamie Moore has done all the work schooling on him and has loved him from day one. He did so much wrong today and there's so much more to come from him. We might go to Kempton with him over Christmas [for a 2m novice Hurdle] and he's a very impressive four-year-old - David Crosse, owner's representative.

runners.spotlight: Smart hurdles form included a creditable fourth in a handicap on this card last year off a BHA mark of 141; chase form is not up to that level yet in two runs, although there was more to like about his smooth win at cramped odds in a small field at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) 14 days ago.

stable_tour.quote: Third in the Kingwell Hurdle behind Golden Ace and Burdett Road last season, I almost wish we'd run him in the Champion Hurdle considering those two finished first and second at Cheltenham. He's a good, solid horse who might take in a novice chase this season. Whether it's two-mile hurdling or novice chasing, the key to him is soft ground 28-10-25

He's been a great horse for us and I still think we can win another good handicap with him. Proper soft ground and two miles is his bag. He won the Gerry Feilden for us a couple of years ago and has been super, so I'm hoping we can land a nice race along the way this season. We may try jumping a fence with him but, with the way the weather's looking, we might not see him out for another month or so. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Impressive winner of chase debut and ran into Lulamba in Grade 1 last time; big player
runners.name: Lump Sum

quotes.race: Kalahari King 'Chasing Excellence' Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely over the moon, but it's more of a relief if I'm honest. It's a bit daunting when they go novice chasing, so I'm delighted Lump Sum is back in one piece. The boss [Dai Walters] puts in so much, so it's exciting to know we've a very good horse and a nice novice chaser on our hands. The second is obviously no mug and they'll come on for the run, but we certainly haven't got him as tuned as we did this time last year, so fingers crossed there's more to come. I was just waiting to see how today went before we start getting carried away. There's some very good novice chasers coming out of other yards, so we'll see how he comes out of this and then sit down and have a look at the book - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was absolutely thrilled and Lump Sum is such a cool horse. To go and run such a race under top weight was not easy so I'm really happy. We gave the winner 21lb which puts his performance into perspective - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsor Of The Welsh Champion Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He just has a bit of class, doesn't he? I must admit I don't know Lump Sum very well but I think maybe the next day I ride him it'll be slightly different, but it's worked today and we've got the job done - Dylan Johnston, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Dovecote Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lump Sum is a smashing horse. We left him out of the novice hurdles at Cheltenham, although he's in some handicaps and could still be well handicapped, but we'll see about going there and it's a decision for Mr Walters and me to have a chat about in the next few weeks. There's Aintree after that, but there's no pressure from Mr Walters on any of the young horses - Sam Thomas, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well-held second in the Fighting Fifth and William Hill Hurdle last season, and has quickly proved even better over fences; thumped the well-regarded Jax Junior at Uttoxeter in October (2m, good to soft) and then good third, beaten less than 10l by superb Lulamba, in Grade 1 Henry VIII at Sandown 21 days ago; must be taken seriously with his sights lowered a little.

stable_tour.quote: He settled nicely when making a winning chase debut at Uttoxeter and that has opened up a few more doors. He was foot-sure and the way he quickened up in the straight was very impressive. We'd been thinking of the Henry VIII, but we've got a bit of a dilemma with Steel Ally also a possible for that race and I wouldn't have any hesitation stepping this lad up another half a mile if need be. 23-11-25

He's a little star. He's not overly big but is by a brilliant stallion in Authorized. He jumps nicely and is a strong traveller. He's done everything we've asked of him this season and seems to handle the soft ground really well. He has a handicap mark now so we'll try to find a suitable opportunity to secure his hat-trick in the next couple of weeks. He's a horse we might be able to aim at the Welsh Champion Hurdle next season if he's on the right sort of mark. 05-01-24

runners.comment: Comfortable winner on chase debut last time, which was just his second run for Dan Skelton
runners.name: Mirabad

quotes.race: JCB Hydrogen "Chasing Excellence" Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mirabad jumped particularly well. It was his first time over fences and I wanted to pop him out and get into a nice rhythm. He can race quite keenly but the hood helped, and the fences backed him off a bit, so it was a good performance. On the rising ground he just relaxed on me. Joyeuse came by me but he's tough and he picked up again - Tristran Durrell, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Fairly useful hurdler for Richard Newland and Jamie Insole last season; went off 7-2 for Greatwood Hurdle on debut for this yard, finishing eighth, then made a winning debut over fences at Exeter (extended 2m1f, good to soft) 22 days ago; bare form of that was weak but he has clear untapped potential.

stable_tour.quote: A new horse to us, he'll go to the Greatwood Hurdle at Cheltenham, where he has some decent course form. He seems to go well fresh so we've saved him up for that nice prize. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Handicap wins over fences have both been franked; should be competitive in graded races
runners.name: Mambonumberfive

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The Fulke Walwyn Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's another step in the right direction for Mambonumberfive and as soon as we crossed the line at Aintree this was where we were coming. He wants slower ground or further and on soft ground this horse will be another gear better and when we do go up in trip he will find everything you want ? he's winning races he shouldn't and he's not the fastest horse in the world, just a proper galloper and not a natural two-miler. There's no point stepping him up until you need to and if he is good enough to win in this company and at this trip, then we'll leave him there as he is learning all the time. His jumping was very good, he jumps them like hurdles and he's so fast and accurate whereas at Aintree he was a bit bold and a bit big at a few. It's exciting. We won't be going into graded company until we need to and at the moment it is all going very well and I'm very happy - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mambonumberfive is a big, gross horse and you wouldn't ever get enough work into him at home. Ben [Jones] said ideally you'd want soft/heavy ground over two miles and he might be better over two and a half in time. He's got a lot of potential and ability and his brain is much better this year. He jumps very well and being a four-year-old with that allowance, it's quite an attractive proposition. There's a novice handicap at Newbury in a couple of weeks and we'll see what his mark does. There's a possible tilt at the Noel at Ascot and if he was really decent, you might go back to Kempton for the Wayward Lad - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mambonumberfive was obviously a nice horse in France and he always looked like a great big individual that was going to take time. He is 17 hands and I would say he is chaser two years down the line so this is a bit of a bonus. He didn't jump very well over the first three or four. Going down the back straight, the penny dropped with him and he then jumped and travelled well. He has seen the trip out well. He is a young horse and Ben [Jones, jockey] wanted to give him plenty of time. He is a brute of a horse and maybe wasn't tuned up for Cheltenham but that run has put him perfect for today and going forward we can look at Cheltenham now I guess. He is an exciting prospect - Ben Pauling, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a substandard Adonis Juvenile Hurdle here in February; much better over fences already, winning handicaps at about this trip at Aintree and Newbury in November with more in hand than the bare margins imply; runners-up from those two races were first and second in a Newbury handicap this month and this horse should be up to mixing it in graded company.

stable_tour.quote: He's massive, so for him to do what he did last season was quite impressive. I'm very sweet on him as a chaser and he could be very dangerous with a four-year-old allowance. There are some options coming up for him that will tell us what level he'll end up at. We'll start at two miles and I'd really like to get him out as he'll need the run. 07-11-25

14:30.race_name: Ladbrokes Desert Orchid Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Limited Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant Et Al
runners.comment: A reformed character these days and improved again since second to Thistle Ask at Exeter
runners.name: Saint Segal

quotes.race: BetMGM Haldon Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Limited Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What an amazing horse I have. Saint Segal has never been that fast in his life before. That was some pace. I think at the age of seven, coming into his fifth season, that he is still improving. That was a phenomenal performance and a career best, how can you be miserable about that. I think the Peterborough Chase is the obvious race for him - Jane Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Tip Top Clean Convenience Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Saint Segal has had a lot of racing this season and, for all his misdemeanours, he's one of the most consistent horses you'll find. He was impressive, and that's probably a career-best performance - Jane Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Home Of The Lucky Dip Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Saint Segal owed us. He's behaving himself better but he's only six and needed to learn how to settle over the two-and-a-half-mile pace. He's switched off and just goes on so that's great - Jane Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Former underachiever transformed by more positive tactics in the last 12 months, his only defeat this season when second to Thistle Ask in Haldon Gold Cup last month; up 7lb since another all-the-way win in valuable race at Kelso (2m1f, soft) 20 days ago but still likely to be a major player.

stable_tour.quote: He's back to 100 per cent after his final-fence fall at Ascot in November, which was such a shame as he was length in front at the time. We wanted to go to the Desert Orchid at Kempton over Christmas but he just wasn't quite ready in time. He's fine now though and the plan is to go for the two-mile handicap chase at Lingfield's Winter Million fixture on January 21. We've given him plenty of time since Ascot and the Lingfield race stands out for him. Soft or heavy ground would definitely be in his favour. 11-01-24

runners.comment: Mark has come down a long way but promise has been thin on the ground of late
runners.name: Boothill

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Boothill has won the handicap at Ascot for the last two years but we can safely say we won't be going there now. He's run a great race and a wonderful horse has beaten us. He deserves to take his chance in all the good two-mile chases and we'll look forward to the rematch - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Byrne Group Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that reappearance. It's a great start to the season and sets us up nicely, but it gives us a headache. Boothill is in the Hurst Park back here later this month but the handicapper is going to have his say no doubt. It's either run there or step up into graded company. It's a nice position to have - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Wayward Lad Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'd say Boothill is growing with confidence with each run and he's showing battling qualities now which he probably never showed in the past. You'd like to have another crack at Jonbon but are you going to beat him? Probably not but we'll give it another go I'd say - Johnny Burke, rider.

quotes.race: Jim Barry Wines Hurst Park Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought of Boothill as a chaser and had a lot of belief in him. We've been patient and I'm not sure what we'll do, but there's no novice chase worth that amount of money. It's a nice dilemma and, after he won at Newton Abbot last time, there was only one race I wanted to run him in. He's by Presenting, so I wasn't worried about the ground - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Boothill is a lovely big horse and has been ready to go for the last few weeks. We just didn't want to start him off in knee-deep ground. He's pleased us at home so it's great to see him do that. He's a chaser and one to look forward to. Maybe we'll think about Aintree or Punchestown. We'll dissect this and then decide, but I wouldn't have thought we'd go to Cheltenham - Harry Fry, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won the Wayward Lad on this card in 2022 but a faller in last two runnings of this race; has not shown his best since chasing Jonbon home in last year's Shloer at Cheltenham and, while this is an easier task off a reduced mark, promise has been thin on the ground of late.

stable_tour.quote: He's fine after his fall at Newbury. His best form is definitely on better ground and ordinarily we wouldn't have run him on heavy, but it was our last opportunity to run before Cheltenham. That ground finds his wind out and he ended up taking a tired fall two out. He's probably a few pounds below the best two-mile chasers but the alternative is to run him off top weight in a Grand Annual and we're working towards the Champion Chase.  20-02-24

It was great to see him deliver on the potential we always thought he had last season. We wanted to go to Aintree but he had a hold-up, so he's had a good break and, although he's eight, he's still quite lightly raced and we hope he can improve. He's a two-miler who likes a good strong gallop, so having won at Ascot and Kempton the obvious races are the Ascot Handicap Chase in November and Desert Orchid Chase on December 27. 04-10-23

runners.comment: Hugely progressive chaser; beat Saint Segal 7l in a G2 last time and up another 14lb now
runners.name: Thistle Ask

quotes.race: BetMGM Haldon Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Limited Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This is down to Dan [Skelton, trainer]. I go out there to do a job but it takes a set of balls to do what he has done. Thistle Ask is a horse that likes to gallop, jump and run. He is made for me, he's a bit numb, and just keeps going. We had a light weight and plenty of experience with some runs under our belt. We just wanted to make use of that. The way Dan has placed this horse - it takes some bravery to do what he has done - Harry Skelton, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Hugely progressive in 2025, winning the first leg of a four-timer in February off a BHA mark of just 108; has won valuable good-ground handicaps at Wetherby (extended 2m3f) and Exeter (extended 2m1f; beat Saint Segal 7l) on his last two starts and, while he is up another stone, he is a contender once more as he goes for five in a row under conditions that should suit.

stable_tour.quote: Three weeks ago I didn't think I'd even be running him in a Haldon Gold Cup but he's thrived on his racing and what he did on the day was quite remarkable. He received two good rides from Tristan Durrell when winning at Kelso and Wetherby and another from Harry [Skelton] at Exeter, where he took our breath away. We'll give him a little freshen up now, he'll go to Kempton over Christmas for the Desert Orchid and there should be more good days to come. He's a real credit to the whole team. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Tends to peak in the spring and recent runs suggest that is set to happen again in 2026
runners.name: Sans Bruit

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Sussex Champion Chase Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I need to thank Harry [Cobden, jockey] because he's a big part of the team and he stood with Matterhorn because I knew we wanted to claim off Sans Bruit after he went up 9lb for Aintree. I was a bit worried it came too soon after Aintree but his owner Andy Peake was the one who keen to run today, and Jay took that handy 5lb off and rode him very well considering it's his first time on board. He was given a beautiful lead by Westport Cove today and he's only little, but he's a smashing jumper - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sans Bruit ran very well on good ground earlier in the season, but in the winter he hated that heavy ground. When he ran at Windsor, Cobby [Harry Cobden, jockey] said, 'we'll just get him right in the spring and he'll take all the beating in this race', and that's what we've done. He managed to run off with Freddie [Gingell] the other day at Chepstow, but the biggest thing is that he looks amazing now, this is his time of year, he's come in his coat in his sunshine, he's relaxed and we had him really, really right - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Last time was a sign of Sans Bruit coming to himself and he had been too keen in the first couple of races here. He took a long time to acclimatise to racing in this country. He's just coming right now and could even go to Ayr and Sandown. I wouldn't be afraid to put him in the Celebration Chase - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has won the last two runnings of the Red Rum at Aintree; aside from being favourite on his reappearance, all indications are that he will be peaking in the spring once more, so others are preferred today.

stable_tour.quote: Our 2024 Red Rum Chase winner completely lost his form in the early part of last season, with the result his handicap mark fell quickly, so by the time he went back to Aintree in the spring to try and repeat his Red Rum success he was on the same mark as 12 months earlier. And he became the first horse in 40 years to land back-to-back victories in the valuable two-miler. We took a bit of a gamble bringing him out again a fortnight later when, off a 9lb higher mark minus the excellent Jay Tidball's 5lb claim, he followed up in Plumpton's most valuable-ever chase. His run at Ascot on Saturday told us things aren't going to be easy from now on off a career-high mark. He was fit enough, as he'd absolutely flown when we took him off for an away-day gallop several days ago, but he might have to wait a bit now before he sees the winner's enclosure again as normally he takes a few runs to hit peak form; for some reason he doesn't like the cold and the wet in mid-winter and is always a better horse in the spring, when everything will be geared towards attempting a Red Rum hat-trick. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Failed to build on last term's promising start as chaser until reappearance win last time
runners.name: Ryans Rocket

quotes.race: Kempton Park Working With The Community Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ryan's Rocket is a nice horse and he's done that well. He's been kept going through the depths of winter waiting for the better ground and has done well physically, but he'll benefit for a break - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Failed to build on a promising start over fences in late-2024 but picked up the thread again when springing a minor surprise at Newbury (extended 2m, good to soft) on reappearance 28 days ago; this asks a tougher question but he has place claims if he arrives here in the same sort of form.

stable_tour.quote: Ran in a couple of bumpers and then won his two hurdle starts before his summer break. He came back in the Persian War and was beaten in the first mile after racing completely with the choke out. To his credit, he did well to finish fourth. We're going to go chasing now and will probably drop back in trip. He'll do well when the ground is good in the spring, so he won't be running in the depths of winter. He's a big chasing type. 24-10-24

runners.comment: In the form of his life and better than the result last time; conditions ought to suit
runners.name: Gabriels Getaway

quotes.race: SBK Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We always liked Gabriel's Getaway early on but he was a bit of a hothead. He took a bit of time to mature but he won three out of three over fences then he got a bump at Bangor and ran too free and the ground was too soft for him at Ludlow last time. He was in at the deep end today but he's done it well. They cut each other's throats and he saw it out well - Ben Godfrey, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Three runs this season have all been among the four best of his life on RPRs, and better than the result when just over 5l fourth to Calico at Ascot (2m1f, good to soft) 35 days ago; previously second to Bad at this track (2m2f, good) in October; 3lb out of the handicap but no forlorn hope.

stable_tour.quote: I've always absolutely loved this horse. We wanted to run in the Red Rum at Aintree but he had a lameness issue and he's been late in so won't start until the spring. We hope we can get him in handicaps at the big spring festivals, possibly the Grand Annual. 14-11-24

We finally got to grips with him last season. He took well to chasing and we made the most of his mark, winning three before he was beaten at Bangor, where he was in a better race and we found out stamina isn't his forte. He's more of a two-miler and we could look to target a nice £28,000 race at Aintree on November 11. 12-10-23

runners.comment: Long time without a win and well out of the weights here; best to look elsewhere
runners.name: Calgary Tiger

quotes.race: West Berkshire Mencap Handicap Chase (For The Geoffrey Gilbey Trophy)
quotes.quote: Ben just clicks with Calgary Tiger and gets on with him so well. He's not an easy horse to hang on to and a couple of jockeys have tried to, but Ben has a great rapport with him. We'll go for a third win. I didn't want to run him too soon after Wincanton last time and I'll give him a similar gap. We've won a Class 4 and 3 now, so we'll look for a Class 2. William de Best-Turner, trainer

runners.spotlight: Nearly three years since this free-going sort last won, and being 32lb out of the weights means he is highly unlikely to break that run today.

15:07.race_name: Ladbrokes "Big Football Bet Builder Boosts" Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Bold-jumping front-runner; two good runs against unexposed rivals of late, including C&D
runners.name: Viroflay

quotes.race: Nick Luck Daily Podcast "Pointing Pointers" Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: We've always thought very highly of Viroflay. He loved it out in front and he has plenty of speed. He was entered at Aintree this week but we thought we'd wait another year. He could go to the hunter chase meeting at Cheltenham [May 2] - Olive Nicholls, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Front-runs; excellent hunter chase form includes 2m4f win here in April and he's run really well against unexposed rivals in two handicaps of late, including over C&D (good) last month; bold bid expected off the same mark.

stable_tour.quote: Could be a surprise packet. Has developed into a very smart hunter chaser and my daughter Olive has now won seven times on him. His second to Its On The Line in the Champion Hunters' Chase at Punchestown was a top-class piece of form and it's just a shame he doesn't quite stay 3m; 2m6f is probably his best trip. Ran a super race at Ascot on Saturday and we can have a lot of fun with him this season. We had been thinking of the Rising Stars at Wincanton in five days' time but Olive wouldn't have been able to claim off him, so the novice handicap at Ascot two days ago looked more suitable. He shaped there as if 2m3f was on the sharp side so we'll go back up in trip next time. He's ideally suited by a flat, right-handed track. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Unpredictable but useful win in this last year; not so good since and still 7lb higher
runners.name: Beachcomber

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Get Rewarded With Ladbucks Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The blinkers definitely helped Beachcomber out. He jumped very well. Rich got him in a lovely rhythm from quite early on, he was able to dictate as he wanted to, and I think going right-handed definitely helped as well -  AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beachcomber is a bit in and out and didn't like going left handed at Catterick last time. This was better for him and he's won here before. He'll jump a fence one day - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Discover Whats Trending At Rhino.Bet Casino Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beachcomber made things easy for me as he settled nicely in front. He's been a bit quirky in the past but he's growing up now - Richie McLernon, rider.

runners.spotlight: Prone to off days and had one of them when pulled up in November but he's capable when the mood takes, as when making most to win this race last year (good to soft; first-time blinkers); likely to be harder to pull off those tactics today and he's still 7lb higher than 12 months ago.

stable_tour.quote: He missed the first fence coming out of Swinley Bottom on his comeback at Ascot and things didn't really go for him, but he's better than that. He ran well at the Punchestown festival and is best going right-handed. Kempton suits him particularly well and there's a three-mile handicap chase there on Monday to consider, before perhaps looking to the same race he won at Kempton last Christmas. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Exuberant convert to fences when winning on chase debut (2m7f); up 8lb; potential for more
runners.name: Kap Vert
runners.spotlight: Had fairly routine handicap hurdle form following a novice win at Exeter last December but he proved an exuberant convert to fences when making some of the running on his recent chase debut at Taunton on the step up to 2m7f (good); up 8lb for that win and in a stronger race here but he can do better yet.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't run badly at Cheltenham but it was a bit disappointing. I think we'll switch him to chasing now - we've schooled him over fences and he's gone quite well, so that looks a nice option. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Goes well fresh, good 2m6f win on return in late 2024, but disappointing reappearance
runners.name: Wiseguy

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan

quotes.race: Coral Sir Peter O'Sullevan Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Wiseguy won his first chase down at Exeter last season but at the end of the season his jumping went to pieces. I ended up putting back over hurdles and he couldn't even jump them. He had back issues and all sorts of things. This was an ambitious place to come but he jumped and travelled well today and we've got him back. We'll just creep forward from here - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Best result when winning at Newbury (2m6f, good to soft) in November 2024 and he had some excuses later that season but, given that he goes well fresh, he didn't put up much of a show back at Newbury last month and others are of more interest after that.

stable_tour.quote: He's just a sensible old dude. He won the Peter O'Sullivan Chase at Newbury last year, which is always a nice race to win. We didn't quite build on it, but it certainly wasn't through lack of trying. We thought he was running rather well in the Scottish National, but he got hampered and it was game over. We've got an idea that the Badger Beer might be a starting point. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Better since visored and won last two, the latest at 3m (good); up 6lb; good claims
runners.name: Montregard

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was really disappointed with Montregard at Newcastle but I think the cheekpieces have helped him here and he's toughed it out well - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Started 2025 with two pulled-up runs but he's been well served by a visor replacing cheekpieces on last two starts, following a Worcester win with a strong-finishing success at Ascot (3m, both on good) last month; up a further 6lb but he should be suited by the likely good pace today; good claims.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse of JP McManus's who won his maiden at the second attempt over hurdles when last seen at Warwick in April. I was really pleased with him that day; he was green but toughed it out and stayed on nicely. I'd say he's progressed through the summer and is set to return in a 0-105 handicap hurdle at Uttoxeter on Friday. He'll ultimately jump a fence too. A nice prospect. 20-12-23

runners.comment: 3m chase winner in Ireland; strongly run race at this trip can suit; solid chance
runners.name: Prince Zaltar

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Prince Zaltar jumps carefully; you get a bit too close and he jumps too far forward. There's a fine line with him, but he finished the race well and got there very easily - Dyland Robinson, jockey.

quotes.race: Navan Racecourse Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Zaltar won at Tramore last year and I thought we were on an upwards curve but anything that could have gone wrong did go wrong. But I thought he ran a cracker at Fairyhouse last day and I couldn't see him out of the four today - Philip Rothwell, trainer

quotes.race: Family Fun Day July 3rd Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Zaltar was very disappointing the last day on heavy ground at Clonmel. He really struggled on it. He jumped better and travelled better on that ground - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Much of his racing at distances short of 3m but he won a big-field chase over this trip at Punchestown (good to yielding) in June; successful yard debut over hurdles in September and a recent close third on return to fences at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) was encouraging; refitted cheekpieces raise a query (indifferent effort in them once in Ireland) but he's another who will appreciate a truly run race and a big effort is on the way.

stable_tour.quote: He probably did a bit too much on the front end in a 3m handicap hurdle at Cheltenham last time and I'm sure he has a decent race in him somewhere down the line. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Hurdle wins at 2m3f/2m4f; suited by stiff 2m7f over fences latest; query about sharp 3m
runners.name: Bective Abbey
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; hurdle wins have come over 2m3f (good) and 2m4f (soft) but he looked suited by the stiff test at Chepstow (about 2m7f, good to soft) when runner-up there this month in only his second chase; open to improvement but others may be better suited by this sharp 3m.

stable_tour.quote: He's a difficult one to weigh up. When we get him right he's more than capable, but we're not capable of getting him right very often -  there are only two occasions he's gone to the track when we've been really happy. He looks like a chaser and we gave him a run over fences in June, but that backfired. He'll go back over them and two and a half miles is probably his trip. We still like him a lot. 21-10-25

15:37.race_name: Ladbrokes "Get Rewarded With Ladbucks" Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Made winning return at Chepstow in October but well beaten since; may be vulnerable
runners.name: Washington

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "100% Football Acca Boost On Self Service Betting Terminals" Handicap Hurdle (Listed)
quotes.quote: Washington won at Chepstow and I considered the Greatwood but I thought Cheltenham would not suit us at all. I knew this big galloping track would be perfect for him. It's very very rare in horse racing that a plan comes together but this one actually did - Harry Derham, trainer

quotes.race: 3 As Leisure Motorhome-Caravan Sales Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Paul [O'Brien] gave Washington a good ride. I'm very pleased with him - he's been with us a while and taken time to come right, so I'm glad he has rewarded the patience of his owners - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Cheltmas Bet £10 Get £20 Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a very strong performance from Washington as it's difficult to win these races under a penalty. He was keen enough early on but came through well in the end although I may well have gone too soon - Lewis Stones, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Made a winning return at Chepstow (2m, good) in October but well beaten both starts since, including for Megan Fox at Doncaster on latest; may be vulnerable to younger legs.

stable_tour.quote: He's sort of already done his bit for the season in winning at Chepstow. He could go to Doncaster in the middle of December for a two-mile hurdle. He's nearly at a career-high mark again now, so it makes life harder for him. We could freshen him up and have a crack at one of the spring festivals as he likes top of the ground. 19-11-25

He's a nice type but I was very disappointed with his recent effort at Newbury, where he was pulled up. I'm not sure if it was the fitting of a hood or the fact he was dropped in, prompting him to sulk. We'll go back to 2m next time with a more positive ride and see if that sparks him back to life. The positive is that he's around his last winning rating. 22-12-22

runners.comment: Pulled up last time but had won his two previous races; may bounce back
runners.name: Nardaran

quotes.race: Bet Goodwin Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It wasn't a great bit of riding down to the last. I think I asked Nardaran up when there was nothing there, but he's a lovely horse and has improved a lot for the summer - Harry Cobden, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Ran no sort of race at Plumpton six weeks ago but he'd previously won on the same course and at Sandown (both 2m, good to soft) in the autumn; needs to bounce back but it's possible he's not reached his ceiling just yet.

stable_tour.quote: An ex-Aga Khan Flat horse in France, he ran a shocker at Musselburgh in February when a lot of ours were under a cloud, before getting off the mark at Taunton. He was over the top when making no show in the novice hurdle final at Sandown on the final day. He had a breathing operation in the close season and a summer out clearly did him the world of good, as he came back at Plumpton last month and put up a really tidy performance to win a handicap hurdle. Cobby must have been impressed by him at home because he had stuck him in his Six to Follow in our stable horses-to-follow competition. I was impressed, too, with what I saw the other day and we'll look to raise him a bit in grade next time. There's quite a valuable handicap hurdle at Plumpton a fortnight on Monday. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Forced too strong a pace last time, following two front-running wins; still has potential
runners.name: De Temps En Temps

quotes.race: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought it was race over two out when they all came up my inside. De Temps En Temps is so versatile - he is quick enough for two miles but stays three really. Turning for home, he got himself together and saw it out so well. I could see Sean [Bowen] next to me and was just hoping I'd get my head in front - Freddie Keighley, rider.

quotes.race: SBK (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: De Temps En Temps picked up to get there between horses and he pricked his ears once he got there. He's a nice horse and the sensible thing to do would be to keep him as a novice hurdler for next season. - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.spotlight: Made most of the running when winning at Uttoxeter (2m, good) and Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) in October, then forced too strong a pace and faded into sixth on handicap debut back at Cheltenham (2m5f); dropping back to 2m may suit and he still has untapped potential.

stable_tour.quote: We've had lots of Cheltenham winners but that was certainly one of the best. He's just been an improver. It was quite a bold shout to leave Freddie on at Cheltenham because he couldn't claim. People were saying I was doing the wrong thing, but he'd won on him the time before and knew him well. His race looked over with that horrible mistake at the second-last and then to battle past Sean Bowen in a driving finish - it was a really special win. I was really impressed with his Irish bumper win and, for whatever reason, he just didn't show that in maiden hurdles in Ireland. We picked him up for sensible money and he's proved a really good buy. He's improving and is exciting to have in the yard. He has three options at the November meeting - a conditionals' race and a 2m novice handicap hurdle, but he would need to not get balloted out of those off his rating. If he didn't get in there's an intermediate hurdle on the Saturday as a back-up option. 12-11-25

runners.comment: 3-3 over hurdles; game winner at Ascot last time; should go well again despite a 6lb rise
runners.name: Trustintimes
runners.owner: The Time On Our Hands Boys Syndicate

quotes.race: Ascot Partners Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The bookies didn't give Trustintimes any chance. The favourite had won a Grade 2 and was only rated 5lb higher than us, so we were either far too high or he was very well in. We weighed up sticking to novices or dipping our toe into handicap company, so we'll see how the handicapper reacts now - Harry Fry, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Highly progressive and 3-3 over hurdles, leading two out and keeping on gamely when completing the hat-trick on handicap debut at Ascot (1m7f, good; runner-up successful since) last month; on a roll and should go well again despite a 6lb rise.

runners.comment: Progressive 5yo; creeping up the weights but should give another good account of himself
runners.name: Indemnity

quotes.race: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Indemnity jumped very well considering it was only his third run over hurdles. His Flat speed helped him and he's a nice horse - Gavin Sheehan, rider.

quotes.race: Euro2024 Daily Giveaways On Rhino.Bet Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Indemnity has had plenty of seconds so it's nice to get his head in front and hopefully he'll get some confidence off the back of this. I was kicking myself at Leicester because he travelled into it really well and I think I pressed the button a bit soon. He won his race, pricked his ears a bit and one just picked me off from out the back. I held on to him longer today. I think he'll be suited to a competitive handicap where they go fast and he can pick them up late - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 5yo on an upward curve; completed hat-trick at Huntingdon, Warwick and Market Rasen, all on good ground, and has run well against stronger opposition since (third of eight at Newbury last time); creeping up the weights but should give another good account of himself.

stable_tour.quote: Touch wood, he's a nice horse. He's much bigger and stronger than last season and ran a lovely race in the face of his stiffest task at Ascot last Saturday. He was a bit keen and it was a fair performance to keep going as he did. Ultimately he's probably going to be slightly better on a sharper track like Aintree or Kempton because he's got pace. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Stratford winner in October; C&D fourth has worked out well; unexposed for handicap debut
runners.name: Wandering Ego

quotes.race: EBF And Charlie Longsdon Racing "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Wandering Ego won that well, and it was a good performance which didn't surprise me. He needed that run at Perth; it was a good blowout. Hopefully, he'll be a nice horse. He'll stay over two miles and looks a progressive type - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made all for bumper win in March and most of the running when beating 13 rivals in novice hurdle at Stratford (2m, good to soft) in October; only fourth of six when favourite over C&D five weeks ago but that still represented a good run on form and the first two have both won comfortably since; still unexposed and may improve further now tackling a handicap.

runners.comment: Has won off higher mark; second to handicap blot at Doncaster; commands major respect
runners.name: Williethebuilder
runners.spotlight: Won off a higher mark (on good ground) for Dan Skelton and has shaped as if retaining all his ability in three runs for current yard, keeping on from off pace when second to a handicap blot at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) on latest; knocking firmly at the door and commands major respect.

stable_tour.quote: He wandered around late on when winning at Wetherby. He wants a race run for him, rather than making his own running, but it was effective on the day. He could run in the Greatwood at Cheltenham on November 17 if it doesn't rain. 12-11-24

12:25.race_name: William Hill Daily Bet Boosts Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Runner-up at Ayr last time and there's every chance he'll be in the mix
runners.name: Shoeshine Boy
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner who took a step back in the right direction when third at Hexham (2m7f, good to soft) last month and built on that when runner-up at Ayr (3m, heavy); there's every chance he'll be in the mix.

runners.comment: Runner-up in this last year and may have needed last month's return to action
runners.name: Geordie Night
runners.spotlight: Second in this last year (good to soft) and won at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good) in May after a wind op; well beaten at Catterick last month but may have needed the run and he's not ruled out; best form on good/good to soft.

runners.comment: New, 6lb higher mark has now kicked in but this in-form 8yo is entitled to respect
runners.name: Getaway Master

quotes.race: pricedup.bet Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We didn't have a clue what we had. We were told the favourite would win this and we'd have been very happy if he'd finished fourth, fifth or sixth. Getaway Master will be better again on softer ground and this was a poor race in which a lot went wrong for a lot of horses, it completely collapsed. I'm sure the handicapper is well aware of that -  Andy Gibson, who runs The Cheltenham Trail syndicate.

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Races On Instagram Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Getaway Master got a nice, patient ride and let him come home strongly. He saw it out really well - Richard Daniels, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) last month on second stable start and second of three to progressive Gordon Elliott winner at Hexham (2m4f, heavy) ten days later; his new, 6lb higher mark has now kicked in but he should be fine now back up in trip and this in-form 8yo is entitled to respect.

runners.comment: Won off 4lb higher at Huntingdon (2m) in May but has struggled since; stamina to prove
runners.name: Little Soiree
runners.spotlight: She's now 4lb lower than when winning for Chris Gordon at Huntingdon (2m, good) in May but well beaten on her final run for that stable and it's been the same story on her four starts for this yard; stamina to prove.

stable_tour.quote: She got beaten a head at Plumpton last week when she got collared on the line by one of Anthony Honeyball's with a 10lb claimer. She made a bad mistake at the last down the back, which probably cost her the race. That was painful but it was good to see her back in form. I want to find her an ideal race, a 0-100 handicap over 2m on better ground, and fingers crossed she should be thereabouts. 26-02-25

runners.comment: Pulled up on last two starts but over fences; on a handy mark on hurdle form from March
runners.name: Glory Hights
runners.spotlight: Pulled up last month on first two chase starts but the return to hurdling could trigger a revival and he's 1lb lower than when going close in a big field at Ayr (3m, soft) in March in this sphere; possible player.

runners.comment: 0-29 and below par last time but third of 16 in this last year; place claims now back here
runners.name: Star Vantage

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden after 29 starts and below par at Musselburgh last time, but prior to that he ran pretty well over this C&D (soft) and he was third of 16 in this last year (good to soft); place claims  back here.

runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Market Rasen; open to further improvement; key player up 5lb
runners.name: Castanea Breeze
runners.spotlight: Tapped back into the promise shown in bumpers to win at Market Rasen (2m7f, good to soft) this month when upped in trip in first-time cheekpieces (retained); open to further improvement and he's a key player up 5lb.

stable_tour.quote: I was really pleased with his win at Market Rasen last Thursday. He's been a very slow learner and mentally immature, which you could tell from the way he jumped in his earlier races. He didn't quite know if he was coming or going. TC [Tom Cannon] gave him a great ride last week, because he just made up his mind for him turning into the home straight. Once he got rolling he was able to put his whip down and was just hands and heels as he kept galloping to the line. It was at a very low level, but I was very happy with that and I think he'll go on from there. 10-12-25

runners.comment: Won at Cartmel in June on second h'cap start; may have needed the run at Hexham recently
runners.name: Moveonbuy
runners.spotlight: Won when upped in trip at Cartmel (2m6f, soft) in June on her second handicap start, shaping as though she could be suited by 3m; may have needed the run at Hexham (2m7f, heavy) recently and she's not discounted.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 7yo; improvement needed in first-time cheekpieces on third handicap start
runners.name: Perfect Poli
runners.spotlight: 7yo who is lightly raced and wears first-time cheekpieces but she needs to produce plenty more than she managed in the summer on her first two handicap starts (2m7f/2m6f, good/soft).

runners.comment: 2-2 in points but hasn't achieved much over hurdles and others are more compelling
runners.name: Kalo Athena
runners.spotlight: 2-2 in 3m points and the step up in trip may suit this lightly raced 6yo, who wears first-time cheekpieces; however, she hasn't achieved much over hurdles and didn't threaten on handicap debut; others are more compelling.

runners.comment: Tailed off at Doncaster latest but lightly raced and interesting to see if backers return
runners.name: Westerdale
runners.spotlight: 6yo who has raced five times and and is yet to seriously threaten; however, at Doncaster last month (tailed off) she was well backed on that first outing since January and it will be interesting to see if her supporters return; wears a first-time hood.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on handicap debut but went off favourite and is in top hands
runners.name: Little Wren
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on first four starts and beaten 23l when fifth of nine on last month's handicap debut at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft); however, she was sent off favourite for that latest outing and it will be no surprise if she takes a sizeable step forward for her top yard at some point.

runners.comment: 5yo; cheekpieces go on; market check advised but hard to fancy judged on last two runs
runners.name: Smart Bucks
runners.spotlight: 5yo who is one to watch in the betting now up in trip in first-time cheekpieces but he's hard to fancy on what he's shown on his last two runs.

runners.comment: Attracted market support last time but she's now been well beaten in both handicaps
runners.name: Fancy Nancy Pants
runners.spotlight: Attracted market support at Bangor (2m7f, soft) last month on second handicap start but was well beaten, having previously finished tailed off at Sedgefield (2m5f, good); she needs to raise her game in a big way.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Hexham (2m4f, heavy) in March 2024 but hasn't recaptured that form since
runners.name: Walk My Way

prev_owners.owner: D Lees, D Pollitt & Driving Down Ltd
Mr&Mrs Lees, D Pollitt, Driving Down Ltd

runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Hexham (2m4f, heavy) in March 2024 but she's been well beaten/pulled up on her five starts since and is now 0-10; a transformation is needed with first-time blinkers replacing cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who has been well beaten over fences on her last two starts
runners.name: You Say Its Over
runners.spotlight: Runner-up four times over hurdles and she didn't run badly over fences at Hexham in October, but two lesser runs have followed in that sphere and this 7yo is now 0-24 under rules; others make greater appeal.

13:00.race_name: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Classy Flat performer; major player if taking to hurdling at the first attempt
runners.name: Alsakib

quotes.race: John Smith's Silver Cup Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: When you get a chance to get on these horses you have to be so grateful and hopefully I can make hay now. Alsakib tested me a bit today, but we knew he'd enjoy the ground and would stay - PJ McDonald, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Old Rowley Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Alsakib is a lovely horse who stays the trip well. I don't think he'll run again this season here. The owners wanted him to run in the Qatar Derby, which is over ten furlongs, and that's always been the plan in having him here with me. If he comes back after that then he has a lot of possibilities - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner for Andrew Balding (various ground), the latest a 1m6f Group 3 in July 2024; sold for 100,000gns in October and he's a major player if taking to hurdling at the first attempt.

stable_tour.quote: A horse I bought this week at the sales - he ran in the Prix du Cadran for Andrew Balding. He's very useful on the Flat and has been bought to do to both jobs. He'll go jumping now and it's really exciting to get a horse of his calibre. 30-10-25

runners.comment: Very useful on the Flat and he could have a bright future in this code
runners.name: Chillingham

quotes.race: Ben And Mary Hibbert Memorial Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chillingham made a pleasing start and I knew he'd improve with racing. It was a case of whether the favourite was going to be very tough to beat. I hope the handicapper won't take it too literally. There was a shortage of mile-and-a-quarter maidens for this type of horse in the north of England. Our hand was kind of forced to come here, otherwise we were waiting until Leicester on the 16th, which wouldn't have suited us - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat for Ed Bethell with four wins (1m2f/1m4f, good to firm/soft); sold for 14,000gns in October; makes hurdle/stable debut without any headgear; he could have a bright future in this code.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Queen Mother's Cup in strange fashion with the winner being disqualified for overuse of the whip, but he'd always shown he had it in him to win a race like that. The handicapper hasn't missed him and he's up to 96, so life is going to be a bit trickier again as he hasn't won off that mark for two years. I think we want to be playing at 1m4f as 1m6f just stretches him. The visor seemed to work the oracle at York and we'll keep that. 02-07-25

runners.comment: Sedgefield bumper winner who brings potential to this first hurdle start; not ruled out
runners.name: Dartmouth Castle
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper at Sedgefield (2m1f, good to firm) in May on second start and similar form when fourth under penalty there (2m1f, good) in September; unraced on slow ground; brings some potential to this first hurdle start and he's not ruled out; one of two for the yard.

runners.comment: In good hands but may be of greater interest when able to tackle handicaps
runners.name: Greedy Smith
runners.spotlight: Hint of promise on debut in Market Rasen bumper (2m, good) in March, then well beaten in two novice hurdles (2m, good/good to soft); in good hands and a market check is advised but he may be of greater interest when able to tackle handicaps after this final qualifying run.

stable_tour.quote: A nice type who will probably run in a couple of bumpers this season. He's still a bit of a frame, so we won't rush him, but he's showing us some nice things at home. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Useful, four-time 1m2f winner on the Flat; tailed off on hurdle debut over C&D 3 weeks ago
runners.name: Liberty Coach

quotes.race: Racing TV Zetland Gold Cup Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Liberty Coach is a very likeable horse and I'm delighted the owners kept him, as there were a lot of people trying to buy him last year. It's horses like him we're trying to hold on to. He had a very good year last year and found his mojo at the back end. We felt he'd come on from last time, and he loves galloping tracks like this. He'll want three weeks before we go again. We'll be pitching him in to run in races for better money now, which is great - John Quinn, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Believe Specialist Finance Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: It's nice to get Liberty Coach's head in front. He's showed good ability in maidens and handicaps and it was frustrating he had yet to be a winner before now. He's quite a big horse and I'd be hopeful he could keep progressing - Sean Quinn, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Useful, four-time 1m2f winner on the Flat (good to firm/soft); very early days over hurdles but he was tailed off at 20-1 over C&D (soft) three weeks ago and has something to prove after that; headgear remains absent.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big unraced gelding who's likely to start off over 1m2f at Doncaster this weekend. I quite like him and he has the make and shape of a nice middle-distance horse. 20-03-24

runners.comment: Tailed off at big odds at Southwell (2m, soft/good to soft) on his two hurdle starts
runners.name: Littletown Lad
runners.spotlight: Fourth in bumper at Newcastle (2m1f, good) in April but tailed off at big odds at Southwell (2m, soft/good to soft) on his two hurdle starts.

stable_tour.quote: He ran in a couple of bumpers for Daragh Bourke and will go novice hurdling. He's very headstrong and needs to learn to race and do everything properly, but he should be capable of winning races when he puts it all together. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Promising performance over C&D on hurdle debut; lesser effort since but could bounce back
runners.name: Minstrel Knight

quotes.race: William Hill Finale Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: That's a great prize to win. Minstrel Knight has been very consistent and he loves this type of ground. He's done that really well. He's in the Horses In Training sale but I need to talk to the owner - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three wins on the Flat at up to 1m6f (good-heavy), showing useful form; was running a promising race when falling two out on hurdle debut over C&D (soft) last month; underwhelming fifth at Southwell (2m, good to soft) since but could be a contender if leaving that run behind.

stable_tour.quote: He was progressive last year and I think he'll be the same this season. He ran a great race first time up at Hamilton, where he travelled well from off the pace and looked as if he was going to do some damage but made quite a big move at a tough time and got tired. He's pretty ground dependent, he needs it soft, and is entered in the Old Newton Cup and a £100,000 race at the Newmarket July festival. If it came up soft, the Ebor could be a fun race for him. 02-07-25

runners.comment: Has shown ability but pedigree suggests he'll come into his own over further
runners.name: Nosy Neighbour
runners.spotlight: Fifth/fourth in his two point starts (2m4f/3m) and again showed ability when 19l third on last month's hurdle debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft); however, pedigree suggests he'll come into his own over further.

runners.comment: Ran okay when 14l third on hurdle debut but others have more substance to their form
runners.name: Sovereignlightcafe
runners.spotlight: Modest, lightly raced maiden on the Flat; ran okay when 14l third on hurdle debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft; 40-1) three weeks ago but others have more substance to their form.

runners.comment: He's shown very little and is hard to fancy
runners.name: Steel Soldier
runners.spotlight: He's shown very little and is hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Runner-up on debut in a bumper but soundly beaten in fifth on next two starts
runners.name: Tea Boy
runners.spotlight: Attractively bred 5yo who was runner-up on debut in a bumper at Hexham (2m, good to soft) in March but soundly beaten in fifth on next two starts (good/good to soft); improvement necessary now switched to hurdles.

runners.comment: Useful on the Flat and third over C&D on this month's hurdle debut; leading contender
runners.name: Two Brothers
runners.owner: On Top Racing Ltd & Two Brothers

quotes.race: Follow @vickersracing On X Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Brothers doesn't like making the running but Serena (Brotherton) had little choice at Doncaster but that blew the cobwebs off him and he came here a fresh horse. A mile and a half on this type of ground is perfect for him - Billy Garritty, winning jockey.

runners.spotlight: Useful middle-distance performer on the Flat (wins on soft/good to soft) who was 6l third of 14 on hurdle debut over C&D (soft) this month; open to improvement in this code and he's a leading contender; tongue-tie added.

13:35.race_name: William Hill Racing Bet Builder Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Pulled up on chase debut but very lightly raced and retains potential for good yard
runners.name: Pierrot Jaguen

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pierrot Jaguen is a big, lovely horse, and probably one for next year more than this year. Robert [Waley-Cohen, part-owner] was just saying we could have a look at Cheltenham or Aintree but I'd be leaning towards taking the chance of it coming up soft at Aintree and running in the Sefton Novices' Hurdle. He's got a bit of class and was very raw at Cheltenham. He travelled like the winner but got tapped for toe, he might have won with another 100 yards. He's a lovely three-mile chaser for next year and Sean [Bowen, jockey] says he has a fantastic mind, which is a good quality with big festivals in mind - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Pulled up on last month's chase/seasonal debut at Carlisle and it's hard to be confident on the back of that; however, this very lightly raced 6yo was a promising novice hurdler last season and retains potential for his good yard; no surprise to see a good run in first-time cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: His Lingfield win is working out okay with the third having won since, and he'll have another run in a novice hurdle first. He'll be kept in the Albert Bartlett and if he was to run well under a penalty we'd definitely consider it as he stays well. 18-2-25

runners.comment: Won at Hexham in October but mistakes have proved costly on next two starts
runners.name: I Am Max

quotes.race: Sky Bet Club Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'm not sure about the decision, there's been softer bumps that have been awarded a race. It definitely put me off my stride, but they told me the winning distance was too far - Ryan Mania, jockey of I Am Max.

runners.spotlight: Won at Hexham (2m4f, good) in October when back over fences; also effective at 3m and on soft ground; however, mistakes have proved costly when well beaten on last two starts and he needs to cut out the blunders.

stable_tour.quote: Perhaps it's been a blessing that he fell on his chase debut at Wetherby as he's going to be much more mature when he goes chasing next season. Since then I've been delighted with him on his two runs back over hurdles with second-place finishes at Kelso and Haydock. I was slightly disappointed with the stewards' inquiry at Haydock as they cautioned the winning jockey but didn't change the result. He's a really tough horse who wants softer ground.
