We'll find a decent 3m hurdle for him now, possibly a Pertemps qualifier. 22-01-25

runners.comment: Very much of interest on his close 2nd at Wincanton in January; may have needed last run
runners.name: Tommys Charm
runners.spotlight: Behind when a final-fence faller at Ffos Las in October following some time off; however, he was also well beaten on last season's reappearance before leaving it behind with a close second in a warm little race at Wincanton (3m1f, good to soft), and he's very much of interest on that form.

runners.comment: Respectable so far over fences but needs something extra if he's to come out on top
runners.name: Chasingouttheblues
runners.owner: Cw Racing Club & Ursa Major Racing

prev_owners.owner: Ursa Major Racing, Cw Racing & Partner

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Prices Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chasingouttheblues won his novice at Hexham and this was a big step today. He's a chaser for the future and we were thinking of going straight over fences but we may give him another spin over hurdles - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner (2m3f-3m, good-soft) who has run respectably in defeat on his three chase starts; he could give another good account but needs something extra if he's to get off the mark in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: We paid £22,000 at the recent Doncaster Sales - he was our pick of the sale - for myself and Mark [Walford] and he's definitely one for the notebook for the winter when he comes out in novice hurdles. 14-06-24

runners.comment: Lightly raced 6yo; could take step forward with cheekpieces back on for second chase start
runners.name: As Legends Have It
runners.spotlight: Untested at this trip under rules and he was beaten just over 9l when third of six on this month's chase debut at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft); however, this lightly raced 6yo was steadily progressive over hurdles and could take a step forward with the cheekpieces back on today; chance.

runners.comment: Beat in-form opponent to win at Catterick on second chase start and he's one to consider
runners.name: Aboutdamntime
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up (3m, soft) and maiden hurdle winner (2m4f, soft) who ended up with just one rival to beat when scoring at Catterick (3m1f, good) last month on his second chase start; however, it was an in-form opponent and this unexposed 6yo is just 1lb higher today; he's one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his debut for us at Carlisle on Monday and there was a lot to like about the way he put his head down after the last. He's got some good point-to-point form and his work has been really good, so he looks smart. He could be one for a good handicap in the spring. 21-11-24

runners.comment: Won over hurdles when last seen and the switch to fences could be a positive move
runners.name: Grangeclare Diego
runners.spotlight: Two-time point winner (3m, good to soft) who was having just his third rules start when making all on his handicap hurdle debut at Market Rasen (2m7f, good) in March; this switch to fences could prompt further improvement and he's in calculations on his return to action.

runners.comment: 0-8 under rules (0-3 over fences) but close third at Kelso latest and could be thereabouts
runners.name: Frisby
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, B Hague, M Lee & A Duffus

prev_owners.owner: Hold My Beer, B Hague, M Lee & Partner
Hold My Beer, B Hague & Partner

runners.spotlight: Point winner who is 0-8 under rules (0-3 over fences) but has often run well, most recently close third at Kelso (2m7f, soft); wears first-time cheekpieces and he could be thereabouts once more.

stable_tour.quote: He's ready to run and we're looking forward to getting him back. He's done well and we're very happy with him. His second on his debut in an Ayr bumper has worked out very well as the well-regarded winner has won again since. We're going hurdling with him, but he's a staying chaser in the making. We've been patient with him because he hasn't had his ground as he wants it really soft. 11-12-24

14:15.race_name: William Hill Each Way Extra Daily Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Won by a head on hurdle debut at Catterick and he's respected under a 7lb penalty
runners.name: Indian River

quotes.race: Racingtv.com/Freetrial Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Indian River is a lovely horse. We haven't had him that long but when I went over to see him in Ireland I loved him straight away. He did it well considering it was only his third run on the track so we're delighted. He jumped very well apart from missing the second-last a little bit - you'd expect that first day at school. We'll have to make a plan but it's a nice start. - Adrian Keatley, trainer

runners.spotlight: Promise in very light Flat career in Ireland (including on soft ground) and he won by a head when favourite on hurdle/stable debut at Catterick (1m7f, good) last month; carries 7lb penalty against some interesting opponents but he could have more to offer in this code and is entitled to respect.

runners.comment: Progressive at an ordinary level on the Flat but he's yet to shine over hurdles
runners.name: Division Day
runners.spotlight: Progressive at an ordinary level on the Flat but he unseated early on his hurdle debut at Catterick and was well beaten at Market Rasen next time, when putting in some slow jumps; hard to fancy on the back of that.

runners.comment: Modest stayer on the Flat but perhaps the switch to hurdles will unlock more potential
runners.name: Jedhi Knight
runners.spotlight: Modest stayer on the Flat for Jedd O'Keeffe with a peak RPR of just 61; sold for 13,000gns in October; however, perhaps the switch to hurdles will unlock some of the potential in his (admittedly Flat) pedigree and his new trainer has a 5-13 (38%) record here; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Progressive on the Flat this summer and has joined a good yard for his hurdling career
runners.name: Kentucky River
runners.owner: J R B Williams & Emdells Limited
runners.spotlight: Progressive on the Flat for Ollie Sangster this summer, runner-up at Doncaster (2m, good to soft; unraced on softer) then winning at Pontefract (2m1f, good to firm); he's joined a good yard for his hurdling career and could play a leading role.

runners.breeder: J Blackburn, S Winter & H Cram
runners.comment: Second/third on his two hurdle outings; probably again vulnerable for win-only purposes
runners.name: Lights Go Down
runners.spotlight: Nine-race Flat maiden who has run pretty well to finish second/third on his two outings in this code (2m1f/2m, soft/good to soft); could give another good account but he's probably vulnerable for win-only purposes.

runners.breeder: The Hon Mrs R Pease & Anthony Boswood
runners.comment: Not devoid of ability on Flat but 0-5 in that code and tailed off at 100-1 on hurdle debut
runners.name: Some Boy Me
runners.spotlight: Not devoid of ability on the Flat but 0-5 in that code and tailed off at 100-1 on recent hurdle debut at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft).

runners.comment: Below par on last few Flat runs for Ralph Beckett but very useful in that code at his best
runners.name: Square Dalboni

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Square D'Alboni is quite a long horse and the back of the stalls just caught his hock at Doncaster last time. We had to leave him alone for a little bit before we could go again. He was in the right frame of mind which was great - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Below par on his final few Flat runs for Ralph Beckett but he was a 2yo Listed winner in France last October (1m1f, heavy) and there'll be lots to look forward to over hurdles if he can tap back into that ability; sold for 45,000gns since his last run and now has first outing for Dan Skelton.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good autumn and the form has worked out well. He's a gelding so we'll have to cut our cloth accordingly. He'll get ten furlongs well and probably a mile and a half. He's done well physically and I'm happy with him. 28-04-25
A recent purchase, he was a very good two-year-old on the Flat but lost his way a bit as a three-year-old. His sire has had some good jumpers and I think he'll do well in that sphere. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Ability on the Flat but down the field on last two runs and changed hands for 8,000gns
runners.name: Twilight Safari
runners.spotlight: Displayed a good level of ability on the Flat for Harry Eustace but down the field on final two runs for that yard to make it 0-6; changed hands for 8,000gns and may be best watched on hurdle/stable debut.

runners.comment: Won when last seen (2m, AW); others have stronger Flat form but he's not ruled out
runners.name: Warrior King

prev_owners.owner: O T I Racing, Paul Inglett & Partner

runners.spotlight: Went close for Harry Charlton at Kempton (2m, AW) in September on second Flat handicap start then went one better there (2m), prior to 20,000gns sale; others have stronger Flat form but not ruled out on hurdle debut.

14:45.race_name: William Hill Castleford Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Strong form up to December 2023 but pulled up last month after whopping absence
runners.name: Haddex Des Obeaux

quotes.race: Wigley Support Fund Edward Courage Cup Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There is a race at Lingfield next week and Haddex Des Obeaux has done that easily, but Dad's the trainer. We'll see what he says, but when he's in this sort of form you might want to strike while the iron is hot. He's won on soft ground and I thought it would be okay. It's actually quite fresh down the inside and it was wet enough to get through - Jamie Moore, rider.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haddex Des Obeaux is quite fast. That's his limit, I was on fumes up the straight. He's a very neat jumper and the form of his previous two chase runs had worked out well. He jumped a bit left at Kempton last time and that's why we came up here - Jamie Moore, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 8yo who showed some strong form up to December 2023 and could be on a handy mark if retaining that ability; however, that's the big question as he was pulled up at Cheltenham last month when making his stable debut after a whopping 706-day absence.

stable_tour.quote: It was ballsy to buy him because he'd missed a year - but if he hadn't, we wouldn't have got anywhere near him. He'd had his time off with a leg, all the vettings were clean, and Jimmy [Fyffe] was prepared to stand up and buy him. I just hope he's rewarded for that. He's full of quality at home and does everything right. He could start in a graduation chase at Carlisle next month, but we'll be governed by the ground as it needs to be safe. He's a useful horse who could be a Graded performer. 30-10-25

runners.breeder: Sas Ecurie De Cachene & Elise Drouet
runners.comment: 6yo who returns from an absence but is a major player for Dan Skelton if fully tuned up
runners.name: Madara

quotes.race: Nyetimber December Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a great run and we're delighted with Madara. It's frustrating to get beaten but Veneita [Williams'] are super tough. Jumping two out we thought we might just go and get him but we did not. He made contact with the winner a little two out but it was our fault and the difference was pennies not pounds. He won't run on New Year's Day but there's a couple of options going forward. I should imagine it's back here for the Plate - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Ryanair Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Madara was beat over the Old course at Cheltenham and I think the New course suits him better. I don't know now because he looked to have plenty of pace there. It's a nice problem to have - Sophie Leech, trainer.

quotes.race: Quintessentially Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Madara is a lovely young horse to have and he is very straightforward. He is just a joy really. We really felt after his last run that he needed further, and we were really keen to run in the December Gold Cup, but because of his four-year-old allowance Fakir D'oudairies put us so far out of the weights it just wasn't worthwhile. He ran well over a similar trip last time and we were happy enough to come again. He had a good pull in the weights, and I think the race panned out well as they went hard in front - Sophie Leech, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 6yo who ran really well late last year on his first two runs for Dan Skelton, finishing second in a competitive handicap at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last December on the second occasion; absent since and a longer trip than this is probably preferable, but he's a major player off the same mark as last time if fully tuned up; versatile ground-wise.

runners.comment: Merely sixth on both runs this season but on an attractive mark and he likes it here
runners.name: Homme Public

prev_owners.owner: Lord Daresbury & Ecurie Madame Jacques Cypres

quotes.race: Polypipe Building Products Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I have massive admiration for Homme Public. He's an absolute gent to do anything with. He's run in plenty of big races and is maybe just shy of being a really good horse, but what he loses in that little bit of ability for the top end he makes up for with his attitude. He's really there when you need him and is a pleasure to ride - Henry Brooke, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Reg' As The November) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We entered thinking we wouldn't run. Then Homme Public was in amongst it and with few runners we thought we'd run. It's disappointing, you'd expect Nicky [Henderson] or [Paul] Nicholls to have a runner in it. I don't think he liked the ground but he won well - Oliver Greenall, co-trainer.

quotes.race: Flipit Sell Your Car Better Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It's a big ask for a horse, even though he's been jumping very well at home, to run straight into a handicap with horses who have had plenty of goes over fences. But the lads know what Homme Public's schooled like at home and they'd only do it if they were confident. And I soon realised they weren't wrong and he jumped well. He's got Swinton Hurdle form, he's a grand little sort - Henry Brooke, jockey.

quotes.race: Start Your Racing TV Free Trial Now Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We always thought Homme Public had a lot of talent. He used to be keen and flighty but he's started to relax and grow up - Oliver Greenall, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet At Market Rasen Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Homme Public probably needed it first time at Catterick and inexperience got him beaten. Today he was more settled and a bit fitter and he did it nicely in the end. I don't know about the Triumph Hurdle, he's done it nicely enough today but what he's beaten is hard to say. It's a possibility but I don't know if he's hardened enough - Oliver Greenall, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in sixth over fences/hurdles on his two runs this season; however, he's on an attractive mark on last season's best hurdle and chase form and four visits to Wetherby have yielded two wins; could stage a big revival if conditions suit (best form is on good/good to soft).

stable_tour.quote: He's been a star for us. He looked a bit ring-rusty at Wetherby and we might go back over hurdles and then aim him at nice handicap chases in the spring. He gets two and a half miles and needs it to be really strongly run when he goes over two. 20-11-25

Another lovely horse we acquired from France after two smart second places at Auteuil. He won on his second start for us but then, like so many who come over from France, he seemed to lose a season. We experienced a similar issue with Herbiers and I know of so many French horses who take a while to acclimatise. He's over all of that now and returned in even better form last month when winning by five and a half lengths at Wetherby. He's gone up 7lb but he's full of it at home. We'll be looking for some good races for him and The Ladbroke at Ascot just before Christmas is very much on our radar. 07-12-22

runners.comment: Cajoled to victory in this last year; his profile in 2025 has been patchy
runners.name: Harpers Brook

quotes.race: William Hill Castleford Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a genius ride and a brilliant job by Dan [Skelton, trainer] and the team because Harper's Brook is good at throwing races. They've worked him out - although even then Kielan thought he'd got upsides too quickly. He has masses of ability but he's just odd. When he thinks he's done it, he stops - Andrew Megson, owner.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harper's Brook got his head in front, which is great because he's got a lot of ability. We all love him to pieces because he's a bit of a rogue. He almost got taken out completely and then almost fell at the second-last before somehow coming back on the bridle again before the last - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was a very nice performance. Harper's Brook is a big raw horse and was a little bit keen, but he jumped fantastic and I'd have won regardless of the horse in front of us running out or not. I just wanted to teach him a bit up the straight, but whatever he does over hurdles will be a bonus as he's a chaser in time - Kielan Woods, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Cajoled to victory by Kielan Woods in this race last year and in-form 7lb claimer Harry Atkins rides today; he may have needed his reappearance run at Exeter three weeks ago and cheekpieces now return, but his profile in 2025 has been patchy and he's not straightforward even when he's on song.

stable_tour.quote: He won a good race at Wetherby last Christmas and will aim for something similar this season. I think two miles on soft ground suits him round that sort of track. We'll have to get him started somewhere but he won't be seen at his best until the going eases. He can have another productive season. 10-11-25

He joined us having won a point-to-point last year for Tom Ellis and was impressive from day one. He is a fine, big chasing type and the fact he won at Carlisle in his first attempt over hurdles was a bonus. He is not short of speed and the plan is to go to Sandown on Friday for the Grade 2 Winter Novices' Hurdle. If things go well there we will look for something bigger over Christmas. I hope he is well above average, as he certainly shapes that way. 30-11-21

runners.comment: Three wins last season and solid third on last month's stable/seasonal debut at Newbury
runners.name: Doyen Du Bar

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Doyen Du Bar won a nice bumper as a five-year-old and then he developed a stress fracture. Henry Brooke rode him and was in awe of him. He said he thought he was a proper horse. He came back from that, ran in another bumper and then developed another stress fracture. We've been patient and waited and we're having a nice season with him. There'll probably be a race for him at the Scottish National meeting. That'll be a target and we'll just let him freshen up - Pauline Robson, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Cheltenham NRMB January 1st Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Doyen Du Bar is a big guy, so whatever he did over hurdles was always going to be a bonus going chasing. The form of his last race worked out well with the second winning at Doncaster. He'll get further, the ground was no problem and he's an improving type - Brian Hughes, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 9yo who won three small-field novice handicap chases for Pauline Robson last season (2m, good-heavy) and reappeared with a solid third at Newbury (2m, good to soft) on last month's stable debut; he could still have more to offer and is firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Runner-up to progressive winner at Kelso last time; in the mix off static mark
runners.name: Traprain Law
runners.spotlight: Having dropped down the weights he ran well when runner-up behind a progressive winner in a quality handicap at Kelso (2m1f, soft) three weeks ago; he retains the same mark and there's every chance he'll be in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: He loves it soft, so we were pleased with his Cheltenham run. He'll be going for two-mile handicap chases and we'll be praying for rain, he could be well handicapped. 29-10-25

Two miles on soft to heavy ground is his ideal and this season he has won twice at Kelso on very deep ground, including last time from a nice newcomer [Galunggung]. There'll be more opportunities over hurdles but I can't wait to get him chasing. Keep an eye out for him while the ground is riding soft or heavy. 25-01-23

15:20.race_name: William Hill Extra Places With B.O.G Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Bought for £46,000 after winning Irish point; new stable 4-30 in bumpers; likely type
runners.name: Agent Argylle
runners.spotlight: By Mahler out of a half-sister to the Welsh Grand National winner Monbeg Dude; bought for £46,000 after winning a good-ground Irish point in May; new stable is 4-30 in bumpers in the last five seasons; likely type.

runners.comment: Shaped with lots of promise when fourth in Listed event at Cheltenham; high on the list
runners.name: A Likeable Rogue
runners.spotlight: Went off 80-1 but shaped with lots of promise when 7l fourth of 13 in Listed event at Cheltenham (soft) last month, keeping on well from midfield; open to improvement and high on the list.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Has joined Rebecca Menzies after two encouraging runs in Ireland; not ruled out
runners.name: Au Plaisir
runners.spotlight: Similar form when mid-division at the Punchestown festival and 12l third of 16 at Navan (yielding) in September; remains open to improvement and has joined a very capable trainer; not ruled out.

runners.comment: 32,000euros 3yo; plausible on pedigree but stable just 3-44 in bumpers in recent seasons
runners.name: Ewden Valley
runners.spotlight: 32,000euros 3yo; second foal; half-brother to 1m2f Flat (RPR 72) and 2m hurdle winner Soul Limbo; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m hurdle winner Gerdago; that's a plausible pedigree for a race like this but his stable is just 3-44 in bumpers in recent seasons.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice staying chaser in the making. We like what we see from him, but he's going to need a bit of time. He'll have a couple of runs this season, but we're in no rush this term. 18-11-25

runners.breeder: S A Richards & Mrs L Kemble
runners.comment: 40,000euros 3yo; yard does well in bumpers and this one makes some appeal on paper
runners.name: Fullythermal
runners.spotlight: 40,000euros 3yo; Jack Hobbs half-brother to 2m3f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Midnight Mary; dam tough 2m-3m3f hurdle/chase winner; yard does well (17% strike-rate) in bumpers and this one makes some appeal on paper.

runners.comment: £11,000 3yo; dam won bumper; in-form stable had big-priced bumper winner last month
runners.name: Get On Son
runners.spotlight: £11,000 3yo; by Getaway; dam bumper winner/placed in 3m hurdle, closely related to smart 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Gallant Oscar; in-form stable had a big-priced bumper winner at Huntingdon last month.

runners.comment: Well held at Uttoxeter and Southwell; hard to fancy
runners.name: Good Boy Griff
runners.spotlight: Well held at Uttoxeter and Southwell; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Made a short-lived effort when fourth of five at Market Rasen; may improve but needs to
runners.name: Hurlyburly
runners.spotlight: Made a short-lived effort when fourth of five at Market Rasen (good to soft; 8-1) last month; may improve but certainly needs to.

runners.comment: Encouraging fourth at Wincanton; new yard has well-above-average record in bumpers
runners.name: Ink Black Heart
runners.spotlight: Showed something to build on when fourth of 12 at Wincanton (good to soft; 11-1) in January; subsequently left Tom Weston; new yard has a well-above-average strike-rate in bumpers; has to be respected.

stable_tour.quote: Fourth in his bumper behind Bossman Jack, which is form we like, he's a big, rangy horse who'll go for a soft-ground bumper in December and a couple more in the new year before we head over hurdles this time next year. He's ultimately a chaser but we're happy with what we've seen so far. 10-11-25

runners.comment: £30,000 2yo; yard does well with relatively few runners in bumpers; another to consider
runners.name: Katagat
runners.spotlight: £30,000 2yo; by Diamond Boy; dam 2m-2m5f hurdle winner, sister to high-class 2m3f-3m3f hurdle/chase winner Secret Investor; yard does well with relatively few runners in bumpers; another to consider.

runners.comment: £31,000 3yo; bred to be suited by longer distances and obstacles in due course
runners.name: Lou Des Bordes
runners.owner: Prof Alyn Morice & Miss Caroline Nowell
runners.spotlight: £31,000 3yo; half-brother to French winners Doralou Des Bordes (2m2f-3m6f chase including cross-country) and Kefir Des Bordes (2m5f cross-country); bred to be suited by longer distances and obstacles in due course.

runners.comment: Half-brother to 2m4f-3m jumps winner Marble Moon; yard 0-25 in bumpers in last five years
runners.name: Marble Sky
runners.spotlight: £18,000 3yo; by Mahler; brother to point winner Shining Marble, half-brother to 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner Marble Moon; yard 0-25 in bumpers in the last five seasons.

runners.comment: 40,000euros 3yo; represents top yard with fine strike-rate in bumpers; likely newcomer
runners.name: Rock On Ronnie
runners.spotlight: 40,000euros 3yo; closely related to a point winner, half-brother to four winners including Chicago Time (useful 2m4f/3m hurdle) and Whataboutyeh (3m hurdle/chase); represents top yard with fine strike-rate (21%) in bumpers.

runners.comment: Stable excels (24%) in bumpers and this one could have a part to play on debut
runners.name: Rubinio
runners.spotlight: 24,000euros yearling; half-brother to two Flat winners including Rashiba (German/French 7.5f-8.5f); dam 7f-1m1f winner (including German/French Listed); stable excels (24%) in bumpers and this one could have a part to play on debut, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.comment: May improve on form of debut third at Catterick but this looks a stronger race
runners.name: Static Charm
runners.spotlight: Outran his odds when never-nearer 12l third of 12 at Catterick (good ground; 33-1) last month; may improve but this looks a stronger race.

16:00.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Improved for the step up to 7f when winning at Newcastle 11 days ago; big player up 3lb
runners.name: Flowstate
runners.spotlight: In good form this year and he ran his best race of the year when winning at Newcastle 11 days ago, keeping on well (7f); that was his first run at the trip and a 3lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run.

runners.comment: Solid 3rd over 8.6f here two weeks ago; runs off the same mark and should make a bold bid
runners.name: Bass Player

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Bass Player retains plenty of ability but has his quirks. We had sweetened him up a little and my daughter Lauren rode him in some amateur races. I'm hopeful there could be a bit more to come - he has the ability to travel well through a race which does help on the all-weather - Kevin Frost, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two course wins last winter; good third over 8.6f here two weeks ago; should go well back at 7f off the same mark

stable_tour.quote: A really lovely horse who ran well last year without winning before undergoing a wind operation over Christmas. He has had three runs since and there were some very positive signs on his penultimate run at Goodwood. When everything falls into place I feel he can pick up a good race. 06-07-23

runners.comment: Inconsistent but he is on a good mark if this is one of his going days
runners.name: Super Hit
runners.spotlight: Can blow hot and cold but he is on a good mark if this is one of his going days; finished second on both occasions Kieran O'Neill has ridden him in the past; one to consider.

runners.comment: Has shown winning potential; steps up in trip with headgear added; drawn widest though
runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.spotlight: All races over sprint trips thus far; has shown enough promise to think a small handicap could fall his way, and the addition of a visor could perk him up; drawn widest though.

runners.comment: Poor form in four runs for new stable earlier in the year; too much to prove
runners.name: Rogue Soldier
runners.spotlight: Poor form in four runs for this yard in the first half of 2025; dropped 10lb as a result but still not easily recommended.

runners.comment: Prolific winner on AW, the latest off 1lb lower in August; usually seen over longer trips
runners.name: Masqool

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: James (Evans, trainer) said Masqool has come to him from Godolphin and every time he's done a bit of work he's improved. We thought he'd run well last time but we didn't think he'd go that close. And today he built on that. It felt like a long last furlong but he's still improving, it was only his fifth run and I think there will be a lot more fun on grass. He'll get a mile and a quarter - Dougie Costello, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Prolific winner on AW, the latest at Chelmsford in August off just 1lb lower; that was 1m2f though and it has been over two years since he last raced over this trip.

runners.breeder: Mrs S Field, Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt
runners.comment: Hasn't lived up to market expectation here in his two runs for new yard; 7f still a query
runners.name: Act Of Violence

prev_owners.owner: Peter R Ball, Gentech Ltd & Partners

runners.spotlight: Hasn't lived up to market expectation in two 6f runs here for his new stable; stamina for 7f has to be taken on trust but he's clearly thought to be well treated.

runners.comment: C&D winner in September; two poor runs and one good run have followed; others are safer
runners.name: Toussarok

quotes.race: Golf At Goodwood Handicap
quotes.quote: Toussarok is going the right way - only out of the first two once in his last seven runs so you can't get more consistent than that. I'll have to see about his upcoming entries - Mark Johnston, trainer.

runners.spotlight: C&D win in September off 6lb lower; one good run and two poor ones have followed; others look more persuasive.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: C&D winner; unplaced in two 0-55s at Southwell last week; blinkers replace a visor
runners.name: Von Krolock

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Von Krolock wants good ground and he loved it out there tonight. He's an ideal horse for here over the winter and there is plenty of improvement in him - Tim Doyle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: C&D winner; ran twice at Southwell last week (7f and 1m), both respectable efforts but without suggesting he is well ahead of his mark; this is a stronger race and others appeal more; blinkers replace a visor.

runners.comment: Yet to win over 7f and recent efforts haven't pointed to an imminent win
runners.name: Poet
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over 6f but he stays this far; recent efforts haven't suggested he is about to add to his tally.

16:30.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Struggled in handicaps for Alice Haynes after maiden win; down in trip/class for new yard
runners.name: Blue Eclipse
runners.spotlight: Struggled in handicaps for Alice Haynes after winning a 7f maiden at Chelmsford in January; down in trip/class ahead of his stable debut; not discounted.

runners.comment: Ran okay in a stronger race over C&D three weeks ago; other pace to deal with today
runners.name: Dapper Gee Gee
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; didn't run badly over C&D three weeks ago and this represents a drop in class; other pace influences on show here though.

runners.comment: C&D win in September; two fair runs for new yard since; easy lead unlikely in this field
runners.name: Groundsman
runners.spotlight: Off the mark with a front-running C&D win in September, his final start for Richard Fahey; two fair efforts for his new yard but unlikely to enjoy his own way up front today.

runners.comment: In good form since headgear went on; close 3rd off this mark latest; respected back at 7f
runners.name: No Knee Never
runners.spotlight: Has not been with James Owen long and he arrives on the up, winning a 6f handicap here (accessories first time) on December 8 and running well for third off this mark at Southwell nine days ago; return to 7f shouldn't be an issue and he is more appealing than many.

runners.comment: 15th win of his long career last week (C&D); wide draw/4lb rise may scupper the follow up
runners.name: Harbour Vision

quotes.race: Stay Safe Players With BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Harbour Vision knows his way round here better than all of us! He jumped well enough but there was plenty of pace and he really settled for me. The gap opened up on the inside and he was away - Taryn Langley, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Age no barrier to success for this admirable 10yo and he lowered the colours of a thriving 3yo over C&D last week; he was given a fine ride on that occasion and a 4lb rise and the widest stall may be enough to scupper the follow up.

runners.comment: Conditions fine and he's on a dangerous mark; can't discount
runners.name: Amaysmont
runners.spotlight: No problem with conditions and he has slipped back down the weights; into the veteran stage now but no suprise were he to better recent efforts.

runners.comment: Placed on her last four starts (all 7f on AW); may prove vulnerable for win purposes again
runners.name: Blue Empress
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; arrives on the back of placed efforts on her last four starts, the last twice behind a progressive 3yo; not ideally drawn and may prove vulnerable for win purposes once again.

runners.comment: Got up late to win at Lingfield (7f) ten days ago; should remain competitive  up just 2lb
runners.name: Fulford Cross
runners.spotlight: Back in form now, following his Lingfield third (1m) with a last-gasp success over 7f back at Lingfield ten days ago; 2lb higher mark shouldn't be insurmountable.

runners.comment: On a good mark judged on her C&D win in April; quiet of late but a revival is possible
runners.name: Fistral Beach
runners.spotlight: Had a purple patch in the spring, winning 7f handicaps at Southwell, Newcastle and here; promising return to action over C&D in September but she hasn't built on that in four subsequent outings; slipped back down the weights though and can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Exposed maiden but he has found his level now and should make another bold bid
runners.name: Bad Habits
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden but having dropped in the weights he has been more competitive in recent starts; one to consider.

17:00.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 40-1 for 7f debut at Southwell when finishing remote after a slow start; best watched
runners.name: Big Moonrise
runners.spotlight: 40-1 for recent Southwell debut over 7f where he finished a remote fourth after starting slowly; one to watch for now.

runners.comment: Attractive and precocious pedigree; interesting newcomer who is worth a market check
runners.name: Caviar Cowboy
runners.spotlight: 55,000gns foal; fifth foal; Zoustar brother to winners Sir Les Patterson (6f/7f AW including 2yo; RPR 103) and Ruggito (Italian 1m/8.7f including 2yo), half-brother to 5f winner Harmony Rose (including 2yo/AW; RPR 96); dam Italian 5f/6f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 98); precocious pedigree and market can guide.

runners.comment: Just touched off on 6f debut; lesser run over 7f since; may well show more here
runners.name: Delinquent
runners.spotlight: Just touched off when odds-on for Pontefract debut over 6f; bred to appreciate an extra furlong at least but he disappointed when upped to this trip at York in September; no surprise if he does much better now.

runners.comment: Both starts over 7f on turf; a sharper test at the trip can suit now switched to AW
runners.name: Man Of Vision
runners.spotlight: Has reared in the stalls in both 7f starts; ran well for a long way on Yarmouth debut in May, behind a subsequent improver, but seemed stretched by the stiff finish at Newmarket next time; gelded since; the lesser test at this trip can suit for yard with fine 2yo record on AW; good claims.

runners.comment: Likely type on pedigree; worth considering if the market is positive
runners.name: Quick Quasar
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; Palace Pier half-brother to winners Meshakel (UAE Group-placed 6f-1m; RPR 105) and Gushing Gold (Listed-placed 7f 2yo; 94); dam 6f/7f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 108); a likely type on pedigree; worth considering if the market is positive.

runners.comment: Well held when long odds-on for 6f debut in an ordinary Newcastle race; should improve
runners.name: Get An Attitude
runners.spotlight: Long odds-on for her recent Newcastle debut over 6f but she made just an average start, unable to go with the more experienced winner in the closing stages; open to improvement but it will be needed; yard also runs Delinquent who has shown more.

runners.comment: Minor form at 7f and 6f; hood fitted; likely of more interest when handicapping
runners.name: Life After Love
runners.spotlight: Minor form over 7f and 6f, faring better on the latter occasion but still some way short of what will be needed here; hood fitted but likely of more interest when handicapping.

17:30.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap

runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick after wins at Newcastle and Southwell; respected in current form
runners.name: Mr Zippi

quotes.race: Midnite Aint Your Grandads Bookie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Zippi's been so well at home and his work has been very good, so it wasn't unexpected. I'm absolutely delighted that he seems to be back to his best. We thought he might improve for the step up in trip because he settles quite well these days. The only stumbling block was whether the race might come too soon, but we've had the all-weather bonus in mind for December, so we felt we had to go for it. He's had a few niggles and a few little problems, nothing major, but it's just been a bit frustrating. He's always worked well, and we've always thought quite a lot of him, so it's nice for him to actually show what he can do now -  Sara Ender, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bids for a hat-trick after 12.5f/1m6f wins at Newcastle and Southwell, belatedly adding to his bumper successes; respected in current form.

runners.comment: Respectable third over C&D last time; won this race last year; enters calculations
runners.name: Moon Over The Sea

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: There was no real pace on paper beforehand. I wasn't going quick where I was but if I'd been going any quicker I'd have taken Moon Over The Sea out of his comfort zone. He's seen the trip out well - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Successful five times at Wolverhampton, including in this race last year; respectable third over C&D last time; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Opened her account in Lingfield event last time for a career-best performance
runners.name: Three On Thursday

prev_owners.owner: Gee Gees Wine Bar & Dylan Cunha

runners.spotlight: Opened her account in Lingfield event (1m2f; won going away) last time for a career-best performance; seems to stay 1m4f; likely player.

runners.comment: Good efforts in May but hasn't fared so well since returning from layoff
runners.name: Guinness Lad
runners.spotlight: Good second twice in May (1m2f, turf) but hasn't fared nearly so well since returning from a layoff; still a maiden.

runners.comment: Gained sole AW win off 7lb higher in January; attractively handicapped
runners.name: Sisterandbrother

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't want to hit the front too soon on Sisterandbrother as he was keen early and he picked them up well. I don't know how strong the race was but it was only his second run over hurdles so he could be a fun summer horse - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Not entirely solid on recent form but has become attractively weighted; gained sole AW win off 7lb higher over C&D in January.

runners.comment: Five-time course winner but balance of recent form doesn't augur very well
runners.name: Starfighter

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter has been a slow burner since he joined us from Ed Walker's and it's just taken a bit of time to get him right. He was rated higher a few years back so hopefully there's bit more improvement there and he'll go on the turf - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

quotes.race: Lester Brunt Wealth Management Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter deserved that he had been frustrating really. He has never really done much wrong, maybe he had been hitting the front a bit early or not quite getting home. Today he went through to the line and there was no doubting his temperament. He could step forward now - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner; however, balance of recent form suggests he's far from certain to take advantage of a handy mark.

runners.comment: Folded tamely on British debut but attracted support and may leave that effort behind
runners.name: Nekazari
runners.spotlight: Ex-French maiden who folded tamely at Lingfield (1m2f) on British debut but attracted major support and is evidently thought capable of a bigger effort; now goes in headgear; interesting contender, especially if the money comes for him again.

runners.comment: Improved form since returned to AW; still unexposed in this sphere; strong contender
runners.name: Krissy
runners.spotlight: Has shown improvement in 1m2f events since returned to AW, winning at Newcastle then solid second (split subsequent scorers) at Lingfield; still unexposed in this sphere and pedigree suggests the return to 1m4f is worth exploring; strong contender.

runners.comment: Three-time course winner but his losing run is mounting up
runners.name: Virtual Hug
runners.owner: Mike Harris Racing & Nikki Evans Racing

prev_owners.owner: Sas Logistics Contracts Ltd Nikki Evans

quotes.race: gowranpark.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Virtual Hug had two lovely runs and he's after learning a lot. His jumping stood to him today. He's not a winter horse and he'll get a good break now. He might come back to Dundalk in February or March - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time course scorer but his losing run is mounting up; below par and hung badly left here in most recent Flat attempt.

runners.comment: Competitively weighted on best efforts but record is 0-21
runners.name: Bloodhound
runners.spotlight: Competitively weighted on best efforts but balance of recent form is less convincing and record of 0-21 cements doubt.

runners.comment: 0-9 for Sir Mark Prescott; sold for 1,600gns since last run
runners.name: Grand Harbour
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in last two starts for Sir Mark Prescott, taking record to 0-9; sold for 1,600gns since; others preferred.

18:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Too green to do himself justice in Southwell maiden; should do better
runners.name: Empirical
runners.spotlight: First foal of an AW winner; prominent in the betting for Southwell maiden (7f) but seemed too green to do himself justice; should do better with the experience under his belt.

runners.comment: Always behind in 1m contest at Lingfield on Monday
runners.name: Jerseygeordie
runners.spotlight: Always behind in 1m contest at Lingfield on Monday; needs sharp improvement turned out quickly.

runners.comment: Lope De Vega colt who is bred to handle this surface; interesting newcomer
runners.name: Lorcas Waltz
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega half-brother to winners Clear Thinking (Australian 5f/6f; RPR 104), Companionship (1m AW 2yo; 82) and General Idea (7f beach; 76); dam Australian 5f-7f scorer (including 2yo/Group 1; 116); this Royal runner is an interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Rather disappointing last time but may yet confirm the form of his debut effort
runners.name: Mythical Bay
runners.spotlight: Rather disappointing at Newcastle (1m) last time but represents notable connections and may yet confirm the form of his Bath effort, which helps to set the standard in this field.

runners.comment: Debutant; has a doubt over the trip but market support should be noted
runners.name: Objector
runners.spotlight: 100,000euros yearling; by Dark Angel; sibling to six winners, notably Angel's Hideaway (6f including 2yo Group 3; RPR 109); dam 5f 2yo winner (82); has a doubt over the trip but market support should be noted.

runners.comment: Likely to be more interesting in handicaps shortly
runners.name: Saxophonic
runners.spotlight: Represents major connections but a couple of eighth-place finishes, latest over C&D, suggest he'll be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.comment: Neck second when favourite for C&D maiden last time; major contender
runners.name: Tewkesbury
runners.spotlight: Closely related to a four-time winner for his connections; has duly shown promise in both outings, neck second to a newcomer when favourite for C&D maiden latest; major contender.

runners.comment: Not out of this on form but his ideal scene may be handicaps soon
runners.name: Turtle Reef
runners.spotlight: Similar efforts in 1m events at Newcastle, beaten just under 5l both times; not out of this on bare form but gives the impression his ideal scene will be handicaps soon.

runners.comment: Always towards the rear in Southwell contest but is the type to do better
runners.name: Von Dutch
runners.spotlight: Always towards the rear in Southwell contest (7f) but is the type to do better, being a Wootton Bassett colt who cost 325,000gns as a yearling.

runners.comment: Recorded a modest RPR in 9.5f event at Wolverhampton
runners.name: Wedonttellthetruth
runners.spotlight: Only sixth of seven, recording a modest RPR, in 9.5f event at Wolverhampton; perhaps one for handicaps in due course.

runners.comment: Prescott filly who should be more interesting when switched to handicaps
runners.name: Campeona
runners.spotlight: Prescott filly who has made no impact in both starts (7f) and is likely to be much more interesting when switched to handicaps.

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Showed some promise in Curragh maiden for Fozzy Stack; open to improvement
runners.name: Lady Dora Mae
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise with seventh-place finish, albeit never landing a blow, in big-field maiden at the Curragh (1m) for Fozzy Stack; sold for 15,000gns since; possibilities with improvement plausible.

runners.comment: Plenty to find on the figures
runners.name: Queen Of Astolat
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced filly who has plenty to find on the figures and should find handicaps more suitable shortly.

18:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: On a losing run and stepping back up in trip isn't enough to earn him the vote
runners.name: Silver Samurai
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive 1

quotes.race: JenningsBet Grey Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: The race worked out perfectly for Silver Samurai as I was able to smuggle him into the race and he has that one kick that proved decisive -  Andrea Atzeni, rider.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Silver Samurai has ability and has been unlucky. It's important to get the timing right with him. He has a strong finish, but sometimes the pace isn't quick enough for him. Nice six-furlong handicaps will be the plan and we'll enter in the Wokingham and see; he handled the track well there last week - Marco Botti, trainer.

runners.spotlight: His losing run has gathered plenty of momentum but he has dropped down the weights and he ran creditably over 7f at Kempton last time; stepping up in trip isn't enough to earn him the vote though.

stable_tour.quote: He is a horse I have always liked and he has done well, winning four times. In fact his win last time out at Newbury maintained his record of winning each season he has raced. He ran well at Ascot earlier this month and seemed so well we felt he should go to Newbury for the Class 2 handicap earlier this month. We have learned that 6f is his trip as they got that stride faster over that trip and he loves to travel in his races. He showed a wonderful turn of foot to win off a mark of 88 and has gone up to 92 now, but I suspect I need a further 5lb if he is to make it into the Wokingham at Royal Ascot. We have a few options for him in the next week or two, notably at Haydock this weekend or Epsom the following week. If things worked out and he won and made it then Royal Ascot would be a great day out, but if not there will be more good days for him this year, particularly now we have finally worked out his trip. 25-05-22

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Ready C&D win 12 days ago when visored for the first time; well in if headgear works again
runners.name: Rajapour
runners.spotlight: Gained his first win for David O'Meara at the 12th attempt when readily seeing off six rivals over C&D 12 days ago (visored first time); 4lb rise manageable if the headgear has a positive effect a second time.

runners.comment: Unexposed and progressive 3yo; interesting contender upped in trip for handicap debut
runners.name: Flame Of Forest
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on his debut effort when winning a 7f novice at Carlisle in May; second, albeit beaten 6l, behind a promising rival in a 1m novice at Newcastle on his return to action in October; open to improvement now handicapping.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs for new yard after a spell in Hong Kong; cheekpieces now tried
runners.name: Kolsai
runners.spotlight: Not shone in two runs for Richard Hughes since returning from Hong Kong; dropped 7lb and now tries cheekpieces but still a risky proposition.

stable_tour.quote: I think he won a pretty strong maiden at Newmarket last season and he could go to the Feilden Stakes at the Craven meeting. I think he's a nice prospect. 06-04-23

runners.comment: 7f win at Newcastle last month; not quite so good one week later and stamina not assured
runners.name: Kindest Nation
runners.spotlight: Back to form with a 7f win at Newcastle last month; came up short under a penalty at Chelmsford one week later; stamina for an extended 1m has to be taken on trust.

stable_tour.quote: She really surprised me last year, not only by how much she grew given she was a small two-year-old but how she improved through the year. She likes give in the ground and we'll try to get some black type with her. She's done well from three to four, so I'm also hopeful she can win a handicap or two along the way. 09-04-25

runners.comment: 11lb lower than when 2nd in the Lincoln Trial here in March; mixed bag since
runners.name: Farasi Lane

prev_owners.owner: M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family
M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Farasi Lane's homework had been brilliant and he was second here last month, which could be considered a career-best and that's amazing for a 6yo to still be improving. That's probably a career-best again and hopefully it shows what we can do with these older horses. There's a 0-90 on Guineas day I've been thinking about, although he might not get in it now - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Can race too freely; beaten a short-head in the Lincoln Trial over C&D in March when rated 11lb higher; generally disappointing since then though and others look safer.

runners.comment: New stable quick to drop him back in trip; not fully exposed just yet
runners.name: Advancing
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Kempton in February (1m); contested some useful handicaps this summer and came up short; sold for 25,000gns in October; drops back in trip on his stable debut and he is not yet fully exposed.

runners.comment: As good as ever with Lingfield 2nd 19 days ago (1m); up 2lb but still looks a major player
runners.name: Sheikh Raj
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden but he has regularly run well in defeat, including a near miss at Lingfield 19 days ago (1m; blinkers first time); up 2lb but that shouldn't prevent another good run.

stable_tour.quote: I've always liked him. He ran a nice race in a maiden at Newmarket last time behind Indian Springs and has a mark of 77. I think he'll be okay once we get him handicapping. He wants a mile, possibly 1m2f. We had him gelded in February and that has helped him. His owners have been with me since I started training, which is nice. 14-05-25

runners.comment: Not at best in two runs this winter; down in weights but has to prove his stamina
runners.name: This Farh
runners.spotlight: Not at his best in two runs this winter; down in the weights but he has to prove his stamina and others look safer.

runners.comment: Course winner and on a winning mark; faded over 7f latest; stamina not assured
runners.name: Packetofbiscuits
runners.owner: A Pot To Pete In Syndicate
runners.spotlight: On a winning mark and his AW win came at this track; attracted support at Kempton 17 days ago (7f) but faded into midfield having made the running; stamina has to be taken on trust.

runners.comment: Flopped at Newcastle last time; earlier C&D third brings him into the reckoning
runners.name: Boubyan
runners.spotlight: Not sure what went wrong at Newcastle last time but prior to that he had run two solid races at this track; each-way shout if bouncing back to form.

runners.comment: Down in the weights but doesn't look to be in the form required to capitalise
runners.name: Enthused

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

runners.spotlight: He has slipped back down the weights but doesn't look in the form required to take this; opposable over this trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost me£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just under£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that out we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

runners.comment: Course winner off this mark; solid 3rd here three weeeks ago (7f); needs more up in class
runners.name: Book Of Life
runners.spotlight: Scored off this mark over 9.5f here in February; third over 7f here three weeks ago, his second run for Pat Morris; more needed back up in class though.

19:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Struggled back from summer break but drops in grade and return of a tongue tie a big plus
runners.name: Fools Rush In
runners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr

quotes.race: Kids Pass Handicap
quotes.quote: Fools Rush In didn't have an ideal start, but he travelled well throughout and did well as he had to come wide. He's a gutsy horse - Harry Davies, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Fools Rush In deserved that, last time we bumped into one and he ran a solid race at Ascot. Today he got into a nice rhythm. I was a bit worried at the two pole as he hit his flat spot but he got out of that and stayed on well - Richard Kingscote, rider.

runners.spotlight: Well beaten in four runs back from a summer break but he's dropped 8lb in the process and is now eligible for a 0-60; as well as the drop in class, the return of a tongue tie (worn for his last six wins) could spark a revival; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to the yard. We've given his wind a little tweak. He has shown some decent form in the past and looks quite well treated. He's declared to have his first run for us at Ripon on Thursday over 6f. He's going to have to race in the same contest as American Star but that's the way it goes sometimes. He might be ok on soft ground and if I didn't have to tweak his wind he'd have been out earlier. 17-04-24

runners.comment: Not at his best last time but drops into a 0-60 and not out of it on this year's peak runs
runners.name: Mbappe
runners.spotlight: Won three times last year; twice placed this summer but his form dipped when only seventh at Kempton last month; now drops into a 0-60 but others are more appealing.

runners.comment: Four wins on AW early in the year; runner-up twice at Brighton in August; absent since
runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.spotlight: Won four times on AW in the first third of 2025, two of them at this track (9.5f); runner-up at Brighton in successive days in August; may come on for this first run since.

runners.comment: Poor form in three runs for this yard; plenty to prove after 171 days off
runners.name: Pacific Prince
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to handicap company at Kempton when last seen in July (1m; 125-1); plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Arrives in good form and could still have more to offer for Kathy Turner; contender
runners.name: The Dark Baron
runners.spotlight: Won over further at Bath and here in the autumn; two solid placed efforts this month; should be in the thick of the action once again.

runners.comment: Little solid form in three maiden/novice runs; blinkers added for handicap debut
runners.name: Summer Evening
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three novice/maiden runs, the last two for this stable after a 452-day absence; blinkers added for this handicap debut; not a solid option.

runners.comment: Two C&D wins this year; on a winning mark and not ruled out back from a short break
runners.name: Lhebayeb
runners.spotlight: Three wins this year, two of them over C&D; flopped in the mud at Bath when last seen but she should be happier back on AW.

runners.comment: C&D win this month; placed at Southwell in his three other handicaps; not fully exposed
runners.name: R P Mcmurphy
runners.spotlight: C&D win earlier in the month; three solid placed efforts at Southwell on either side of the win and he could yet have a bigger run in him.

runners.comment: C&D winner; best run for some time when 2nd at Lingfield ten days ago; contender up 2lb
runners.name: Charlatan
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; ran his best race for some time when second of ten at Lingfield ten days ago (1m); 2lb rise manageable if he can back it up.

runners.comment: Slow-starter; mixed bag since returning to action in September; others look safer
runners.name: Boujee Gold
runners.spotlight: Slow-starter; mixed bag since returning to action in September and others bring more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Should be capable off this mark but her stamina has to be taken on trust
runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.spotlight: Wouldn't judge her too harshly on her latest run in a race for amateur riders but stamina for today's trip has to be taken on trust.

19:30.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Still a maiden but has a fighting chance on bits of form and this is a drop in class
runners.name: Alnayef
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but has a fighting chance on bits of form and this is a drop in class; first success is not out of the question.

stable_tour.quote: He's one we have from John and Thady Gosden and he could potentially be nice - he showed some promise behind Faylaq at Ayr on Sunday. He's big, 16.3hh, and a late-maturing type. He's not very quick but they don't need to be if they keep galloping. 07-05-25

runners.comment: Went close twice this autumn; folded tamely and soundly beaten over C&D last time
runners.name: Fleur De Mer
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs G F Hall Racing
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who went close on two occasions this autumn; however, folded tamely and soundly beaten over C&D last time.

runners.comment: Close second at Southwell on return from break last time; won over C&D in April; player
runners.name: Grand Duchess Olga
runners.spotlight: Close second at Southwell (1m6f) on return from break last time; scored over C&D in April and looks a major player back here.

runners.comment: Holds weak claims on his form for current yard; new trip
runners.name: Oviedo
runners.spotlight: Two wins for previous yard but holds weak claims on his form (at up to 1m4f) for current stable; new trip needs to make a difference.

stable_tour.quote: Some of his form last year was notable, particularly when third to Chaldean in the Group 3 Acomb Stakes at York. He had a nice blowout on his comeback in Listed company at Newcastle in April and, after a near two-month break, he returned on Monday at Redcar to win the Zetland Gold Cup pretty well. Depending what the handicapper does, it would be nice to go to Royal Ascot now for the Hampton Court or Golden Gates. 01-06-23

runners.comment: Dual C&D scorer, including off current mark, and a consistent sort; solid claims
runners.name: Daaris
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer, including off current mark, and a consistent sort; respectable third at Chelmsford most recently; solid claims.

runners.comment: Ran respectably over 1m6f on last Flat attempt but has gained her wins over shorter
runners.name: Appleblossomwhite
runners.spotlight: Well held over hurdles last time; ran respectably over 1m6f on last Flat attempt but has gained her wins over 1m/1m4f.

runners.comment: Handicap debutant who is far from solid on form
runners.name: Dollars Dream
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant who is far from solid on form and needs improvement off his opening mark.

runners.comment: Consistent; ran creditably, amid traffic issues, at Wolverhampton on Monday; in the mix
runners.name: Zooks
runners.spotlight: Consistent mare who has scored twice this year; ran creditably, amid traffic issues, at Wolverhampton (2m) on Monday; in the mix.

runners.comment: May be sharper for latest run (back from break); three-time C&D winner
runners.name: Black Smoke
runners.spotlight: May be sharper with latest effort (back from a break) under his belt; three-time C&D winner who is on a handy mark; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but has frame possibilities on plenty of form
runners.name: Rampant
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has frame possibilities on plenty of form, provided he stays this new trip; seemed unsuited by drop back to 9.5f here yesterday.

runners.comment: Opened his account in Newcastle event most recently; should remain competitive
runners.name: Himself
runners.spotlight: Opened his account in Newcastle event (12.5f) most recently and looks better than the bare form, having idled close home; should remain competitive back up just 2lb.

runners.comment: Only gone up 6lb for two wins this month; drawn wide but still a major player
runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Madness gave me a really good feel up to halfway but the horse who was making it couldn't really take me far enough and he was dossing a bit once in front - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Having tumbled down the weights he has bounced back to form with a bang this month, winning easily at Lingfield before a more hard-fought success over C&D five days later; that latest effort was backed up by the clock and a 2lb rise looks lenient; this is tougher from a wide stall but still holds strong claims.

runners.comment: Two wins this year, the latest a ready success at Southwell last week; good chance up 2lb
runners.name: Zoulu Warrior
runners.spotlight: Progressive sprinter who was winning for the second time when taking a Southwell handicap (6f) with more authority than the winning margin of a neck might indicate last week; 2lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run.

runners.comment: Career best when making all at Kempton (6f) in September; up 6lb & other pace to deal with
runners.name: Early Release
runners.spotlight: Produced a career-best effort when making all at Kempton (6f) 100 days ago; up 6lb for that success though and he is not the only pace influence in this field.

runners.comment: Latest 3rd here (5f) showed he could win races on AW; one to consider back up in trip
runners.name: Sub Thirteen
runners.spotlight: All wins on turf but this month's third here (5f) showed he was capable of winning races on this surface; one to consider now stepping back up in distance.

runners.comment: On a good mark and should be winning soon; perhaps not here from the widest stall though
runners.name: Water Of Leith
runners.owner: Adam Mills And Jonnie Delta Racing
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner; dropped a long way in the weights since October and the money came for him at Newcastle 11 days ago (5f), a race where he weakened in the final 100 yards; widest draw tempers enthusiasm this time.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us as a juvenile and then left for a season before joining us in July after a Carlisle win for Rebecca Menzies. He's in the form of his life and has won twice more for us, rising from 61 to 76 in the handicap. He's far from straightforward but we know his quirks. He must walk to the start and goes in the stalls without a jockey. He was carried badly left and promoted to third in the stewards' room at Windsor last Thursday. He stayed down in the area and ran another good race on Saturday when fourth at Ascot, which more than paid for his trip. He thrives on his racing and could be a Bronze Cup hope at Ayr next week. 12-09-22

runners.comment: Back to form with front-running 2nd at Chelmsford this month; other pace to deal with here
runners.name: Moostar

quotes.race: Up To £25 Back With Bresbet Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Moostar was pretty good today. Speaking to Daryll [Holland, trainer] beforehand, he just said she is more of a galloper than a filly who quickens so I made use of that stride. She's still learning. I felt she wasn't doing a tap in front once I asked her a question and hopefully there's plenty more to come - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Back to form when second of nine at Chelmsford (6f; tongue tie first time) 23 days ago; made the running on that occasion and she will do well to dominate today's field.

runners.comment: Infrequent winner; hopes rest on the drop back to 6f sparking something extra
runners.name: Simply Blue
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 21 starts; edging down the weights but needs today's drop back to 6f to give him a lift.

stable_tour.quote: We've loved this horse since we saw him and he's ticked every box twice at home. He's got a big engine and a lot of ability. He made his debut at Chester but wasn't able to show what he's about. He missed the break and got stuck out the back -  it can happen round there. He then went for a Leicester novice where he ran a belter to be denied on the line. I'm seriously considering Royal Ascot for him, either the Windsor Castle or the Norfolk. He's probably more of a 6f horse but I wouldn't be afraid of a stiffer five either. He's got an exceptional mind and is everywhere you need him to be in his work. I think a lot of him. 30-05-24

runners.comment: Too free over 8.6f on recent stable debut; drops in trip with a point to prove
runners.name: Darn Hot Time
runners.spotlight: Raced too freely on her stable debut here two weeks ago (8.6f); drops back to a sprint trip with enough to prove.

runners.breeder: Miss S Sands & Mrs Lynette Andersen
runners.comment: Runner-up on last three starts; not sure to reverse latest C&D form with Twilight Madness
runners.name: Clover Time
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden but he has finished second on his last three starts, chasing home Twilight Madness over C&D 19 days ago; drawn even wider than his old rival today and maiden status set to remain intact.

runners.comment: Promising stable debut here 19 days ago but he will need more to come out on top today
runners.name: Cali Case
runners.spotlight: 0-6 in Ireland; promising start for new yard when fourth of nine over C&D 19 days ago; that form will need bettering if he is to come out on top.

runners.comment: Not at his best on last two starts but this should be run to suit & he's feasibly weighted
runners.name: Ten Club
runners.spotlight: Not seen to best effect on his last two starts but he's on a feasible mark and he should get a good pace to aim at; likely to be arriving on the scene late and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Sold for 2,400gns this month; on a winning mark but others appeal more
runners.name: Fletchers Dream

prev_owners.owner: S Mcmillan, S Boyle & A D Brown

runners.spotlight: 6f win at Newcastle off this mark in September; not quite so good in three runs since and needs a full revival starting out for his new stable (sold for 2,400gns this month).

runners.comment: Good run here on Monday and better expected back up at his preferred trip
runners.name: Em Jay Kay
runners.spotlight: 6f win at Newcastle last month; some solid efforts in defeat since, including over 5f here last week, and high on the list from a good draw back over his best trip.

12:05.race_name: Paddy Power I Have No Idea What Day It Is 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle

runners.breeder: Mrs F S Williams & Newsells Park Stud
runners.comment: Ability in three middle-distance maidens but this still looks a big ask on hurdling debut
runners.name: Bartholomew
runners.spotlight: Positives to take from his three runs in middle-distance maidens but this still looks a big ask on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Dual winner at 1m but has regressed and recently changed hands for 2,400gns
runners.name: Crest Of Light
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner in Britain at about 1m but has regressed and recently changed hands for 2,400gns; makes no appeal in a maiden of this nature.

runners.comment: Trained by Willie Mullins when falling late on at Auteuil in March; showed ability
runners.name: Dead Cert
runners.spotlight: Trained by Willie Mullins when falling late on at Auteuil in March (1m7f, heavy); he wasn't going to win that race but showed ability and it will be interesting to gauge the confidence behind him with the yard doubly represented.

runners.comment: Won four times for Sir Mark Prescott and posted RPRs in the 90s
runners.name: Deep Water Bay
runners.spotlight: Bought for only 12,000gns despite winning four times for Sir Mark Prescott and posted RPRs in the 90s; stayed 2m on the Flat so there are no stamina issues for hurdling.

runners.comment: Limited Flat maiden who finished well held on hurdling debut at Cork when 33-1
runners.name: Far Eclipse
runners.spotlight: Limited Flat maiden who finished well held on hurdling debut at Cork when 33-1.

runners.comment: Maiden winner for Aidan O'Brien but lost his way and sold on for 18,000gns
runners.name: Genealogy

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant

quotes.race: William Hill Betting Done Properly Maiden
quotes.quote: Genealogy had a good run first day at the Curragh. Ryan gave him a fantastic ride here from a bad draw. He's a massive horse and whatever he does this year will be a bonus. He could be one for the Eyrefield Stakes or the Criterium de Saint Cloud late in the year - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bought for 18,000gns out of Aidan O'Brien's yard, for which he won a 1m maiden at two; lost his form in just two starts this year; has been gelded.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden at Punchestown before finishing fifth in the Autumn Stakes at Newmarket. He's ready to start at a mile or a mile and a quarter and we think he could get further in time. 07-04-25

runners.comment: Looks held by Manoir De Mirande and Ole Ole on their Punchestown clash
runners.name: Hardy Stuff
runners.spotlight: Didn't look straightforward on his debut at Cork but ran better in the hood at Punchestown (soft/heavy), finishing a 5.5l fourth; did finish behind Ole Ole and would have been behind Manoir De Mirande had that one not come down.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: 1m6f winner in France; let down by his jumping at Cork, though the ground was testing
runners.name: Kizlyar
runners.spotlight: 1m6f winner in France (good to soft) and recruited for 110,000euros; let down by his jumping when only 7-2 at Cork (soft to heavy; behind Ole Ole) but should have learned from that and these conditions could be more favourable.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Fougeray De La Ferronniere Et De Mirande
runners.comment: French winner who would probably have won at Cork had he not come down late on
runners.name: Manoir De Mirande
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner in France on very soft ground; would probably have made a winning debut for these connections had he not come down late on at Cork (soft to heavy); strong in the market that day and could be useful.

runners.comment: Went 3-6 for Roger Varian, showing smart form (1m4f); purchased for 120,000gns
runners.name: Munsif

quotes.race: Fleet Finders Supports The National Horseracing College EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: On paper it looked an easy opportunity unless the Charlie Johnston horse with a nice pedigree was something special. Munsif popped out and used his experience, he probably wasn't doing an awful lot in front and I just had to keep him up to his work. He looks like a horse who's going upwards. I thought he handled the quick ground at Nottingham but it's probably a little bit quicker today and he might just prefer a little bit kinder ground - Jim Crowley, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Went 3-6 for Roger Varian and recorded a smart RPR of 97 in winning a 1m4f handicap on his penultimate start; joined a respected outfit for 120,000gns and couldn't rule him out.

stable_tour.quote: We've been very pleased with him this season. He's won three times from five runs, most recently at Doncaster, and was also placed at York in May. He's in the Old Rowley Cup at Newmarket on October 10 and that's where he'll go if he runs again this season. If not, he'll be put away and we'll look forward to him as a fun four-year-old next season. 24-09-25

runners.comment: In close pursuit of Manoir De Mirande when that one came down at the last at Cork
runners.name: Ole Ole
runners.spotlight: Placed in all three runs over hurdles and was in close pursuit of Manoir De Mirande when that one came down at the last at Cork 20 days ago; this gelding is clearly up to winning a maiden.

runners.comment: Won at a low level on the Flat; held by a few of these on his Cork run three weeks ago
runners.name: Ray Gun
runners.spotlight: Won at a low level on the Flat; held by some of these on his Cork run three weeks ago.

runners.comment: Very opposable on what he's shown in one Flat run and two over hurdles; outclassed
runners.name: Rua Mor
runners.spotlight: Very opposable on what he's shown in one Flat run and two over hurdles; outclassed.

runners.comment: Won a 1m novice for James Ferguson but well beaten in two handicaps for that yard
runners.name: Wolfpack
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m novice for James Ferguson but well beaten in two handicaps for that yard; joined this top stable for 6,500gns and would be a surprise winner of this.

runners.comment: Dual 1m2f winner for Richard Hannon; limited appeal in a maiden of this strength
runners.name: Concert Party
runners.spotlight: Won two of her seven races for Richard Hannon, both over 1m2f; wasn't any great shakes though and was sold on for 13,000gns; limited appeal in a maiden of this strength.

runners.comment: Limited on the Flat and 80-1 when tailed off on hurdling debut at Punchestown
runners.name: Dream Angel

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.spotlight: Limited on the Flat and 80-1 when tailed off on hurdling debut at Punchestown.

runners.comment: Emerged from off the pace to win a 1m4f soft-ground maiden in France
runners.name: Dschingis Desire
runners.spotlight: Emerged from off the pace to win a 1m4f soft-ground maiden in France and has since joined powerful connections; stable won this with a filly in 2016; market informative.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner but others in here had superior form in that sphere
runners.name: Kashel Spring
runners.spotlight: 2-8 on the Flat for Joseph O'Brien and left that yard for 26,000euros; others in here had superior form in that sphere.

runners.comment: Two wins for a top French Flat yard and was recruited for 185,000euros
runners.name: Michonne

prev_owners.owner: Craig Bernick, Hubert De Burgh & Stamford Bloodstock

runners.spotlight: Bought for 185,000euros out of a top French Flat yard for which she signed off with wins at 1m3f and 2m; should have a bright future over hurdles.

runners.comment: Plied trade at a low level on the Flat but has fared surprisingly well in maiden hurdles
runners.name: Searcog
runners.spotlight: Plied her trade at a low level on the Flat but has fared surprisingly well in maiden hurdles at Fairyhouse and Navan; still looks vulnerable in a race of this nature.

runners.comment: Reserve; made it 0-7 on the Flat when recently beaten in a 1m4f AW maiden
runners.name: Palmezzano
runners.spotlight: Reserve; 0-6 on the Flat for Joseph O'Brien, best run when second in a 1m2f handicap; that's ordinary form and was recently only fourth in an AW maiden on stable debut.

12:37.race_name: Paddy Power From The Horses Mouth Podcast Beginners Chase
