runners.comment: Smart novice hurdler but has become disappointing; offered little on recent chase debut
runners.name: Bottlersecret

quotes.race: O'Driscoll's Irish Whiskey Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Bottler'secret is a lovely, straightforward horse. He races lazily, which you love in a horse coming off the Flat. He jumped really well and the cheekpieces just helped him travel a bit better. He went to the line really well and hopefully there's more to come. I wouldn't say he has to have the ground this soft ? it was important on the Flat because he probably just lacked a gear. I'd say he'll go Punchestown and the timing is nice with the early Easter - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Winning Fair Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Bottler'secret is a nice horse. For his first day he jumped well and the further he went the better he got. He's in the Triumph. I don't know if he will go there, if he had a bit more experience, he would definitely go - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Bathshack Maiden
quotes.quote: Bottler'secret really went on that ground. He was one we kept for Galway and it worked out really beautifully. This was always the plan and we will see where we go from here. He is probably a 1m2f to 1m4f horse - Ciaran Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Only narrowly beaten by Kargese in a Grade 1 novice hurdle but has become rather disappointing on the Flat and over hurdles since then and now on a losing run of 11; offered little on his recent chase debut.

stable_tour.quote: Could potentially go for the Listed ?100,000 handicap hurdle over two and a half miles at Leopardstown, stepping up in trip. He worked at Navan last week with blinkers on and we might use them. 21-12-24

We were a little disappointed with him at Cheltenham, where he was very rusty. He's very laid-back and I think he'll sharpen up plenty for the run. Good ground also probably caught him out over the trip - he handles the ground fine but that combined with the trip was a touch sharp. On softer ground we'll probably keep him to two miles. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner with a mark of 135; could easily run well despite his absence
runners.name: Jamess Gate

quotes.race: Race Displays Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: We might enter James's Gate for the Coral Cup or maybe even one of the novice races; we'll see how he is. He seemed to jump the last hurdle perfectly but landed on his hind ones first, awkwardly. He jumped really well. It was the only hurdle that was any bit of a blip. We are very pleased with him. He's got a bit of class - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Punchestown Festival 2025 Tickets On Sale Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought we had Jame's Gate back last year but he had a few minor setbacks. He's very fragile and Martin (Brassil) and the team have done an incredible job to get him back again. I'd like to think he'd make his mark at graded level but everything has to stay in place - Ricky Doyle, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Third in the 2022 Champion Bumper when trained by Willie Mullins; won twice over hurdles last winter to earn a mark of 135 and wouldn't put it past him to run well despite his absence.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't arrived back yet and I'm not sure the word is good on him. I think he might miss the season. 07-11-22

runners.comment: Useful hurdler but struggled in some strong handicaps last season; chase debut
runners.name: Kings Hill

quotes.race: thurles.ie Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Kings Hill needed a horse to go with him. He got there at his ease and he learned plenty being out in front like he was. He will want further on nice ground. His time of year is coming and it's good to get that out of the way - Paul Gilligan, trainer

runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler but struggled in some strong handicaps last season and looks up against it at this level on chase debut; the tongue-tie is new.

runners.comment: Lightly-raced hurdler but smart; no match for Kopek Des Bordes on his chase debut
runners.name: Lovely Hurling

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Supporting Kill GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lovely Hurling seems to be improving and is one to look forward to. I'm not sure what the plan is, he looks like one who can step up in grade. He has only run on soft ground so I don't know how he will handle better ground, but he has plenty of size and scope. He would get you out of bed in the morning - Colm Murphy, trainer

runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 6yo with a bright future ahead of him; no match for Willie Mullins-trained superstars in his last two races, chasing home Final Demand in a 2m4f Grade 1 hurdle in May and then Kopek Des Bordes on his switch to fences at Navan (2m1f); appeals as one who will come into his own over further but still commands considerable respect.

runners.comment: Dual Grade 1 winner over hurdles; beaten by a smart mare on her recent chase debut
runners.name: Kargese

prev_owners.owner: R Lavillenie, Ecurie Thierry Cypres & Fils, J Louis Da Silva

quotes.race: William Hill County Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kargese is tough. You saw her here last year then she went on to Aintree. Usually four-year-olds aren't able to do that sort of thing. She has come out again this year and she is as tough as nails and is as tough as anything that I have ever seen. We thought she was nicely handicapped. We thought maybe all last year's four-year-olds were better handicapped than this year's juveniles so we said we would take our chance and they have run well. Mentally she is so tough as well. She can do that and you can bring her home and she will eat and drink. That is what stands to her. She was too keen at Ascot, but I wanted to get a run into her and it was going to be very hard to bring her here without a run. We did (intend to bring her back after Christmas) as she was so hard on herself last season. I didn't want her for the autumn. I wanted her for the spring and we gave her every chance. You saw how hard she raced last season and she is hard enough on herself in every race so we felt better to give her an easier autumn then concentrate on the spring. I'm going to celebrate today and then we will decide what we are going to do. Normally I go to Punchestown, but I would have to look if there is something either at Ayr or maybe Aintree - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Champion Four Year Old Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Kargese was really hard on herself in Aintree so that was a tremendous performance to come back and win here. To see where she was turning from home, Paul certainly got his fractions right there and got the jump right at the last. I think she deserved that after the way she ran in Aintree. She is big enough to jump a fence. I'd imagine she will stay over hurdles - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: McCann FitzGerald Spring Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Kargese was too keen with Danny at Christmas. The plan today was to make the running but Mark Walsh jumped out and made it. His horse was galloping and Danny settled the filly in. She was much more settled today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 1 winner over hurdles and added last year's County Hurdle at the Cheltenham Festival; came up well short when a shade of odds-on for her recent chase debut at Cork (soft) but the winner Kala Conti is a smart mare; should have learned from that experience and will be hard to beat in receipt of weight from her male rivals.

stable_tour.quote: She was a very good juvenile and progressed again last season to win the County Hurdle. She's always been keen to get on with things and is a free-going mare who might be suited by fences. We've yet to fully decide what to do with her, but she could go chasing. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Queen Mother Champion Chase winner in 2024 but regressive since; set to struggle
runners.name: Captain Guinness

quotes.race: BetMGM Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with Captain Guinness. He has run an absolute blinder. He is such a warrior and it was brilliant to see. He has had a disappointing season, but it was brilliant seeing him coming back to himself there - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Captain Guinness travelled incredibly and jumped really well. The hill felt like a long hill today! I knew El Fabiolo was out of the equation but there was still quite a long way to go. It does change your brain a little bit, but you are still just trying to ride from fence to fence. Although he was beaten a long way, he ran a really good race here last year behind an incredibly talented horse, and when you are riding for Henry around here this week he does just get them spot on, so I was very, very hopeful coming into the race - Rachael Blackmore, rider, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Fortria Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Captain Guinness jumped really well and I thought that was his best performance for a while. He made lengths at every fence and I love the way he picked up to the line. We've entered him in the Tingle Creek and it will be considered - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted. We came here hoping we'd hit the frame and we have. It was a brilliant run and Captain Guinness jumped great and the winner was just too good for us - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Sean P. Muldoon & Patrick F. Gormley Fortria Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Captain Guinness is a really good horse and was giving away plenty of weight. We would love to win a Grade 1 with him. We'll give him an entry in the Tingle Creek, he really seemed to enjoy it around there last year when he was third - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Captain Guinness stuck at it well. I was worried about the ground but it looked a good opportunity. We won't be going to Cheltenham this year - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Poplar Square Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Captain Guinness settled really well which is key to him and it was just what we wanted. He jumped brilliantly and we're back on track. I would imagine Leopardstown at Christmas would be part of the plans - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN Supporting Laois GAA Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: I hope Captain Guinness can continue the way he's going. His jumping looked deadly and Rachael said that the ground is very testing and he will be even better on nicer ground. Christmas just feels like it's going to come too soon for him, we might go for a nice race at Naas in early January. Touch wood, we can head then for the Irish Arkle at Leopardstown - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I suppose it was a bit of a surprise, but he has been working well and went well in a schooling race recently. I thought he might have needed his first run, as most of mine do, but he jumped great and I'm delighted with him. Who knows what would have happened had the favourite not fallen, but Rachael [Blackmore] said he picked up really well from the last - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Captain Guinness

runners.spotlight: Durable sort with six chase wins; career-best when winning Grade 1 Queen Mother Champion Chase at Cheltenham in 2024; not at his best last season but ended campaign with solid efforts behind Marine Nationale at both Cheltenham and Punchestown; pulled up behind Found A Fifty on return at Navan; well beaten in this race last year; veteran likely set to struggle.

stable_tour.quote: We could potentially start him back in the Fortria at Navan, or the Hilly Way at Cork is also an option. He hasn't won since the Champion Chase in 2024 but had some great runs in the end last season, it just took him a while to come to himself. He's had an atrial fibrillation a couple of times in the past, but seems great now. 11-11-25

His two runs this season have been very encouraging. First time out he beat some smart rivals in the Grade 2 Fortria Chase at Navan, his first success at that level. His second race was another good run when second to Blue Lord in the Grade 1 Paddy's Rewards Club Chase at Leopardstown over Christmas. He hasn't run since but I'm delighted with how he's working and the plan is to go for the Champion Chase, where he should run well. 01-03-23

runners.comment: Pulled up in this race last year but beat Majborough last time so has to be considered
runners.name: Found A Fifty

quotes.race: BAR 1 Betting Hilly Way Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Found A Fifty had fitness on his side, we knew we had him fit today and the way the rain fell it suited us. It's great to win those pots. Today might have been our day just to catch the favourite napping. He's a great horse at that level; that's his level. He's in at Christmas, but we'll talk to Noel and Valerie Moran to see what they want to do. Majborough made a few mistakes in fairness, so that might be our Gold Cup today. It's nice to win the race as well because I haven't won it before. - Gordon Elliott, Trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Fortria Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Two miles on that ground is right up Found A Fifty's alley, and probably two and a half miles on better ground. It was a good performance and I'm delighted for Noel [Moran], who has been hitting the crossbar all weekend here. It's great to get a winner for him here. He jumped brilliantly and we will pick and choose his races over different trips going forward - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Jack McInerney Memorial Fairyhouse Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Grade 2 or 3 is probably Found A Fifty's level and we'll keep him at that class next season and he should win loads of races. In fairness to Noel and Valerie, they let us take our time with him and that really suited him today. It was a good performance and that trip seems to suit him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Fortria Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Jack said Found A Fifty didn't feel as good today as when he last rode him. He thought down the back he was going flat out, then he probably made up too much ground from the fifth-last to the third-last. He just stopped in front. But that was a fair performance and he's a smart horse. He won't run in the John Durkan, I would say we'll go to Leopardstown at Christmas for the 2m1f Grade 1 and work from there - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bottlegreen Ladies Day 2024 Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance to give a stone to the second horse and Found A Fifty had a good blow. I suppose we will have to look at a race like the Durkan, but that's the level we're at with him. He's settling better and the way he jumps we could come back to two miles. He's a good horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very messy at the start and I collided in the air at the first with Charlie Deutsch's horse. We probably didn't go as hard as I thought we were going to go and I was always travelling, then down the back we really pressed on. I was happy enough to let them go and I probably ended up there a bit too soon to be honest, but Found A Fifty was very good. He hasn't missed a beat all season. He's a great horse. A tough horse. He's versatile. He stays two and a half but a strong run two is fine for him - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Eventco Marquees Ltd. Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Found A Fifty is a good horse. He got very revved up last year and he could blow his top, but Jack was delighted with the way he settled. Normally you might be glad to see those fences taken out, but when you saw the way he jumped I was hoping the opposite! I love the way he quickened down the straight. He's in the Drinmore so we'll see - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.spotlight: Started last season with Grade 2 wins at Down Royal and Navan but pulled up in this contest; last of five finishers in Champion Chase before winning 2m4f Grade 2 at Fairyhouse; never involved in Down Royal Grade 1 on reappearance; left that form behind when landing the Fortria at Navan; took advantage of Majborough's jumping errors when landing the Hilly Way at Cork on latest; contender.

stable_tour.quote: He's a dual Grade 1 winner. He's entered in the Grade 1 at Down Royal on Saturday and I'm tempted by that. Going over three miles will open a lot more doors for him and could bring about a little bit more improvement. I do think he'll stay. If he doesn't go to Down Royal, the Fortria at Navan would be the obvious option, but I do want to try the 3m experiment at some stage. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Probably not up to this level; uphill task over this trip against specialist two-milers
runners.name: Hercule Du Seuil

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud Sponsors Of Irish Racing Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It was a very good performance. Lucid Dreams kept him honest the whole way and Mark had to go to plan B and drop him in behind. Hercule De Seuil jumped well when Mark needed him to over the last four fences. I haven't decided if we'll go further with him but if the weather stays dry, we might get another run into him. We might give him a mid-season break then and come back in the spring. I'd rather keep to the minimum trip but he could go out to two and a half. Mark felt he maybe doesn't want the ground as soft as it was today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Group Irish EBF Kilbegnet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Hercule Du Seuil is surprising us all the time and seems to be improving with every run. He's very sharp and likes getting on with it. He seems to really like his new job. I have a feeling there is more improvement to come from him as well. I'm not sure he's a real winter horse but we'll keep going as long as we can with him and try to find something suitable for him now. Hopefully he can continue to surprise us - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness Open Gate Brewery Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Mark [Walsh] thinks Hercule Du Seuil is settling and learning to relax. That will help him see out longer trips and have more at the end of his races - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Join The Tipperary Supporter's Club (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a weak race. Hercule du Seuil is a forward-going horse and so we made the running and nothing really came to me. There is an engine there - he was very free last year, but is starting to settle now and is growing up with every run - Mark Walsh, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won five novice chases in a row in 2023 including two at Grade 3 level before fine runs in defeat in Grade 1 company; below best in just two runs last season but emerged from 156-day absence to land 2m5f Killarney Grade 3 contest in late May, keeping on strongly to outstay stablemate and favourite Blood Destiny; kept on closing stages when third behind Found A Fifty in the Fortria on return; uphill task over this trip against specialist two-milers.

stable_tour.quote: He is a winner at Navan and seems to like the place so it makes sense to run in the rescheduled Fortria Chase on Monday. We'll see how he goes in that before planning where to go next. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Top-class 2m novice chaser last season but he is prone to errors in jumping department
runners.name: Majborough

quotes.race: BAR 1 Betting Hilly Way Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I was disappointed with Majborough's jumping. It didn't hold together going down the back and he paid the price for that. I was hoping he'd jump a lot better. But there you are, it's a bit disappointing, but hopefully he can improve for later in the season. I'm hoping that run will bring him on. He just needs to improve his jumping to be competitive at that level. We'll look at Christmas with him if he recovers well from this race - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Majborough is huge but light framed and the moment he stepped off the lorry at home I thought he could be some article. Looking at Fact To File and then at him, there are similar attributes. He's only five and a summer's grass will help him come back bigger and stronger. I'd imagine you'd have to look at the Champion Chase possibly but he could go up in trip as he seems easy enough to ride. If he keeps jumping like that he could be scary - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with Majborough to finish third after the three mistakes he made. So we know he has a huge engine but we've got to get his jumping right. While I'm disappointed not to win, we're happy that we have a horse with an engine. I'm surprised that he did that but that's what can happen in the heat of battle here. He seems fine - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That [jump at the third last] sort of put it to bed. I was surprised Mark [Walsh, jockey] was in the position he was jumping the second, third and fourth, but he was happy enough that Majborough wanted to be there. He's always been a standout to me. Mark said he gave him a squeeze coming up to the winning post and he had plenty in the tank, which is a fair thing to say after running at that pace over two miles and a furlong around here. All he was doing was putting in an extra stride to be very safe. Any time he met it right he was picking up lengths. We'll have to jump a bit better as we'd want to be winging every fence to match Sir Gino because he's a huge talent - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Majborough was very good. He made a few little mistakes as a novice would, and he had to do it the hard way in front, but he fairly motored over the last two fences when Paul [Townend] came to him on Tullyhill, and was very slick at them. I couldn't be happier. Fences were always going to be the making of him and that was a great introduction," Walsh added. "He's not a slow horse and he has plenty of gears, but he'll stay too - Mark Walsh, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm surprised at his price, 6-1. I expected him to be favourite. Majborough was my pick of this race. All of mine have been improving over the season for the second run and I couldn't get him out over Christmas before the Dublin Racing Festival. We were worried about that but obviously he needed the run and Mark learned an awful lot about him. He came back in and said 'the next day I'm going to make all the running' and that was the plan today. He was fifth, sixth the whole way around but that's how strong the pace was, that he couldn't even make it when he wanted to. The two of those [Majborough and Kargese] I thought were going to be first and second but the fact Storm Heart finished fifth just shows how fast the early pace was. When Majborough came into the yard and they told me this is our Triumph Hurdle horse this year, I'm looking at him and thought, he's a Gold Cup horse, a three-mile chaser. Physically, that's what he looked like. That'll be a few years down the road, we'll let him go novice chasing first - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won 2024 Triumph Hurdle; top-class 2m novice chaser last season, winning the Arkle at Leopardstown by 9l; blundered severely at the last two fences when third in Arkle at Cheltenham, rallying well in closing stages; romped home at Punchestown, despite jumping sharply to the left at last two fences; jumping issues evident when runner-up to Found A Fifty in Hilly Way on return; will take beating if the flaws in his technique can be ironed out.

stable_tour.quote: I've always thought the Hilly Way at Cork would be a nice starting point for his season, so that's where we're going to go. I was disappointed with how he jumped in the Arkle but he was much better in that department at Punchestown. I'm training him as a Champion Chase contender. He'll start off at Cork, and then we'll be looking at Leopardstown at Christmas and the Dublin Racing Festival after that. He looks great and I've been very happy with him since he's come back in. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Reigning champion 2m chaser is the one to beat but started last season very slowly
runners.name: Marine Nationale

quotes.race: William Hill Champion Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Marine Nationale is a horse of a lifetime. He seems like he's been around forever but that's only his 12th run, we've had him since he was a 4yo. He's improved since Cheltenham. Badsworth Boy was eight, nine and ten when he won three Champion Chases, the only horse to win three, so his plenty of time - Barry Connell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: BetMGM Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Marine Nationale started in Naas in a Grade 2, and progressed with two good runs at Leopardstown - he was coming all the time. If you go back and look at his career, three runs - won an ordinary maiden hurdle, then improved a stone to win the Royal Bond, improved another stone to win here. He loves this place and comes alive here. We were very confident coming today but understated, because I was too confident the last day and didn't want to do that again. He travels, he jumps - he's everything you want in a Champion Chaser - Barry Connell, owner-trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: On a bit of better ground, with the hill at Cheltenham, Marine Nationale will be a better horse again. I thought I might get to Solness coming down to the last but the ground is probably just a bit softer than he would ideally like. He's run an absolute cracker - Sean Flanagan, jockey.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The winner was very good. I was happy though with Marine Nationale, though. He didn't meet the first two right, but once he warmed to it I thought his jumping was good. He probably lacked a a bit of experience. Other than not winning the race I was very happy. The first two were well clear of the rest. We'll go to Leopardstown at Christmas and build for the Champion Chase after that. I don't see any reason why we shouldn't. We would like to have won but other than that he acquitted himself well - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power From The Horses Mouth Podcast Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: As you've seen there, Marine Nationale's jumping is nothing to be worried about. He was foot perfect. He winged everything, he got in tight to one down the back but he was very clever doing so and didn't touch a twig. I went a nice gallop in front, he was probably a bit keener today than he's ever been on his first run in a while. He was lit up a bit but it was very straightforward, he's just a class act. He's having a good blow, I imagine he'll come on plenty for it - Michael O'Sullivan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Marine Nationale is unlike any other horse we've had before - they were mainly stayers, this is a quick horse, he's probably a Group 1 horse on the Flat, and we might get around to that at some stage. But today was his day. He's had five runs and won all five. His jockey is a superstar. I think we'll come back here for the Arkle next year. Those are my initial thoughts at this period in time - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Royal Bond Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Marine Nationale travelled away and jumped well, he was awkward at the last, and that was the first time he has ever been off the bridle. I didn't know what he would do off the bridle but he showed that he was tough. I thought the ground was gone for him. He'll improve again - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Festival 2023 On Sale Now Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I don't think Marine Nationale missed a beat in terms of his jumping and is having a good blow afterwards. He wasn't as impressive as he was in his bumpers, but did what he had to do. He could probably do with another run and may go for a Grade 3 in Navan (For Auction Novice Hurdle on November 13), with a view to going for the Royal Bond Novice Hurdle at Fairyhouse (on December 4) after that, if he's still on track - Barry Connell, trainer-owner

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Race Services (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Marine Nationale did what I expected and probably hasn't done any more than he did at Punchestown. They were proper winter horses at Punchestown and this was a summer bumper, but it's nice to confirm that his debut wasn't a flash in the pan. He has a relaxed temperament, which is a big plus, and he looks a decent prospect. He was in Sam Curling's so has plenty jumping done - we bought him before Sam had planned to run him in a four-year-old point-to-point. We'll look for a maiden hurdle somewhere. In the back of my head is the Royal Bond, if we can get a maiden hurdle and maybe a Grade 3 beforehand. He'll go on soft ground but I'd say he mightn't be a winter-ground horse. If everything went to plan he could go to the Dublin Racing Festival, and if the dream was still alive then Cheltenham. You have to think that way until something beats him - Barry Connell, owner/trainer.

runners.spotlight: Reigning champion 2m chaser progressed well last season, culminating in wide-margin (left clear last) win in Champion Chase at Cheltenham and beat Captain Guinness 6l in four-finisher Grade 1 Champion Chase at Punchestown, clearing away from the last in good style; begins this season as the one to beat but it's worth bearing in mind he was well below his best on last season's return and finished 4.5l third behind Solness in this contest.

stable_tour.quote: He's come out of the Dublin Racing Festival in excellent form. He's improving 10lb every time he runs over fences as he's effectively a novice. That was his fifth chase run, and the winner's 17th. He did the donkey work of chasing down Solness and I think he'll come on for it. He's a course-and-distance winner on the Old course over hurdles, and his temperament is bombproof. He's the best Irish challenger in the race, although whether we beat Jonbon is another matter. He's in great nick at home. 20-2-25

runners.comment: Won two G1s over C&D last season, including this race; goes well fresh; leading player
runners.name: Solness

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I could see Solness running a big race in the Champion Chase. He'll jump and go and they'll have to come and get to him to beat him. That's the way he likes to run. Aggressive tactics worked, he jumped brilliantly and I thought what he did from the last to the line showed real tenacity because he was there to be shot at the whole way. He has a will to win, and Danny got a breather into him between the third-last and the second-last and that was probably the winning of the race in the end. He just keeps going forward - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: At one stage I was planning to run Solness in a maiden at Dundalk last Friday, but we decided to supplement him. We thought he had a real live each-way chance but the ground was a little bit slower than he maybe ideally likes. We said we'd go as wide as we can to get the best strip we can - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Fortria Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Solness ran great. He's been really consistent over the last while. The ground will probably be getting a bit too soft for him in the coming weeks. While the ground stays dry, he will stay on the go. We will see, he might go to the Hilly Way too if he has his ground - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Kerry Group Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Solness travelled well the whole way and toughed it out when the other horse came to him. He is a class horse - Sean Corby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Solness had a nice run first two when he was very keen. In a stronger race we would probably drop him in, but if there was no gallop today he was going to let him bowl along. He's a very good jumper and he likes soft ground - Brendan Powell, assistant traibner

runners.spotlight: Vastly improved under forcing tactics to land pair of Grade 1s over C&D last season, including when seeing off Gaelic Warrior and Marine Nationale in this corresponding race; no match for Marine Nationale at both Cheltenham and Punchestown, not fluent at times on latter occasion; however, goes well fresh and won't hang around on the front end, so could exploit any race-rustiness or jumping flaws from market leaders.

stable_tour.quote: He'll potentially start off in the Hilly Way along with Banbridge, but he's in the Tingle Creek as well, so we'll see what the ground is like in those places. Hopefully, we'll have a run somewhere before Leopardstown over Christmas. He had a great season last time, winning a couple of Grade 1s, and hopefully he can get back to the same form. 23-11-25

runners.comment: Progressive mare last season; 4-6 over fences; 2nd in last season's Arkle; bit to find
runners.name: Only By Night

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: My first runner for Robcour and delighted. Only By Night was game at the finish. We're not sure what races she'll take in on the way to  the mares' chase at Cheltenham, I suppose the John and Chich Fowler Chase at Fairyhouse January (2m4f) is an option, I've not thought a whole lot beyond here but it's a nice start - Gavin Cromwell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Only By Night ran a great race and I'm really happy with her. I don't have an idea what we'll do with her next; this was the plan - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Agatha Christie Mares' Novices' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The dream still goes on. The Mares' Chase might be for Only By Night at Cheltenham. The big question with her, which we still haven't answered, is whether she'll do two and a half miles. She's entered in the Arkle as well, and if the ground was heavy then we'd be more tempted to look at that. It's still up in the air and it's a nice problem, but the Arkle is so strong with the likes of Sir Gino and Majborough. You have to accept we have a nice horse, though, and we couldn't be more delighted - Colin Russell, part owner.

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires Order Of St George Irish EBF Mares Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Only By Night is a very big mare and jumps very well. There should be a lot more to come. The mares novice chase at Thurles in January would look a logical next step on the way to the mares novice at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Only By Night is very good to jump although I thought we were in bother going along the side, but she found plenty for pressure. I'm delighted with her. We won't lose the run of ourselves but it was a good performance and she will go further too - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Care At Home Services Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Only By Night is a nice mare. She had won a Listed bumper and we would have hoped she could come here and do that. She jumped well and has a lovely way of going. She was a bit keen first time for Derek O'Connor, but she improved on that at Navan and today she was very straightforward. She has become so in her work at home too. She has grown up. We would hope that she could end up in the mares' novice at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires Hurricane Lane Irish EBF Mares INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Only By Night is a lovely mare. She really went through that ground but I would say she will go through any ground. She will stay in bumpers and is very straightforward - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressive mare last season; 4-6 over fences, featuring wins in Cork Grade 2 and Naas Grade 3 on return when seeing off Champ Kiely by a short head; belied her 25-1 odds when second in five-runner Arkle at Cheltenham last season when just in front of Majborough; no match for that rival when beaten 14l in 2m Grade 2 event at Punchestown; cheekpieces are reached for now.

stable_tour.quote: She had a great season, winning three times and finishing second in the Arkle and at Punchestown. She's in good form and the plan is to go to Naas on Sunday for a second-season novice chase. The Mares' Chase at Cheltenham will likely be her ultimate target. 04-11-25

She's a nice mare who showed plenty in her bumpers and had a couple of good runs over hurdles last season. She's going chasing and is a point-to-point winner who jumps well. She's ready to start off as soon as we get some soft ground. She's a fine, big mare and we think she'll improve for a fence. 13-11-24

13:47.race_name: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)

runners.comment: Perfect 2-2 over hurdles, but had to work hard in the Royal Bond; player nonetheless
runners.name: Koktail Brut

quotes.race: Bar 1 Betting Royal Bond Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Koktail Brut did everything wrong probably as Jack said he was keen enough in front. We weren't sure if there was going to be pace in the race, so we said we'd keep it simple and go on. He was very gutsy to come back. Looking at that, I'd say a bit further would suit him. I'll talk to Michael and Eddie [O'Leary] and see, but we won't just say he definitely wants two and a half miles yet. He could be one to keep and go to the Lawlor's of Naas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet Builder On Self Service Betting Terminals" (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: I'd say Koktail Brut is a nice horse. We thought we had a few nice ones at home and that was a good performance. He's a bit faster than his half-brother Gevrey and shows a bit of class. I'd imagine we'll look for a Graded bumper - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; 1-5 in bumpers; has progressed since sent hurdling, reversing bumper form with Colcannon to easily take Punchestown maiden (2m, heavy) on return before doubling tally when narrowly landing the odds in Grade 2 Royal Bond at Fairyhouse (2m, yielding to soft); one of two for in-form Gordon Elliott yard; player.

stable_tour.quote: This guy isn't short of pace and did well in bumpers. He's one to look forward to over hurdles and is ready to start. You'll see him very soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Fourth to Lulamba in France; created big impression on first start for Willie Mullins
runners.name: Le Divin Enfant

prev_owners.owner: Arf Racing, Mme Karine Perreau Et Al

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Le Divin Enfant had the experience from French jumping and we were able to use that. It probably wasn't the deepest race but he had a nice experience out there and didn't have to empty the tank. I'd be hoping he could be Graded material as I got the feel of a good horse from him. I didn't dip the tank at all and that is usually a good sign. I'd say this trip suits and while he was busy today, that should knock the freshness off him. Even after the race, he was still fresh in himself - Paul Townend, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Brother to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Imperial Saint; fourth to classy Lulamba in Auteuil maiden hurdle in October 2024; created a big impression on first start for Willie Mullins when making all to win Thurles maiden hurdle (2m, good to yielding) by 23l last month, clear jumping the last and didn't have to be extended; exciting prospect.

runners.breeder: Mme Henri Devin, M Henri Francois Devin & M Francois Nicolle
runners.comment: Unbeaten in a bumper and two hurdle starts; unknown quantity; could improve again
runners.name: Love Me Tender

quotes.race: BOYLE Sports Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Love Me Tender's jumping is electric. He's looking for the next hurdle all the time and has the option of going up in trip as well. He's progressing and doing everything right - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: QuinnBet (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: I had actually ridden Love Me Tender a good bit at home, he is very straightforward, but can be a bit on the lazy side. I knew I was away with it coming down the hill and he was very impressive. I know he probably didn't beat much but he couldn't do much more than that - Jody Townend, jockey

runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in a Tramore bumper, Kilbeggan maiden hurdle (2m3f) and 2m Tipperary Grade 3 novice without being extended, all on good to yielding ground; this race will be a much bigger examination but he's an unknown quantity and could have plenty of improvement to come; one of two for Willie Mullins.

stable_tour.quote: I know he won a Grade 3 race at Tipperary last time over two miles, but I think he'll be better over a bit further. Every time we run him he gets better and his family have all done that. The more they race, the more they improve. I'll train him like a Grade 1 novice hurdler until he tells me otherwise. He's got plenty going for him. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Won a point, bumper and hurdle start; form franked on latest run; player
runners.name: Mister Pessimistic

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Bookmaker INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Mister Pessimistic travelled strongly everywhere and he won well. The lads were quite sweet on him; they liked him at home, and he did a couple of nice bits. He won a point-to-point nicely and he's one that will stay well and is a nice horse for the future. His pedigree would suggest he could get further and I imagine with an obstacle in front of him, it will bring out more improvement - John Gleason, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won an incident-packed maiden point-to-point (only three of the 11 completed) at Loughanmore in April for the influential Sean Doyle; prominent all the way when winning 18-runner Listowel bumper on first start for Henry de Bromhead; recovered well from slight mistake two out to land the odds in Cork maiden hurdle (2m, yielding) on latest (form franked); player.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely young horse who is unbeaten. It was a good win at Cork on his first try over hurdles. We'll probably aim him at the novice hurdle at Leopardstown over Christmas and see how we get on. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Looked very smart at Fairyhouse; stable has won four of last six renewals; big player
runners.name: Skylight Hustle
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner for Colin Bowe; ran well in a Fairyhouse bumper last January; returned from absence when second of 20 on hurdles debut at Gowran (2m, heavy), a short-head in front of The Passing Wife; improved considerably to win 24-runner Fairyhouse maiden hurdle (2m, yielding to soft) by 21l last month; stable has won four of last six renewals; big player.

stable_tour.quote: We've always really liked him. We were expecting a big run in a Fairyhouse bumper last season but he just didn't produce what he was capable of for some reason. I fully expect him to leave that run behind him this season. He can be very keen and needs to learn how to relax. When he does, he could be exciting. He's been working very well. 26-10-25

runners.breeder: E A R L De Faydeau
runners.comment: Perfect 2-2 for Joseph O'Brien, including easy Grade 3 win on latest; in the mix
runners.name: Talk The Talk

quotes.race: Jack McInerney Memorial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Talk The Talk is a lovely horse. Once he settled, after he jumped the first, he got into a nice rhythm and it was all plain sailing really - Sam Ewing, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Promising run for Stuart Crawford in valuable sales bumper at Newbury in March when second behind Dan Skelton-trained winner; made bright start for Joseph O'Brien when overcoming trouble in running and mistake at the fourth to win Limerick maiden hurdle in October; impressive winner of Fairyhouse Grade 3 (2m, yielding to soft) last month; in the mix.

runners.comment: Third to Koktail Brut in Royal Bond at Fairyhouse; will need to improve again
runners.name: The Passing Wife

quotes.race: Fr. Breen Memorial (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: The Passing Wife put up a good performance with the weight. I was thinking of putting up a claimer on him but it worked out. He'll go hurdling now - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Point-to-point and three-time bumper winner; returned from long absence with third of 20 in Gowran maiden hurdle, finishing a short head behind Skylight Hustle; took step forward when never-nearer third to Koktail Brut in Grade 2 Royal Bond at Fairyhouse on latest; will need to improve again to be competitive.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't run in more than a year as he got a leg, but he had some very good bumper form before that and won his last two starts at Bellewstown and Galway. He's back working well and ready to start off. We're looking forward to getting him going again. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Smart in bumpers; good on hurdles bow; seemingly found out in mares' Grade 3 on latest
runners.name: Carrigmoornaspruce

quotes.race: Buckley Agri New Holland Irish EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It is grand that that is out of the way. Michael's [Kenneally] seven [pound claim] was a help. Carrigmoornaspruce is only in since the fourteenth of July, would you believe it. With these good horses, you don't have to work them too much; they are just able to do it. I suppose she will go to Down Royal next. That would be the obvious race for her and we'll see after that, but to have that out of the way is grand. She was second here last year. We'd done loads of schooling with her, once a week for the whole summer, because we knew we were going hurdling, we put hurdles out on the grass at home. Michael schooled her twice a week for the past two weeks. It had been very straightforward; she was jumping great - Declan Queally, trainer.

quotes.race: Plusvital Flat Race
quotes.quote: Carrigmoornaspruce was unreal. It was kind of the same as Naas. We just said to the boys that we would let her gallop around at the back and come home as well as we can. We're planning on coming here for the mares' bumper at the Dublin Racing Festival. It worked out and she's a very talented filly - Declan Queally, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart form in bumpers, with three wins culminating in Grade 3 success at Punchestown festival (yielding); impressive hurdles debut at Listowel in September when making most (jumped well) to hammer a couple of subsequent maiden winners over 2m (yielding); seemingly no excuses when beaten in Grade 3 mares' novice at Down Royal on latest (form doesn't look strong).

14:22.race_name: National Maternity Hospital Foundation Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Better known as a chaser; beaten 11l back hurdling last time and mark left untouched
runners.name: Path Doroux

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted, Path d'Oroux was banging on the door so many times last season and didn't win but got a lot of experience. It was a messy race, they went very slow and then turned into a sprint but he came out of it well. He's probably not good enough to mix it with the Grade 1 novices but at the same time he's experienced. In the early season in against some he may just have the upper hand. This was the plan for a while - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Corrib Oil Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Path D'Oroux will come on plenty for this. He's a nice one to look forward to. He's very laid back mentally and he should sharpen up for that. I suppose we'll got to Fairyhouse for the Royal Bond - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Buggyman (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Path D'Oroux is a nice horse. I'm delighted with that as we really liked him at home and I'd say it was a good bumper. He was a little bit keen and it didn't exactly go to plan. We intended to ride him with a little bit of cover and, while we couldn't get it, he still won and that's always the sign of a good one - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.spotlight: Better known as a talented chaser and was having his first run over hurdles in well over two years when an 11l fifth of the ten runners at Fairyhouse (2m, yielding to soft); opposable off an untouched mark.

stable_tour.quote: He's a consistent horse who was second in the Dan Moore last season. Despite running plenty of good races, he's still won only once over fences so he qualifies for graduation chases and he'll go for the one at Carlisle that he was third in last year. It looks a nice place to start off. 04-11-25

He had a good win at Cheltenham last month before finishing third in a graduation chase at Carlisle. He was placed at Leopardstown, Aintree and Punchestown and was a little bit unlucky not to land a big one. Hopefully he'll reap the rewards for it this season - he's still a novice as Cheltenham was his first win over fences. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Good Flat horse; hasn't kicked on over hurdles since winning a Limerick maiden
runners.name: Laafi

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Betting Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a good performance. Laafi was proven in the conditions and the first-time blinkers did the trick. It was very straightforward. He jumped well and got a nice position. I was able to do things on my own terms up the straight and he showed a good attitude - Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions Golden Horn Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Laafi is a work in progress and still learning but there's a bit left in the tank for next year and he'll be at his best over further. He has a future and he's always shown a nice attitude. He wasn't one of those horses that suddenly emerged on the scene, he's shown a gradual improvement over the year and it's nice to finish off the season with him on a high - Philip Robinson, racing manager for owner Sheikh Hamed Dalmook Al Maktoum.

runners.spotlight: Very useful Flat performer for William Haggas; good form in winning a big-field maiden hurdle at Limerick (yielding to soft) since when he's finished last of three in a Naas Grade 3 and tailed off in the Greatwood at Cheltenham with the blinkers back on; difficult to know where he is right now and has a lot of weight.

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Compiling a very solid record in 2m-2m4f handicaps; second from a long way back last time
runners.name: Bowensonfire

quotes.race: QuinnBet Bellewstown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bowensonfire is a nice horse, has a bit of ability, it probably took a while for the penny to drop but he is a big baby so hopefully there will be more to come from him - Jack Kennedy, jockey, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.spotlight: Compiling a very solid record in 2m-2m4f handicaps and came from a mile back to finish second to an unexposed Willie Mullins horse at Fairyhouse a month ago (2m, yielding to soft); hold-up performer who could get a strong pace to chase and has to be of interest.

stable_tour.quote: He's so consistent and ran another big race at Cheltenham on Friday. I thought that was a hot enough race and he was bang there. He stayed the trip well, too, and that will give us more options going forward with him. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Up 7lb for Navan but he's probably still improving after only 12 races
runners.name: Balko Dange

quotes.race: QuinnBet Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Balko D'Ange missed a few hurdles last time, which is unlike him. He's generally quick at his hurdles. We were disappointed with him then, but then you look at what the winner has done since. He was in off a nice mark and has the look of a horse who will get better with racing. Putting him into a good handicap off a low weight is the way we're probably thinking. The big handicap hurdles at the Dublin Racing Festival might just be a bit competitive for him at this stage; we'd like to take it step by step - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a handicap at last year's Christmas meeting at Limerick; reverted to more patient tactics when coming through to win comfortably at Navan last month (2m, soft to heavy); that triggered a 7lb rise but he's probably still improving after only 12 races.

runners.comment: Good maiden winner; stuck in the mud in a Grade 3 last time; interesting off this mark
runners.name: Ace Brannigan
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 5yo who comfortably accounted for a subsequent improver to win his maiden at Tipperary (good to yielding); failed to fire in the Grade 3 For Auction at Navan but ground bordering on heavy was perhaps not ideal; quite interesting off this mark provided inexperience doesn't hold him back; stable won this race with a handicap debutant in 2017.

runners.comment: Maiden/novice wins during the summer of 2024; mostly disappointing in the meantime
runners.name: Feud

quotes.race: Galmont Hotel & The Galway Bay Hotel Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: I loved the way Feud did it. He made a few mistakes at Listowel and I thought that might still be in him a bit, but he was very clever. He jumped some of them beautifully, and the ones he didn't he just kicked out of the way. We'll explore his ceiling over hurdles, and if it's a case of him becoming a lovely dual-purpose horse, we'll see. I'm excited about him. Beforehand I said we'll either go to Listowel for the Lartigue or the Royal Bond, so the dream has come true, for now - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: John B. Keane (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hurdling could be his job and he was quite impressive. You just hope that when you set them at hurdling that they enjoy it, although Danny said Feud was quite awkward at several jumps and he lost an iron at one stage, so if he brushes that up we have a load to look forward to. I think he's entitled to go to Galway - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden/novice wins during the summer of 2024; mostly disappointing in the meantime and his second at Wexford in August was in an easier handicap than this.

runners.comment: Ran well at the weights last time but thoroughly exposed and wants further these days
runners.name: Prairie Dancer

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer pulled himself up a bit in front and I probably got there way too soon. When I really put it to him though he found plenty - Aidan Kelly, rider

quotes.race: Colm White Bookmaker November Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer loves getting to the front. He was a big outsider, but he was one you could never put a line through. I knew if he put his best foot forward, he had a chance. He had good jumps form in competitive handicaps. I just kept filling him up and he found plenty up the straight. He's really genuine. The last 100 yards they were coming at me strong, but he put his head down and battled - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

quotes.race: Liam Healy Memorial Lartigue Hurdle (Grade B Handicap)
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer lugged a bit to his right and I didn't want to be fighting him, that forward going rhythm is important to him. He's a hardy horse and once he can get away and you can get a breather into him, he's a hard horse to get past - JJ Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Sheridan Electric Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought we'd get the chance to make the running on Prairie Dancer and thankfully it worked out well, he jumped and travelled well and coped well with the ground. He's a grand, straightforward horse - J J Slevin, jockey.

quotes.race: Athlone Handicap
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer is improving the whole time. This track and front-running suits him, ground doesn't seem to matter and hopefully he can keep going - Shane Crosse, rider.

runners.spotlight: Has won all sorts during his career but now thoroughly exposed; ran well at the weights last time at Down Royal (3m; August) but probably needs further these days.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Lartigue Hurdle at Listowel last season and it was great to see him win the November Handicap at Naas before running well in a Listed race after that. We're going to step him up in distance now over hurdles and go down the staying handicap hurdle route. 27-11-23

runners.breeder: Terrains Davilly St Leonard Et Al
runners.comment: Only a 4yo who is by no means exposed after one run in a handicap; betting helpful
runners.name: Sainte Lucie

quotes.race: Celebrate The New Year With Tote 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sainte Lucie looks one out of the top drawer. I love the way she went through that ground. I imagine we will be going to the top events with her - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Since winning her maiden 12 months ago (yielding to soft) she's come up short in three Grade 1s and when made favourite for a Cheltenham handicap in April (good ground perhaps lively enough); only a 4yo who is by no means exposed; the market could tell a tale.

stable_tour.quote: We'll take our time with her this season, as I like to do with four-year-olds just out of their juvenile campaign. She looked very smart when she won at Punchestown on New Year's Eve and we'll try to get her back to that sort of form. She's rated 127 so handicaps might be the way forward when she returns. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Disappointing in the mud on handicap debut; remains dangerously unexposed
runners.name: Joueur Masque
runners.spotlight: Had 923 days off after winning a French bumper in 2022, beating the now smart stayer Jet Blue; made it third-time lucky in maidens when making all at Punchestown in June (good to yielding) and, with the hood reapplied, he raced too keenly on his handicap debut back there (soft to heavy); clearly needs to settle better but these drier conditions could be key to him; dangerously unexposed.

runners.breeder: E A R L Guittet Desbois
runners.comment: Ex-Willie Mullins 7yo; no closer than 8l in three Flat maidens for his current yard
runners.name: Icare Desbois
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner for Willie Mullins for whom he reached a mark 8lb higher than today's; no closer than 8l in three Flat maidens for his current yard; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He's by Triple Threat, a sire we like from Capital Stud. He beat Lecky Watson in a Fairyhouse bumper last year and has schooled very well over hurdles, he's sharp. We're looking forward to getting him out in a maiden hurdle over 2m to start with. 13-11-23

runners.comment: Twice runner-up before tailed off at Cheltenham; even if back on song this is tough
runners.name: Littlefoot

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: In Gowran Park (last September) Littlefoot got a very nasty injury and it was touch and go whether he would come back. He's really coming into himself now, he jumped brilliantly, travelled, and we know he has an engine so it's nice to see him back - Mark Molloy, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Won his maiden over 2m7f but quick enough for 2m, having finished second in a Tipperary handicap over that trip in October; has since finished tailed off at Cheltenham; others are more intriguing.

runners.comment: Limerick winner in October; the 7lb rise could find him out in this stronger race
runners.name: Matt Connor
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner; the stewards had a word after finishing fifth in his first handicap over hurdles and then prevailed in a close finish at Limerick (2m, yielding); the 7lb rise could find him out in this stronger race.

runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Recent AW winner; 1-16 as a hurdler and could struggle in this competitive a handicap
runners.name: Walhaan

quotes.race: Edmondstown Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walhaan got a no-nonsense ride, Eoin was very good on him. We felt he had improved since Navan and had this race pinpointed. The flat track and nice ground suited him well. He's really starting to get the hang of hurdling now - Ciaran Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won on the AW earlier this month to snap a losing run but this 9yo is only 1-16 as a hurdler and could struggle in this competitive a handicap.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice in France for Jean-Claude Rouget but has been winless since and has only just joined us after a season with Ian Williams, for whom he finished second twice at Ascot. They were good runs and fingers crossed we can do something with him this year off his mark of 90. From what he has shown me at home he could win off his mark. He may start off this week at Newcastle on Friday and I think as the season progresses he can win a race or two. 28-04-21

runners.breeder: E U R L Freddy Head
runners.comment: Multiple Flat winner; kept on to be beaten under 9l at Naas 12 days ago; more needed here
runners.name: En Or
runners.spotlight: Multiple Flat winner who remains a maiden over hurdles (0-7) but he did keep on to be beaten under 9l at Naas 12 days ago and there could be a race in him off this mark.

runners.breeder: Jeffrey K Ramsey, Stephanie E Ramsey & William K Ramsey
runners.comment: Hasn't been that threatening in three handicaps and this is no easier
runners.name: Free Flow
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 21 career starts came in a Thurles maiden in March (good); hasn't been that threatening in three handicaps and this is no easier.

runners.comment: Has lost her way since finishing second in a handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival
runners.name: Kimy
runners.spotlight: Has lost her way since finishing second in a valuable handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival in February and has been off since May; 3lb wrong.

runners.comment: Running well under both codes since the autumn but not ideal being 5lb out of the weights
runners.name: Someones Wish
runners.owner: Call It What You Like Syndicate

quotes.race: Willwego.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought Someone's Wish would come on for the run. Jack [Kennedy, jockey] said they went very fast up front and it played into his hands. He held onto him as long as he could and said he'd come on plenty from it - Gordon Elliott, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Has been running quite well on the AW since winning a Downpatrick handicap hurdle in October; has a lot more on his plate here and not ideal being 5lb out of the weights.

stable_tour.quote: It was nice to see him get his head back in front at Downpatrick and we've him pencilled in for the 2m handicap chase at Down Royal this week. 26-10-25

15:00.race_name: Paddy Power Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Listed Race)

runners.comment: Ended last season with Scottish National win; good third in Drinmore on return; player
runners.name: Captain Cody
runners.owner: Vincent Caldwell & Angela Shamoon & Mrs A Shamoon Ibgi

prev_owners.owner: Vincent Caldwell & Angela Shamoon & Mrs A Shamoon Ibgi

quotes.race: Coral Scottish Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I just wanted to get Captain Cody settled early and creep him into the race. I followed him at Cheltenham last time and he was too free. He probably unshipped Danny Mullins because he was going so well, he was overracing, so the plan was to get his head dropped early. As soon as he did that he got into a lovely rhythm. I wanted to go wide because he hasn't had that many runs over fences and I wanted to let him see his fences. It couldn't have gone all the better all the way round. I didn't want to get there too soon. I knew I was going to beat Johnny. Even at the last I thought let's just get him over it, and away he went - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Paddy Kehoe Suspended Ceilings Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Jody was very good. She minded her own business and kept Captain Cody balanced and jumping. She's always there riding winners all the time for us. When you consider how light she is, she must have to carry a stone and a half of lead every day - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Ladies Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Captain Cody had a top-class run at Cheltenham last year. His jumping was a bit rusty at times but he was very good at the last two when it counted - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Auction (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Captain Cody has definitely improved. I know Patrick thought his horse would come on for the run at Punchestown but I knew my fellow would too - Jody Townend, rider.

runners.spotlight: Ended last season with Scottish National win at Ayr (4m, good to soft) off a rating of 140; very pleasing return when third to the classy Romeo Coolio in Grade 1 Drinmore at Fairyhouse (2m4f, yielding to soft) last month; step up in trip will suit back in handicap company; one of six-strong team for Willie Mullins and is the choice of Paul Townend.

stable_tour.quote: A thorough stayer who would gallop all day long. He showed his stamina when he won the Scottish National at Ayr and I'd imagine he'll have the Grand National on his radar this season. The Irish equivalent might be an option, too, as he's a winner around Fairyhouse over hurdles. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Close second in big-field 2m4f Listed handicap at Punchestown; pulled up in Coral Gold Cup
runners.name: Blizzard Of Oz

quotes.race: Michael Hickey Memorial Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance. The second horse is a very good horse. We're looking forward to having a nice year with Blizzard Of Oz. We wanted to get today over and done with. He's always a bit rusty at the start of the season and his jumping warmed up - Daryl Jacob, owners' representative.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Blizzard Of Oz gave me a pleasant surprise. I would imagine we will aim for the final of this series at Punchestown - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Blizzard Of Oz jumped every hurdle differently. I think there is a good jump in him. He had to be tough in that ground and he stayed going well - Paul Townend, rider

runners.spotlight: Close second in big-field 2m4f Listed handicap at Punchestown festival last season then edged ahead near the finish to win 2m7f Listed chase at Wexford (good to yielding) on return from layoff; bad mistake costly when upped to 3m2f in Coral Gold Cup at Newbury last month (pulled up).

stable_tour.quote: He did the job nicely at Wexford and I'd say he beat a good horse in Rocky's Diamond that day. He's still a novice, but I'd imagine it'll be handicaps for him this season. We have an eye on the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury - that race could suit him. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Won Listed handicap here in March for former yard; detached behind Blizzard Of Oz latest
runners.name: Monbeg Park

quotes.race: QuinnBet Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Monbeg Park is a bit quirky. The last day, he ran well, finishing third and swished his tail a bit. I was talking to the boys, who are point-to-pointing today, and they said leave your stick until last resort and try not to interfere with him too much. He has loads of ability - Tiernen Power Roche, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting galabid.com/t21 Auction For The Down Syndrome Centre Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We've never had anything like Monbeg Park. He's very special and when he jumps a fence we'll see the best of him. We're selling men and it's just by default we still have him. He jumped the last in his four-year-old maiden and sprained his front joint. He couldn't go to the sales then and we just got left with him - Sean Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Pegus Horse Feed Point-To-Point Flat Race
quotes.quote: Monbeg Park wasn't fully right at Gowran but came out of it well and looks a different horse now. We will keep him for racing ourselves now and if he stays in one piece, you could see him winning something big. We'll turn him out now and go hurdling next year - Sean Doyle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: One of his two chase wins came at this track when landing Listed handicap (21.5f) back in March off 142 for former yard; best run since when close second to Heart Wood in Punchestown Grade 3 in October; detached last of four behind Blizzard Of Oz at Wexford since; new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Smart hurdler in his early days; 3 small-field chase wins this year; detached in G1 latest
runners.name: Pied Piper
runners.owner: Mrs M Roden & Mrs R Nolan

quotes.race: Fibrus Gallop At Gigabit Speeds Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Pied Piper was a bit sketchy throughout, but has lots of class and will come on mentally for that, so I'm very happy. He was entitled to go through it very easily, but hopefully his jumping will sharpen up a lot. I was full of horse, and getting his head in front will do his confidence the world of good - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: WKD Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Pied Piper idles in front and we didn't want to make the running, but he just cantered around like it was a piece of work. We'll probably wait till Christmas now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice way to start Pied Piper off and it was great. He's got a lot stronger since last season and I love the way he put his head down and galloped to the line. He's a nice horse. We're going to dream for another while but it's a hot division and he'll have to keep improving. We'll go to Down Royal now for the WKD [Hurdle] in two weeks time then onto Christmas from here. He'll be trained as a Champion Hurdle horse but it's a very hot division and he's going to have to improve but if you're not in, you can't win. As an individual he's way stronger. Even going round the ring he looked more like a chaser than a juvenile. With them juveniles you want that scope to keep improving. It's as strong as a division as there is out there. We can go to bed dreaming tonight anyway - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Finesse) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought we'd come over, have a feel and see where we are. We thought Pied Piper was a nice horse and if he was settled and behaved he's go close. We thought he was nice, but I was surprised a little bit by that. He jumped like a man. When he got close to one he learned how to settle. We bought him as a horse to mix on the Flat and over jumps, so he'll be a nice horse for those staying Flat races as well this year. He looks nice. They've (Fil Dor) got the same owners so we may try and split them up, we might run the two of them in the Triumph Hurdle. They're both in the Supreme Novices', I'd say this is the speedier horse than the other one and the Friday track might suit Fil Dor better. If one of them is going to go for the Supreme then it'd be this lad. There's always Aintree and plenty of other options. I wouldn't rule the Supreme out for him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Tote.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pied Piper is a nice horse and I think there is an awful amount of improvement in him. I couldn't see him winning today and he hasn't even been away from home. He jumped well and probably travelled a bit too well early. He loved the ground and is one to look forward to. He's a big baby - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kube - Leicester's Premier Event Hire Venue Handicap
quotes.quote: Pied Piper has been travelling a lot better in his races recently and been caught too far back off a slow pace the last twice. We went an even gallop considering the conditions and he kept at it well. He won in similar conditions at Newmarket at the back end of last year and has replicated the timing again this year - Rab Havlin, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Smart hurdler in his early days; all three chase wins recorded in small-field events between April and June this year; failed to make the grade in Grade 3 events before livelier displays at Cheltenham and in the Troytown; always detached in Grade 1 Drinmore at Fairyhouse on latest.

stable_tour.quote: He's a hard horse to place, but he travelled brilliantly at Cheltenham on Saturday. He probably just found a strongly run 3m1f at Cheltenham a bit too far and the winner outstayed him. I was thrilled with how he ran, though, and it might open up a few doors for him. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Won valuable Grade 3 handicap at this track in February off 130; chance if at his best
runners.name: Backtonormal
runners.owner: Darren Cahill & Mrs Mary Furlong & Michael P Byrne

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Mary Furlong & Ms Margaret Mullins

quotes.race: O'Driscolls Irish Whiskey Leopardstown Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I was trying not to get there too soon. I was happy everywhere. I was going easy, had loads of room. Backtonormal travelled and jumped brilliant and galloped all the way to the line - Conor Stone-Walsh, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Some merit in beginners' chases last season before coming good in very valuable Grade 3 handicap at this track (2m5f, yielding) in February off 130; never sighted on return at Naas last month; pulled up at Navan three weeks ago; could play a role if he recaptures his best.

stable_tour.quote: He won a competitive handicap chase well at last season's Dublin Racing Festival but had a setback afterwards. He's ready to start off again and there might be a race at Gowran Park for him. He seems in good form and we're looking forward to getting him back out again. 04-11-25

He made a great start for us by winning the auction hurdle series final at Punchestown. He's a nice horse and we'll get him started over fences shortly. We'll probably start him off over two miles and go from there. 13-11-24

runners.comment: One chase win; heavy fall in Kerry National; pulled up in Munster National; hard to trust
runners.name: You Oughta Know

quotes.race: Racing Again June 4th (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: You Oughta Know is not particularly a horse for this track, he probably wants a more galloping track. We went a real strong gallop and it was a messy race. Everyone who rode him at home liked him but he wasn't the sharpest workhorse so we didn't think he'd do what he did but a strong gallop really played into his hands - Patrick Mullins, rider

runners.spotlight: Made all to score by 23l in beginners' chase at Wexford in August (19.5f, good); fell heavily when 9-2 favourite for the Kerry National at Listowel; pulled up in the Munster National next time; runner-up in Grade 3 novice at Cork (2m4f, good to yielding) last month; comes with risks attached.

stable_tour.quote: He doesn't want real winter ground so we might wait for something in the spring for him. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Fell in X-Country handicap at Cheltenham 15 days ago; finished 8th in this race last year
runners.name: Favori De Champdou

quotes.race: Liam & Valerie Brennan Florida Pearl Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Favori De Champdou came on from the last day and we knew he had, but I thought that would be tougher. Jack said he stayed very well and jumped brilliant. It was a hot enough race and he's a nice horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Lyons Of Limerick Jaguar Land Rover Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Favori De Champdou did it well. Jordan was happy the whole way. He jumped well and handled the ground and didn't do a whole lot in front. He's going the right way - Ian Amond, travelling head groom.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Favori De Champdou did everything right and Jack gave him a grand ride. He looked big in the ring but he jumped great. I would imagine he'll go chasing straight away after missing a year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won conditions chase at Down Royal (3m2f, good) in March and ran pretty well when fifth of 15 in the Porterstown Handicap at Fairyhouse (3m6f, yielding to soft) last month; travelling okay when a faller in Cross Country handicap at Cheltenham 15 days ago; finished eighth in this race last year.

stable_tour.quote: He's been knocking on the door in some of the big staying handicap chases. He was third in the Thyestes last season and in the Grand National Trial at Punchestown. Hopefully the door will open for him in a race like that. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Always in rear on stable debut when pulled up at Naas on return; fell in this last year
runners.name: Hartur Darc

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Leinster National Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We weren't really sure whether Hartur D'Arc would stay this trip but we said we'd pitch him in here and see. It's a lovely pot to win. Sean (Flanagan) gave him a nice ride and everything went right for him. He's in the Irish National. I know it's over a lot further but you'd have to consider it - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Hartur D'Arc did it well and is a very good horse. It didn't really go to plan up the straight. I wanted to stay out but had to switch in on the worst of the ground. It took him a while to get going but he pulled up like a fresh horse. It didn't take much out of him and he will come on from the run - Declan Lavery, rider.

runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner on soft/heavy, most recently off 128 in the 2024 Leinster National at Naas; narrowly denied off 137 in repeat bid in March; tailed off over hurdles at Punchestown in May on final start for Gavin Cromwell; always in rear on stable debut when pulled up at Naas on return; fell in this race last year.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good when he won the Leinster National in March and I'm not sure he stayed the trip in the Irish National on his final run. He's not a slow horse and we'll bring him back in trip for his first run back - he's in the Troytown and the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham and the plan is for him to start in one of them. 12-11-24

He was very good in the Leinster National and I'm not sure he stayed the trip in the Irish National on his final run. He isn't a slow horse and we'll bring him back in trip for his first run back - he's in the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham and the plan is for him to start in that race. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Might have won the National Hunt Chase last season but for a fall; midfield in Porterstown
runners.name: Now Is The Hour

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Prestige Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a big thing to Now Is The Hour as he really enjoys this type of ground. I've got into a nice rhythm and he's come home well. He's a nice prospect - Sean Flanagan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Grade 2 winner in a short career over hurdles; 0-8 over fences but might have given Haiti Couleurs something to think about in the 3m6f National Hunt Chase at Cheltenham had he not come down two out; no show in the Irish National; good third to Final Demand in Navan beginners' on return but only midfield in the Porterstown on latest.
