stable_tour.quote: He's a Grade 2 winner over hurdles but still a maiden over fences, although he was a little bit unlucky last season not to win - he was running a big race in the National Hunt Chase at Cheltenham when he fell at the second-last. He has an entry in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury but he's ground-dependent - he wants proper soft ground. He could go to Newbury if conditions suited. 04-11-25

He won a Grade 2 novice hurdle at Haydock last season in very testing ground. He took to fences well at Cork in March and is waiting on proper soft ground now. He'll be going over fences again and is a real stayer. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Winless over fences; never a threat in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury last month
runners.name: Omoore Park

quotes.race: Jack Richards Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: O'Moore Park has run a blinder. He jumped well and stuck at it really well. I would say going up in trip will suit him. I had a nice position everywhere. I was following the winner and he was just very good on the day - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Supporting Treo Eile Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: O'Moore Park benefitted from the run the last day which knocked the freshness out of him and brought him on. He's progressing away and is going to be a chaser - Paul Townend, rider.

runners.spotlight: Has fairly useful form at 2m4f-2m6f over fences, including placed efforts at the Cheltenham Festival last term and Galway on reappearance; however, still seeking first chase win and was never a threat in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury last month; not the percentage call.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran really well in the novice handicap chase at Cheltenham when third to Caldwell Potter. He started off in a beginners' chase at Galway a few weeks ago in the hope it would leave him in good shape for the Coral Gold Cup. He's entered in that, and staying handicap chases will be his thing this season. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Ran well for long way in Troytown; good second over inadequate trip latest; contender
runners.name: Search For Glory

quotes.race: Surehaul Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Search For Glory did it well in the end, he just didn't enjoy being in front. He probably showed more gears than he every showed there - Jack Kennedy, rider

runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 3-winning novice hurdler; didn't add to Galway beginners' chase win last season; jumping left a lot to be desired in the Ultima at Cheltenham and appeared not to stay in the Irish National; ran well for a long way in Troytown on return before fading; fine second over inadequate 20.5f at Navan three weeks ago; contender back up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's still only eight and I'd like to think there's a big handicap chase in him. He was seventh in the Ultima last season and the Troytown at Navan could be on his radar. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Won Summer Plate at Market Rasen; 2nd in American Grand National; loves quicker ground
runners.name: Ballysax Hank

quotes.race: Racing Again September 20th Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought we rolled away nice and even. I was probably to the pin of my collar most of the way, but once we got rolling down the hill, Ballysax Hank really hit the line strong. When he hit the front, he had a good look and ran around a bit, but he hit the line strong. It turned into a stamina test, which played into my strengths. He's a lovely horse who could go back over jumps and he can mix it now, hopefully. The likes of the November handicap at two miles would be right up his street - Gary Carroll, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Summer Plate Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very fortunate to get the ride, I had the call on Tuesday when I was in a cattle market and didn't think twice about it, so I'm delighted Ballysax Hank has gone on and won. There was a second I thought I was coming off, but once running he relaxed and jumped well," he added. "He picked up well and winged the last and went away nicely - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 2-4 over fences, winning the Summer Plate at Market Rasen (21.5f, good) in July off 128; won sole Flat start next time at Bellewstown (1m6f, good to yielding) before a fine second to Zanahiyr over hurdles in the American Grand National (2m5f, firm); very little rain forecast which bodes well for his chances on his first try at the trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's been in good form and picked up a nice pot when winning the Summer Plate at Market Rasen in July. He ran a cracker in the American National when second to Zanahiyr and he's had a little break since. We'll freshen him up and he could maybe go to the Paddy Power at Christmas. I'd imagine we'll stay chasing for the moment. 04-11-25

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Cap Orne & Yannick Fouin
runners.comment: Chance judged on Kim Muir third; trip on the sharp side on return; the choice of Walsh
runners.name: Sa Majeste
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner posted two chase wins last season at up to 3m and was a fine third in the Kim Muir off 142 at Cheltenham (3m2f, good to soft) back in March; pulled up in Irish National; trip a bit sharp when remote fourth at Punchestown (21.5f) on return last month; the choice of Mark Walsh; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: Hopefully he can pick up a nice handicap at some stage this season. He ran well enough in the Kim Muir last season and some of those big handicap chases will be on his agenda over the next few months. Hopefully there's more to come as he's had only 12 runs. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Fourth in the Troytown; that was just his first start in handicap company over fences
runners.name: Will The Wise

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Group Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was very unsure how Will The Wise was going to handle the ground. I thought he could weaken coming to the last but he dug deep. He's also in the Albert Bartlett but we'll have to see what the handicapper does as well - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Will The Wise was good there today. He travelled and jumped and stayed going. Hopefully we are back on track with him and I hope he can step up in grade - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Will The Wise is weak and will be a good horse when he gets to jump fences. The pace was very stop-start and he was only getting going at the finish - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressive handicap hurdler last season; got away with sloppy jumping, including a blunder two out, when making all to win 2m2f novice event at Galway in October; solid fourth of 19 in the Troytown at Navan (3m heavy) last month; that was just his first start in handicap company over fences; more to come from 2lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice over hurdles last season before running well to finish sixth in the Pertemps Final. He's gone chasing since then and it was great to get off the mark at Galway last time. The Troytown is his next target and hopefully that will be right up his street. 04-11-25

He's a nice horse who showed a good attitude to win his bumper at Punchestown. He'll start off in a maiden hurdle, potentially on Sunday at Cheltenham over two miles, or we could go to Cork the following week. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Form of Listowel win bodes very well; poor favourite in Grade 3 at Cork; early days
runners.name: Mossy Fen Park

quotes.race: Thorn Plant Hire Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Mossy Fen Park has loads of scope and he jumped brilliantly the whole way around. I met the last on a nice stride and he went away nicely to the line. I am delighted with that. He is a fine big horse and he hadn't run for awhile, so hopefully he will come on from it - Darragh O'Keefe, jockey.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mossy Fen Park is a smashing, big horse. It was a messy race and he nearly lost ground at the second-last after giving it so much air, but he picked up really well in the end. I'm delighted he's got it done and he should be some chaser - Darragh O'Keefe, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Grade 2 over hurdles; solid form in defeat in first two chase starts before off the mark in good style on return from absence in 2m6f Listowel beginners' in September (runner-up Oscars Brother won Grade 2 since and has been snapped up by JP McManus); disappointing favourite in Cork Grade 3 on latest but early days; handicap bow.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay when third at Cork, but two and a half miles around there was probably a bit sharp for him on reflection. I think we can work on his jumping as he was probably better at Listowel when winning a beginners' chase. I think he'll be fine. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Hit with a 14lb rise for easy win in stayers' handicap at Punchestown; absence to overcome
runners.name: Shanbally Kid

quotes.race: Oaklodgelandscapes.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Shanbally Kid is a bit like his owner, he likes to be on his own. He gets a bit upset when he's near horses. I said to Danny keep him on his own as much as you can but I didn't realise Danny had that plan in mind. He's probably a National horse for the future. He's a novice in England for next season as well because the English season ended last week - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Finished third in the 2024 Coral Cup at Cheltenham; failed to make any kind of impact in his first five chase starts but massive step up in trip brought out major improvement when running out a 15l winner of Punchestown festival handicap (31.5f, yielding); hit with a 14lb rise; absence to overcome back down in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He was in his comfort zone the whole way when he stepped up in trip in a handicap chase [3m7½f] at Punchestown at the end of last season. Danny [Mullins] gave him a good ride, took his time and kept him wide. There is more to come this season now he's got his jumping together, and all the staying handicap chases will be on his radar. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Runner-up in the Munster National in October; stable won this race in 2022; player
runners.name: Weveallbeencaught

prev_owners.owner: Jimmy & Susie Wenman, Edward & Jane James

quotes.race: Ballymore Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was the plan to keep it simple with Weveallbeencaught and go from the front. He doesn't do too much, he's idle and had his ears pricked after the last. He's one for the future and a chaser - you only have to look at the size of him. He's a big, powerful animal and surely hurdles aren't what he's made for. He's very exciting. He'll be better over 3m and he'll come back for the Ballymore or Albert Bartlett in March, most likely the Albert Bartlett as we don't want to take on Hermes Allen - we're not stupid! He's one of the priciest horses we've bought but he's worth way more than they paid for him - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit Irish Store Sales With ITM Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've got a good one, long term. We'll go and win another bumper with Weveallbeencaught and then put him away hurdling next season. I think a quiet bumper. The owners will be keen to do something fancy, but I've got to calm them down. A horse his size isn't going to win an Aintree bumper and he's a three-mile chaser. We bought him as a Gold Cup horse and that's what we're going for. He's very similar to Imperial Commander. That's big talk, but that's the idea we've got - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won 3m Doncaster novice handicap chase in fine style for Nigel Twiston-Davies last January; second-best of the home team when fourth in the Kim Muir; good stable debut at Listowel before finishing runner-up in the Munster National at Limerick (3m, yielding to soft) in October; stable won this race in 2022.

stable_tour.quote: He was runner-up to French Dynamite in the Munster National, in which he ran really well. You could argue that if they'd gone another half a furlong, he would have been beside the winner. He's going to go straight for the Paddy Power in Leopardstown over Christmas. His owner and I won the race a couple of years ago with Real Steel, and we think this lad will suit the race down to the ground. After that, he could be one to target at the Irish Grand National. 23-11-25

runners.comment: Easy winner at Clonmel but this is much tougher and her jumping will be severely tested
runners.name: Nara

prev_owners.owner: Mme Sandra Hosselet & Bloodstock Agency Ltd

quotes.race: Suir Blueway Mares Chase
quotes.quote: Nara jumped well and is a bit more settled. She is learning all the time and hopefully will keep improving. We will probably look at a handicap now - there is a second-season novice at the end of November at Punchestown maybe - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: Carey Glass Irish EBF Mares Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Nara is still forward-going and keen and jumped a bit better today although made a few novicey mistakes. Hopefully we can iron those out of her but she was good - Mark Walsh, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Nara was a bit careful over the first couple, but once she got her confidence she was brilliant. Mark [Walsh, jockey] was brilliant on her. She's a fine, big mare. She had a couple of nice runs over hurdles last season and probably has a preference for nicer ground - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Seventh in the 2024 Fred Winter; encouraging start to her chase career last season including Grade 2 success at Thurles; failed to complete next two starts in handicaps with jumping issues evident; ran out an easy winner of small-field mares' chase at Clonmel (18.5f, good to yielding) in October; more on her plate here.

stable_tour.quote: She won nicely at Clonmel in a mares' chase. We've been looking at various options for her and she's entered in the Troytown. I would like to see her over a trip, but she's pacey as well, so I'd say she can go either way. She does seem stronger this season, but she's not a real winter-ground mare. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Hasn't won a race of any description since April 2023; vulnerable to less exposed types
runners.name: Sandor Clegane
runners.owner: Mrs K Browne & Mrs Anne Coffey

quotes.race: Finlay Ford At Naas Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I know Sandor Clegane was beaten ten lengths but I thought he hit the line well and he jumped well. I would say he will go to Cheltenham now for one of the staying novice chases - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has some rock-solid graded form in the book over fences and hurdles; however, he's 0-8 over fences and hasn't won a race of any description since April 2023; soundly beaten last three runs; vulnerable to less exposed types.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well enough in the Galmoy and actually hit the line well, which he hadn't been doing, so I was happy to see that. He's in the Stayers' Hurdle and could go for that, but I'd love to see him have a crack at the Coral Cup ? that sort of race would suit him. If he got into a rhythm early, I could see him running a big race. 20-2-25

runners.comment: Has a good chance at the weights judged on his second to Three Card Brag last season
runners.name: Kinturk Kalanisi
runners.spotlight: Went close over 2m5f at Fairyhouse on second chase start; solid display at Navan (3m) next time when second to the progressive Three Card Brag (had Captain Cody and Now Is The Hour behind off level weights); travelling well when losing his rider two out in Leinster National; pulled up in Irish National; could have a say if primed after a break.

runners.comment: Bounced back to form when beaten a neck by well handicapped rival in the Porterstown
runners.name: Will Do

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing Irish EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Will Do is better the further he goes and that ground is probably as good as he wants it - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Will Do is a good stayer. He loves galloping and he showed that when he won his bumper at Cork and although he looked beaten a few times there, he still managed to win it. He's a nice horse going forward and hopefully he will win plenty of races - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: It's nice to get one under the belt in bumpers. He is a good staying type and would strike you more as a staying chaser in time. John Gleeson - winning rider.

runners.spotlight: Enjoys a thorough test of stamina; fifth in this race last year when sent off favourite; second in National Trial at Punchestown (3m3f, soft) last February; third to Haiti Couleurs in National Hunt Chase; no show in Irish National; bounced back to form when beaten a neck by well handicapped rival in the Porterstown last month (3m6f, yielding to soft); each-way player.

stable_tour.quote: You'd imagine something like the Troytown at Navan will be on his radar now. He'll come on plenty from his run in the Munster National and all he does is gallop and stay. He could do with slickening up his jumping. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Distant fifth in Munster National; pulled up over hurdles at Navan; others preferred
runners.name: Yeats Star
runners.spotlight: All three wins came on soft over shorter trips although placed in C&D handicap hurdle last year; narrow defeat in 3m Perth handicap chase in September; distant fifth in Munster National; pulled up over hurdles at Navan three weeks ago; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't run badly in the Munster National and has turned a corner of late. Hopefully there's a nice staying chase in him. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Excellent second in this race last year; only 2lb higher now; new headgear tried now
runners.name: Midnight Our Fred
runners.owner: Mrs Florence Lockwood & Emily B Lockwood
runners.spotlight: Good form over fences last term, winning 2m4f Gowran handicap and excellent second of 27 in this corresponding race off 2lb lower mark; pulled up in the Kim Muir at Cheltenham; good prep for this when second in 3m handicap hurdle at Cork last month; enters the discussion in new headgear.

stable_tour.quote: I'd say we'll go to the Kim Muir as the trip could suit him better than the National Hunt Chase. He's run well in races around three and a quarter miles a few times, so we'll probably keep him at that. He ran a great race in the Paddy Power Chase, doing everything bar win. He jumped, travelled and quickened nicely and a couple of the horses around him have boosted the form nicely. His first three handicap chase runs were at Cheltenham which obviously wouldn't be the norm for Irish horses, but he ran well each time. I'd be hopeful he's improved this season and if we can get him there in good he'd hopefully have a chance. 20-2-25

runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner is yet to hit form over larger obstacles but looks well treated
runners.name: Waterford Whispers

quotes.race: Close Brothers Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Waterford Whispers looked like being in a bit of trouble but he's still learning and picked up well from the back of the last. He'll jump a fence in time - Frank Berry, owner's racing manager.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner at up to 2m4f is yet to score over fences but has posted several decent efforts; was running on over 2m2f when third to Will The Wise in Galway beginners' in October; never travelled when sent off favourite for Punchestown handicap (21.5f) last month; runner-up in 2024 Martin Pipe off 133 so could be lurking off dangerous mark if able to put it together.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely at Galway, but whether he was completely in love with the track, I'm not sure. He ran fine, but we'll probably try him over a bit further now. His second in the Martin Pipe is his standout form, and we hope he can rediscover that. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Weakening when unseating rider at the last in Troytown on latest; others more convincing
runners.name: No Time To Wait
runners.spotlight: Bumper/maiden hurdle winner for Gordon Elliott; 0-7 chasing; fair second to odds-on favourite in Punchestown novice in June; beaten favourite at Kilbeggan next time; weakening when unseating his rider at the last in the Troytown on latest; others more convincing.

stable_tour.quote: We'd be leaning towards the National Hunt Chase as long as he gets in. He ran well at Musselburgh last time at a track which wouldn't have suited on ground that was plenty quick. He's definitely going the right way and we think there's more to come. 20-2-25

runners.comment: Won 2m6f Fairyhouse novice in January; has been found wanting in valuable handicap chases
runners.name: Noble Birth

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Noble Birth got a freebie in front but he jumped great. We'll see what the handicapper does, maybe the good novice handicap chase at Navan will be a race for him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdles winner; sole chase win in 2m6f Fairyhouse novice last January; has been found wanting in valuable handicap chases; solid fourth over hurdles last time but hard to be confident in.

stable_tour.quote: He's been placed in a couple of bumpers and went over hurdles for the first time at Punchestown on Saturday. I didn't think he jumped well enough on the day but he'll be okay and probably needs a bit of a trip. 15-11-21

runners.comment: Midfield in the Troytown on latest; best at around 2m4f so others more likely
runners.name: A Wave Of The Sea

quotes.race: Paddy Power "I'm Never Going Back To The Office" Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: A Wave Of The Sea jumped savage today, we put the blinkers on, Shane gave him a great ride. I am delighted to get a winner here this weekend. He is not especially well-handicapped but he is a good tough horse who turns up and runs his race. We'll speak to JP (McManus) and Frank (Berry) but he might be one that could win a good pot at home while others are gone over to Cheltenham. We'll see what they want to do - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Matheson Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: A Wave Of The Sea struggled a bit in graded company, last day was a bit better and he jumped very well today. It was probably the difference. He could easily travel to Cheltenham for one of the handicap chases - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Value Cabs 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: A Wave Of The Sea is not a natural front-runner and he probably needed a lead for a bit further. We've always thought a fair bit of him and he'll be better as a four and five-year-old. He's still big and weak, but he travelled lovely today and jumped great up to the second last - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: A Wave Of The Sea was green in front and he just outstayed the other lad in the end. He's a nice horse and a stronger run race when he can get a lead will suit him better - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Very experienced handicap chaser who has been generally reliable over the past 12 months; won two handicaps at Kilbeggan during the summer; midfield in the Troytown on latest; best at around 2m4f so others more likely.

stable_tour.quote: He's won three races at the Dublin Racing Festival, the first as a juvenile hurdler, so I guess that's the way we'll be heading with him, to try to win the Grade B handicap chase there for a third time. He's a good, solid handicapper and only six. There have been a few times when he's been let down by his jumping, but at the same time there have been days when he has jumped really well and everything has gone right. So far the pattern has been one big win every season, so I'm hopeful he can do that again at least. 20-10-22

A consistent performer who always runs his race. In each of the last two seasons he has landed a valuable pot at the Dublin Racing Festival and he came up just short this term in his bid for the hat-trick when third to a well-handicapped horse. He's an intended runner in the Grand National this weekend and, although he has never faced the Aintree fences before, I think he will be fine, but there is only one way to find out. 12-04-23

runners.comment: Might have won at Cheltenham last time but for a bad mistake; only 1lb higher here
runners.name: Backmersackme
runners.spotlight: Has taken a while to get going over fences but ultra-canny connections secured the services of Sean Bowen when runner-up at Cheltenham in October (3m1f, good); he made a bad mistake at a crucial stage of the race but rallied gamely up the hill; could be nicely treated from just 1lb higher.

runners.comment: Good Listowel winner; raced far too keenly when tailed off in Munster National; reserve
runners.name: Pride Of Place

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase (Div I)
quotes.quote: I just had a phone call from Pride Of Place's previous trainer, Michael Hourigan, and he told me how to train him and stuff like that. He got a lovely ride from Charlie and goes on the good ground. That was a 0-110 and he's rated 101 so hopefully he might still be in the same bracket so we'll follow them around. Charlie's riding well, he rode a nice winner for us at Roscommon as well - Enda Bolger, trainer.

runners.spotlight: First reserve; won with plenty to spare at Listowel (3m, good to yielding) in September but raced far too keenly when tailed off in the Munster National last time.

runners.comment: Would be a player if the ground deteriorated but probably won't have his ground; reserve
runners.name: Buachaillbocht

quotes.race: David Trundley Artist At Punchestown Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Buachaillbocht has won three, he's going the right way and might win another one - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Join The Punchestown Members Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Buachaillbocht was better today than at Tramore, that track might have been a bit tight for him. It was atrocious ground there too and he just didn't travel. He travelled well today and stayed it out well. He was entitled to do that, he is only six and he's improving - Ted Walsh, trainer

runners.spotlight: Second reserve; three wins over hurdles last term in testing conditions at up to 2m7f; off the mark chasing on final start of season in 2m4f Fairyhouse novice; fair third in Listed handicap hurdle at Navan on return; drying ground a worry; 2lb wrong.

runners.comment: 2nd in amateur event over 3m1f at Cheltenham; midfield in Troytown & Porterstown; reserve
runners.name: Beaufort Scale

quotes.race: Hurley Family Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beaufort Scale didn't put a foot wrong anywhere today, he jumped brilliant. We went a really good gallop and when I asked him he picked up, and did it well at the line - Sam Ewing, rider

runners.spotlight: Third reserve; two wins over hurdles; maiden over fences and not the most consistent; fine second in amateur riders' event over 3m1f at Cheltenham in October; midfield in Troytown and Porterstown; 3lb wrong.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran a cracker at Cheltenham on Friday. I'd say that was close to being the best run of his life so, hopefully, he can pick up a nice pot in a staying handicap chase this season. 26-10-25

15:30.race_name: Paddy Power The Flat One INH Flat Race

runners.comment: Dam half-sister to Arctic Fire; easily won a point for Sam Curling; big player
runners.name: Arcadian Emperor
runners.spotlight: Dam German 1m3f/12.5f winner, half-sister to winners Arctic Fire (high-class 2m-3m hurdle) and Arctic Warrior (useful 2m/2m4f hurdle), out of German 1m3f winner; 30,000euros 3yo won Lisronagh maiden point-to-point in March for Sam Curling; big player on first start for Willie Mullins.

stable_tour.quote: There was lots to like about the way he won his point for Sam Curling at Lisronagh. He looks like he will make a lovely chaser down the road. He's a big chasing type. He's only four, though, and we'll probably stick to bumpers this season. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Moderate fifth in Thurles maiden hurdle (22.5f, good to yielding) on debut; more needed
runners.name: Barnahash Mason
runners.spotlight: By a useful stallion; kept on at one pace when moderate fifth in Thurles maiden hurdle (22.5f, good to yielding) on debut in October; more needed.

runners.comment: Price increased to 50,000euros at three; dam point winner; market will reveal expectations
runners.name: Beechwood Road
runners.spotlight: Masked Marvel gelding; price increased to 50,000euros at three; dam point winner, half-sister to 3m1f chase winner Dento Des Obeaux, out of maiden half-sister to 1m3f AQPS Flat and 2m1f-2m2f hurdle/chase winner Tali Des Obeaux; market will reveal expectations; stable 4-10 in bumpers this season.

runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to the smart Regal Encore; monitor the betting for shrewd yard
runners.name: Brother Bernard
runners.spotlight: Third foal; 20,000euros 3yo; dam unraced half-sister to winners Regal Encore (smart bumper and 2m-3m hurdle/chase) and The Organist (useful bumper and 2m3f-3m hurdle), out of 3m hurdle winner; monitor the market; stable 15-84 in bumpers last five seasons.

runners.comment: Half-brother to winners King Kal (2m3f/2m4f hurdle) and Magneticattraction (point); hooded
runners.name: Diamond Kal
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to winners King Kal (2m3f/2m4f hurdle) and Magneticattraction (point); dam unraced sister to smart 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Casey Jones; hooded for debut; stable 3-25 in bumpers last five seasons.

runners.comment: Sold for £250,000 after point win; two good bumper runs; sets the standard
runners.name: Generous Risk
runners.spotlight: Won three-finisher maiden point-to-point for Donnchadh Doyle in March before selling for £250,000; hit the front in 2m3f Cork bumper on rules debut in April when fading into third; second to stablemate on return in 2m Fairyhouse bumper, headed in closing stages; sets the standard.

stable_tour.quote: A nice young horse. He was third in a bumper at Cork towards the end of last season but I'd say he's a bit better than the bare form of that. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Poor point form; well beaten behind Generous Risk at Fairyhouse; looks set to struggle
runners.name: Muckanagh Lough
runners.spotlight: Nice pedigree; modest point-to-point form; well beaten behind Generous Risk at Fairyhouse last month; looks set to struggle.

runners.comment: Good third at Clonmel but raced too keenly at Tramore on latest; up against it here
runners.name: Isdistheone
runners.spotlight: Four bumper runs to date; improved for softer ground when third at Clonmel last month; raced too keenly when fourth of six at Tramore on latest against her own sex; looks up against it here.

runners.comment: The best of her bumper runs was when 11l third at Punchestown in October; can rule out
runners.name: La Rocca Lass
runners.spotlight: The best of her six bumper runs was when 11l third at Punchestown in October; completely tailed off at Wexford 12 days later (led early); safe to rule out.

runners.comment: Showed next to nothing in point-to-points; beaten out of sight in two bumpers
runners.name: Northernlightsky
runners.spotlight: Showed next to nothing in point-to-points; beaten out of sight in two bumpers; impossible to recommend.

12:17.race_name: Earl Of Harrington Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Point and bumper winner; off nearly a year but has to be respected; the market can help
runners.name: Forceonmyown

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Flat Race
quotes.quote: Forceonmyown will be a nice mare to go jumping with. She's not very big but she has a lot of heart - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Point winner was second in a bumper at this meeting last year before winning at Punchestown; her absence since is a concern but represents a top yard so has to be respected; the market can help.

runners.comment: Out of form on Flat but a repeat of her Grade 1 hurdle 2nd will make her difficult to beat
runners.name: Galileo Dame
runners.owner: Annus Mirabilis Synd/Sean Odriscoll/Middle Cow Umlimited

prev_owners.owner: Annus Mirabilis Synd/Sean Odriscoll/Middle Cow Umlimited

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Looking at that you'd have to say Galileo Dame is a smart filly. I suppose the obvious thing now is to go into an Oaks trial of some sort - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Rated 90 on the Flat but has been badly regressive in her last three starts; however, she was runner-up in a Grade 1 juvenile hurdle last season from three hurdle starts; a repeat of that will make her difficult to beat but her Flat form raises a question.

stable_tour.quote: It looked a good maiden on paper at Leopardstown and she won impressively. She looks a smart filly and she will go for an Oaks trial now, maybe the Blue Wind Stakes. She has options in England and France as well. 23-04-24

runners.comment: Third on the Flat last time in testing ground; considered on hurdling debut
runners.name: Ina Mina
runners.spotlight: Flat winner over 1m4f at Tramore in the summer; was third over the same trip at Gowran on heavy ground making her yard debut last time; considered on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Bumper winner in 2024 but off since; respected from this yard; the market can help
runners.name: Not Negotiable

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Not Negotiable is a big mare with a big engine and I'd be thinking soft ground, at a trip, over fences is where she'd really be at her best. I think she is a proper winter mare. I'd be very excited with her - Patrick Mullins, rider.

runners.spotlight: Showed signs of greenness but was still an easy winner at odds of 2/7 in a Tipperary bumper (2m; yld) in April 2024; an obvious concern that she has been off since and is unproven in these conditions but respected from this yard; the market can help.

runners.comment: Better effort at Naas last time; needs to improve another chunk today but it is possible
runners.name: Belladona Princess
runners.spotlight: Both starts over just short of this trip in maiden hurdles; well beaten at Punchestown on debut but a much better effort at Naas since; needs to improve another chunk today but it is possible.

runners.comment: Fine effort in a Navan maiden hurdle; with improvement from that should be a contender
runners.name: Champagne Venture
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably in several bumpers without winning, including behind Bambino Fever and William Munny; a cracking effort in a Navan maiden hurdle on return; with improvement from that she should be a contender today.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Fairyhouse last time; the third home that day has won since; a player
runners.name: Changeyourstars
runners.owner: Mrs C T Ryan & Philip Brady Partnership
runners.spotlight: Point winner; the best of two maiden hurdle runs came when runner-up at Fairyhouse over this trip last time; the ground was testing then so these conditions hold no fear; the third home that day has won since; a player.

runners.comment: Point winner was runner-up in a Wexford maiden hurdle; this ground may be too testing
runners.name: Clody Diamond
runners.spotlight: Point winner in 2024 was runner-up in a Wexford maiden hurdle (yld) over this trip on second hurdle start; back after a break; capable of a good run but this ground may be too testing.

runners.comment: Was never involved in a Clonmel maiden hurdle on debut and will have to improve hugely
runners.name: Cry Before Dawn
runners.spotlight: Was never involved in a Clonmel maiden hurdle on debut and will have to improve hugely.

runners.comment: Third in a point and maiden hurdle; should have improved from that; hood on; considered
runners.name: Crystal Gold
runners.spotlight: Decent effort in third on sole point start and also in a Punchestown maiden hurdle against geldings on return; should have improved from that and a hood is added, so one to consider.

runners.comment: Point winner showed some ability in bumpers and a maiden hurdle but off a long time
runners.name: Dixies Girl
runners.spotlight: Point winner in 2022 ran respectably in two of three bumpers plus a maiden hurdle the following year; likely best watched back after a long absence.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in a strong Navan maiden hurdle; can improve and shouldn't be far away
runners.name: Doing It In Style
runners.spotlight: Some ability on the first of two bumper runs and improved form after a break when not beaten far in a strong Navan maiden hurdle; can improve from that and shouldn't be far away.

runners.comment: Cost Eur3,000 as a 3yo; will have to be fairly smart to take this on debut
runners.name: Its All Yellow
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-sister to bumper, 1m5f/1m6f Flat (RPR 98) and 2m4f/2m5f hurdle winner Sneaky Getaway; dam Flat maiden, half-sister to French 3m1f Grade 2 chase winner Astonville; cost Eur3,000 as a 3yo; will have to be fairly smart to take this on debut.

runners.comment: Tailed-off in a Cork maiden hurdle on debut so can't be fancied
runners.name: Madam Elle
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off in a Cork maiden hurdle on debut so can't be fancied.

runners.comment: Fourth in a 2m maiden hurdle here; with improvement should be in the mix today if staying
runners.name: Shallow Bowles
runners.spotlight: Pedigree a mix of speed and stamina; outran odds of 125/1 to finish a solid fourth in a 2m maiden hurdle here in November; with improvement likely from that she should be in the mix today if lasting this trip.

runners.comment: Never involved in three maiden hurdles and can only be watched with a view to handicaps
runners.name: Shuil Swift
runners.spotlight: Never involved in rear in three maiden hurdles and can only be watched with a view to handicaps.

runners.comment: Not a lot of promise in two points and a Tramore maiden hurdle so is passed over today
runners.name: Supreme Axel
runners.spotlight: Not a lot of promise in two points and a Tramore maiden hurdle so is passed over today; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Some decent runs in defeat but questions after pulled-up in a Navan handicap last time
runners.name: Toor Idaho
runners.spotlight: The best of eight maiden hurdle runs when second at Ballinrobe over 2m6f in August; some decent runs since but questions now after being pulled-up in a Navan handicap last time.

runners.comment: Some promise on hurdles debut but was tailed-off next time and others appeal more; reserve
runners.name: Loughrask Jet
runners.spotlight: First reserve; some promise on hurdles debut but was tailed-off next time and others appeal more.

runners.comment: A hint of ability in two bumpers and two maiden hurdles; others appeal more; reserve
runners.name: Nothing Da Now
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; just a hint of ability in two bumpers and two maiden hurdles; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Pulled-up all starts; saddle slipped last time but still can't be fancied; reserve
runners.name: Beara Beauty
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; pulled-up in a bumper and two maiden hurdles; saddle slipped last time but still can't be fancied.

12:52.race_name: Tim & Martin Molony Veterans Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Hurdle winner last time; ran well enough in a Cork hunter chase in April; considered
runners.name: West Cork Wildway

quotes.race: Brenda Sheedy Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I suppose age was catching up with West Cork Wildway a small bit, but in fairness, the handicapper dropped him down a few lbs. He's one of the stable stars for me anyway and he brings on all the young stock at home. He has always shown his spark at home and I thought if we got his conditions, he could win again. It was a slowly run race, which suited him and we got a bit of soft ground. Hopefully, he might pick up another one - Paul Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: West Cork Wildway was very good today. He learned from his mistake at Killarney and he is a nice horse going forward. He'll give us a few more good days out hopefully - Paul O'Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Boomerang.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He hadn't run in a while but Paul (O'Flynn) thought he'd run well. He's not a bad horse. I thought that was a nice race. He can be a bit funny with his head at times. I think he might progress further chasing - rider Darragh O'Keeffe.

quotes.race: Season Finale INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a very nice horse with a good pedigree. Any horse who can win a four-year-old maiden first time out obviously has a fair level of ability and he won a winners' race too. After a break, he ran very well in a nice maiden hurdle at Listowel, beaten by two decent horses, and he was well entitled to do what he did today. I think the owners had an offer to sell him after his point-to-point but they're a big syndicate and I think they felt they'd rather have some fun with him. You'd look forward to him in a maiden hurdle after that, he's a very athletic jumper - Eoin O'Brien, rider of West Cork Wildway

runners.spotlight: Returned to form when winning over hurdles at Cork last time; has had only nine chase runs, his sole win coming in 2021 but did run well enough in a Cork hunter chase in April; considered.

runners.comment: Hit and miss in both codes this year but would have a chance if repeating his best form
runners.name: Krabat
runners.spotlight: Maiden over hurdles but is 1-15 over fences; has been hit and miss in both codes this year but would have a chance if repeating his best form.

runners.comment: Not a bad Tipperary handicap run in July; a shout if at his best; can go well fresh
runners.name: Dundaniel
runners.spotlight: Has won three points and a hunter chase; best run this year when a close third in a Killarney hunter chase in May; not a bad Tipperary handicap run in July; a shout if at his best; can go well fresh.

runners.comment: Three chase wins at Tramore; well beaten over hurdles on return; others make more appeal
runners.name: Rochestown

quotes.race: QuinnBet.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Rochestown loves it here and we're running out of races for him here. The last day he ran, our horses had a little cloud over them. We knew he was in form today and we'll find something for him here in May if there's some rain. If not, we'll leave him off. He can revert back over hurdles. It's Philip's first winner for me so that was nice. They did a good job watering today and that's as good as he'd want it. He dug deep and he's tough - Brendan Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Hospitality At Festival 2023 Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rochestown got a great ride from Ambrose. He just idled a bit going to the last. Hopefully we can find another similar race - Brendan Walsh, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Record of 3-10 over fences but they all came at Tramore, the latest in April; well beaten over hurdles on return and others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way on return at Galway; has a squeak if back to his form early this year
runners.name: Baldurs Gate

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "We Play Together" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Baldur's Gate got a great spin from James, the horse just needed the 7lb off over the trip. He's just had a few niggly problems but we always thought he was a nice horse, He's a gent of a horse. We'll find something over Christmas - Denise O'Shea, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Sole win from 17 chase runs came in 2023 but has been placed many times since; beaten a long way on return to action at Galway but has a squeak if back to his form of earlier this year.

runners.comment: Has been regressive in the last year and has to do much better than recent offerings
runners.name: Clonmeen

quotes.race: Tote, Never Beaten By SP Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Clonmeen put in a tough performance, he gave a stone to the second. A good handicap off a low weight might be what I'm thinking about, maybe the National Trial here - Willie Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Record of 2-23 over fences; has been regressive in the last year and has to do much better than recent offerings.

runners.comment: Fourth over hurdles at Punchestown after an absence; a big player if building on that
runners.name: Difficult Decision

quotes.race: Limerick Racecourse Vets Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Difficult Decision got a nice start and jumped brilliant all the way - Phillip Enright, jockey.

quotes.race: Littleton Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Difficult Decision was a bit unlucky at Punchestown last time. I thought today was a bit short for him, he is really a three-miler, but he was a bit keen early on so we let him stride on and he was game - Oliver McKiernan, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Difficult Decision was keen early on and that's why I kept holding onto him. He's been off a while but he had been ready to go all last year. Oliver didn't want to chance him on the good ground. He's a soft ground horse with plenty to learn - Barry Browne, rider

runners.spotlight: Two wins apiece over hurdles and fences including two at this track; returned from a long absence with a fine fourth over hurdles at Punchestown; can be a big player if building on that.

runners.comment: Hurdle winner two starts back; hasn't run over fences since 2023 but a chance on that form
runners.name: Halsafari
runners.owner: John P Bowe & Michael J Bowe

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Halsafari had a good blow the first day and he improved a lot the second day and thankfully, he came forward again - James Barcoe, trainer.

quotes.race: D Pack Packaging Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Halsafari only ran two days ago here and the first thing Brian Hayes said when he came in was that he needed the run. So it's thanks to Brian and he's improved a ton. He's a natural chaser and it's some turnaround from two days ago when we were so disappointed - John Bowe, owner-breeder

runners.spotlight: Came back to form on third start for this yard when winning over hurdles at Cork but was well below that level at the same track since; hasn't run over fences since 2023 but would have a chance on that old form.

runners.comment: Maiden over fences but third at Fairyhouse last time; should go well with blinkers added
runners.name: Decimation
runners.owner: Michael Hannon & James Mcnamara & James Byrnes

quotes.race: Molson Coors Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Decimation has been knocking on the door and it was nice to get his head in front. The main challenger went but he stuck at it well and he's a lovely horse - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

runners.spotlight: One-time smart hurdler is yet to win over fences in nine starts but some decent efforts including a third at Fairyhouse last time; should go well with blinkers added.

stable_tour.quote: He's tipping away and looks the type who could do nicely over fences. You will see him out in a beginners' chase in the coming weeks and we're looking forward to it. 14-11-22

runners.comment: Poor when last seen over fences in UK nearly three years ago; others make more appeal
runners.name: Smackwater Jack
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner has been well beaten in that sphere lately; poor when last seen over fences in UK nearly three years ago; others make more appeal.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good start over fences at Aintree but has missed 18 months. He's back in good form now and we'll start in a handicap chase with him in about six weeks. He could become a very nice staying chaser. 27-10-22

runners.comment: Only one win over fences; best recent runs have been over hurdles; others preferred
runners.name: The Little Yank

quotes.race: BetVictor Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Little Yank had a lot of trouble with ulcers and we couldn't figure what was wrong with him. He's going to be a smashing chaser for the summer - John Ryan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Seven time winner in all disciplines, though only once over fences; best recent runs have been over hurdles; others preferred.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner but regressive this year; can't be fancied from 19lb out of the handicap
runners.name: Eddies Pride

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Eddies Pride needs to be ridden cold and to come late, Gary gave her a fantastic ride and did exactly as he was told. She's a lovely, well-bred mare that has had a lot of niggly problems. She'll stay at it - Norman Lee, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner but regressive this year and can't be fancied from 19lb out of the handicap.

13:27.race_name: McMahons Builders Providers Irish EBF Dawn Run Mares Novice Chase (Grade 2)

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner including here; solid 2nd to a subsequent Grade 2 winner on chase bow
runners.name: Farfromnowhere

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Farfromnowhere is a great mare to jump. We'll see what's coming but we won't run her on too fast ground. We'll treat her like she's good until she proves us wrong - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner including here; was a solid second on chase bow at Cork to subsequent Grade 2 winner Kala Conti; was 15l ahead of Jade De Grugy then but may struggle to uphold that form, though is still a player.

runners.comment: Won two points this term but this is an ambitious tilt on rules debut
runners.name: Honey Come Quick
runners.spotlight: Won two points this term, the latest a mares' winners' race by 24l; however, this is an ambitious ask on rules debut and likely to find several too strong.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie La Grugerie
runners.comment: Grade 1-winning hurdler was soundly beaten on chase bow but can improve plenty from that
runners.name: Jade De Grugy

quotes.race: SBK Irish EBF Mares Champion Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Jade De Grugy has been improving all year. Nicer ground was a big help and tactically Paul was brilliant. We're delighted to be able to win a Grade 1 race with a filly like this. Brighterdaysahead probably just had a very hard race at Christmas and she never really recovered from it. She could [jump a fence] but it wouldn't be what we'd be looking forward to at this stage, we'd rather keep her hurdling. I'd say we'll probably train her for the Mares' Hurdle next year -  Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Quevega Mares Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Annie Power won this race before winning the Champion Hurdle and it has been won in the past [Black Tears] before winning the Mares' Hurdle at Cheltenham. It was a nice comeback on Jade De Grugy's first run of the season. She had worked nicely at home and I was very happy with her coming here. She showed me today what she had showed me at home. I think she'll improve a fair bit for the race, which leaves us in a good position going to Cheltenham. Carrying the weight she carried today against nice opposition, I think is a good sign - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Honeysuckle Mares' Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Jade De Grugy showed how good and how tough she is, and it was a great run from the runner-up as well. She does look like a two-and-half mile mare, coming back from Cheltenham, to put in a run like that. A lot of the Cheltenham horses haven't featured at this meeting and I think it's a tough ask on that ground. It'll be Punchestown next I'd imagine. We didn't find out or look for anything at home since Cheltenham, it's a Grade 1, so you have to take your chance. This is the race you want to win rather than Cheltenham because it's a Grade 1. You always want to win Grade 1 rather than a Grade 2 - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Solerina Mares Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jade De Grugy was very impressive. She did things right all the way and she jumps brilliant. She travelled and quickened up in the straight. Brian was very happy with her. She's a very sensible mare and always did everything right. We're delighted with her. She has the race at Cheltenham and the Grade 1 back here as well afterwards. There is a short gap between them, but I'd imagine they will be the two targets - David Casey, assistant to Willie Mullins.

quotes.race: Savills Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jade De Grugy is exciting. She did it nicely. I thought we built up down the back the second time and she stayed going well. She obviously stays well, the ground is testing, and she has a lovely attitude. She jumped well and did everything nicely - Paul Townend, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner culminating in a Grade 1 win at the Punchestown festival last term; was 2/7 fav' but was well beaten on chase bow at Cork; has 15l to make up on Farfromnowhere from that run but is likely to be a lot sharper today; big player.

stable_tour.quote: A fine, big strong mare who put together three really good runs last season. She chased home Lossiemouth in the Mares' Hurdle at Cheltenham and then won very well at Punchestown in the Grade 1 race there. She has the option of going over fences, but we could keep her over hurdles. She will do the opposite to Kargese. If one goes over fences, the other won't. The Mares' Hurdle would be her obvious target again should she stay over hurdles. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Beginners' chase winner ran well at Clonmel last time but has a lot to find in this grade
runners.name: Littlebiggie
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner took a beginners' chase at Ballinrobe; ran well enough in defeat at Clonmel last time but has a lot to find in this grade.

runners.breeder: Southeast B/S, O Hickey & L Gleeson
runners.comment: Grade 2 h'dle winner on this card last year; Grade 1 placed since; solid chase bow; player
runners.name: The Big Westerner

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with The Big Westerner; she ran a blinder. She just got into a little bit of trouble at the second-last, but ran really well. I very much hope she's a chaser in the making - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Lyons Of Limerick Jaguar Land Rover Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: The Big Westerner is a classy mare and shows plenty of gears. I was cantering turning in and and I thought she quickened up really well coming to the second-last. She has plenty more to offer. On soft ground I would say she will have no problem coming back in trip. She stays well but has plenty of gears - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Big Westerner looks a nice mare. She jumped well and travelled great. She was a bit slow at the last but she picked up and went away. She was still a bit green - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Grade 2 novice hurdle winner on this card last year over 2m7f; was Grade 1-placed at the Cheltenham festival since before being pulled-up at Fairyhouse; made a solid chase bow at Fairyhouse when 18l ahead of a subsequent novice winner; more to come; big player.

stable_tour.quote: I'm very happy with her. She seems in great form. She's going over fences and could start off in a mares' beginners' chase at Cork this month. She looks like a real chaser and hopefully I'm proved right. She has so much class that I think she'll be good over any trip, but I think softer conditions are important for her. Looking ahead, the mares' novice chase at Limerick over Christmas could be an option after Cork. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Won a Wexford beginners' and second in a Fairyhouse h'cap; plenty to find today
runners.name: Uhavemeinstitches

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Mark [Walsh] gave Uhavemeinstitches a lovely ride. They went very quickly in front. Mark said they went nearly too fast, he thought and it fell apart a bit. She's a nice mare going forward. She is still a bit babyish; she made one or two novice mistakes, which I didn't think she would, but I suppose it's the speed as well. It was her first time racing at that speed over fences. I am not sure where she will slot in. That was for horses rated 120 or less over hurdles, so a lot of the higher-class horses were ruled out of it. We will have to see where she fits into the rankings as the season goes on, but she is a nice filly to have. We went a real strong gallop and I always thought Liam [Quinlan] was going to come back which he did - James Motherway, trainer.Uhavemeinstitches was good bar the first but she learned and jump brilliant after that. It was only her fifth lifetime start so you would have to be happy with her. I'd be hoping she would stay well and do something like her mother - Mark Wash, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Earl Of Harrington Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Uhavemeinstitches is a lovely filly who we've liked from day one. She jumped so well early on that she was jumping into the back of one or two of them, but she was really good at the last two. She had a little look when she got to the front, but Simon [Torrens, jockey] said she found plenty when he got after her. She really filled out her frame during the summer and when she came back to us in the autumn, I was really delighted with her. I knew I had a mare to train then. She's only four rising five, so hopefully there's plenty to come. Stamina will probably be her forte down the line - James Motherway, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle at this meeting last year but is bred to be a chaser (dam won Irish National) and is already better in this sphere; won a Wexford beginners' and second in a Fairyhouse handicap over 2m4f; this trip should suit but has a fair bit to find.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner has been nowhere near her best over fences and passed over today
runners.name: Whatcouldhavebeen
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner has been nowhere near her best over fences, beaten a long way in three starts; passed over today.

runners.comment: Was in front when running out at Fairyhouse when last seen over hurdles in 2024; watch
runners.name: Boher Road

quotes.race: FEXCO Handicap
quotes.quote: Boher Road is thriving. I was very happy the whole way round and showed here that he was very versatile. I couldn't believe how far clear he was at the line, he loved the track - Ronan Whelan, rider

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets Supports Brentford Football Club Maiden
quotes.quote: Boher Road is a nice horse and has improved with every run. We knew we had the form in the book to be there or thereabouts today. Ronan gave him a great ride, he could have done with a bit more cover but it just didn't work out. Ronan says he'll go further so hopefully when he learns his job he'll do that - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won twice on the Flat in 2024 but was below form on last two starts in that sphere; was in front when running out at Fairyhouse when last seen over hurdles earlier that year; seems best to watch on return.

runners.comment: Galway maiden hurdle winner in 2023 was disappointing there next time; watch on return
runners.name: Free Flowing
runners.spotlight: Galway maiden hurdle winner in October 2023 but was disappointing there next time; is rated only 109 so has loads to find in this company so can only be watched on return.

runners.breeder: S & G Kinast & Haras De La Rousseliere
runners.comment: Grade 1-placed hurdler ran a cracker in a Leopardstown h'cap when last seen; big chance
runners.name: Storm Heart

quotes.race: Tote.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Storm Heart was very good. I didn't expect that and he is more than alright looking at that performance. His attitude was great and he loves jumping. I think there could be huge improvement in him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: French Flat winner won a Punchestown juvenile maiden hurdle two years ago before being twice placed in Grade 1 company; just one run last season but it was a cracking effort in a big Leopardstown handicap; can go well fresh and clear top-rated so a big chance.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a huge race in the big handicap hurdle at the Dublin Racing Festival when second, but missed Cheltenham with a small setback afterwards. Hopefully we can get a clear run with him this season as he's talented. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Bumper winner got off the mark over hurdles at Clonmel last time; has a bit to find here
runners.name: Parnell Street

quotes.race: Thanks To All For Your Support In 2025 (Q.R.) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Parnell Street is a grand horse. Pat had the two half-brothers. Gomez Addams was the other one that he sold, so he said he wanted to hold onto this one. His other half-brother [Twinjets] actually won a handicap chase 20 lengths for Paul Nicholls in Newbury. Chasing is his game when you see the size of him. He has been schooled over fences as a three-year-old. He's a brilliant jumper, but we'll tip away over hurdles for this year. We knew he would go in that ground. We ran him in a bumper in Limerick and it was pure muck, so we knew he would go on it. We think even up to three miles will suit him. We probably will go to Limerick. He's been in awhile now. He was in for a few summer bumpers. We may as well keep him going after he won his maiden hurdle. There's no point looking back next year. We thought he wasn't right in Listowel, so we were kind of confident he would reverse the placings with That Danny Feeling this time. We thought the ground was a bit quick for him in Listowel - Andrew Slattery, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper winner at Killarney but wasn't able to follow up in winners' company at Listowel; got off the mark over hurdles at Clonmel last time over just short of this trip; has a bit to find here but can run respectably.

runners.breeder: M Laurent Kling & M Alain Dambrines
runners.comment: Placed in points and bumpers; got off the mark on hurdles bow at Thurles; can run well
runners.name: Riskaway

quotes.race: Book Your Christmas Party Here On December 20th Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was delighted with Riskaway as it was messy and was a cat-and-mouse sort of race. Some of us were out-jumping each other, but we didn't want to go on and he did it well in the end. He stumbled at the back of one hurdle, having jumped it perfectly, but other than that he was perfect. Going two and a half miles suited. He could probably go further and hopefully he will keep progressing - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Placed in all starts in points and bumpers; got off the mark on hurdles bow at Thurles over this trip on gd/yld, showing improved form; handles this sort of ground too; more to come; can run well.

stable_tour.quote: We might give him one more run in a bumper and then send him straight over hurdles. He's better than you've seen so far. 26-10-25

14:37.race_name: BOYLE Sports Home Of The Early Payout Ladies Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won under Jody Townend at Listowel (2m2f, good to yielding); testing ground won't be ideal
runners.name: Ollie La Ba Ba

quotes.race: MCG Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was brilliant. Jodie [Townend, jockey] is a huge asset in these races and she gave Ollie La Ba Ba a peach and got him up where it mattered. I probably had a different horse in mind for her. I thought Tinking Man was really solid coming here, but when he got balloted out, I wasn't going to lose Jodie so we switched around. We're having one of those weeks and it is bouncing our way - Eoin McCarthy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won under Jody Townend at Listowel (2m2f, good to yielding) in September and is 5lb higher here; well held over fences last time; trip is fine but testing ground won't be ideal.

runners.comment: Solid placed form in 2m maidens, including here; shapes like this trip will suit
runners.name: Torps
runners.spotlight: Solid placed form in 2m maidens, including when second on main track here in October; beaten at 4-7 on inner track here last time when winner got first run on him; shapes like this trip will suit.

runners.comment: Been running fair races over fences and couldn't rule him out on ground he'll handle
runners.name: Whateys Quest

quotes.race: Limerick Racecourse Vets Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Whateys Quest was on his head the whole way at Naas the last day and couldn't lie up. I had this race in mind for a while and it worked out. The ground is more testing and more dead today, everything was in his favour - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has been chasing since winning 2m3f maiden hurdle at Clonmel last year, and won over fences (extended 2m6f) here last Christmas; been running okay lately and will handle the ground.

runners.comment: Placed in maidens on nice ground during the summer, with form up to 3m; handicap debut
runners.name: Coded Welder
runners.spotlight: Placed, including behind some useful types, in maidens on nice ground during the summer, with form up to 3m; after a layoff, tailed off on winter ground in Navan maiden on handicap debut.

runners.comment: 2m4f winner on soft but has been out of form; well handicapped again but needs a revival
runners.name: One Big Boum
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back races, including 2m4f Cork handicap on soft, over a year ago; hasn't hit the frame in six outings since; well handicapped again but needs a revival.

runners.comment: Stays up to 3m; possibly still a bit high in the ratings but not out of it; handles heavy
runners.name: Oneforgonzo

quotes.race: Buy The Centenary Of Naas Racecourse Book By Turtle Bunbury Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Oneforgonzo is a nice horse, in that grade anyway. Hopefully when he strengthens up and develops he'll go on to do something better - Sean Aherne, trainer

runners.spotlight: Won his first two completed starts in handicaps in 2024; after a fruitless spell chasing, has run some good races back over hurdles at Cork this year and stays up to 3m; mark possibly still a bit high.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner has 12lb lower mark in this sphere; should improve from Cork comeback
runners.name: Midweek Voices

quotes.race: O'Driscolls Irish Whiskey Careys Cottage Cup Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Midweek Voices won the last day and Cian was saying a galloping track suits him, while he was well in at the weights today. Cian gave him a great ride, he was patient and jumped his way into it. He's improving. Before, he wasn't finding much off the bridle but he's sticking at it better now. His jumping is getting slicker. Hopefully we can go for one of them good handicaps. He still has a good mark over hurdles but his jumping is his forte over fences. He was plenty in his hands but he got in behind a few then and switched off a bit. I think he would stay a bit further - Eoin Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Midweek Voices had been a bit frustrating in his races, he didn't see to be getting home, but the drop back in trip might have helped. He jumped well today apart from one. We'll look at another handicap for him - Eoin Doyle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back chases on soft early this year; maiden over hurdles, best effort when second to Whateys Quest at Clonmel last year; should come on from seasonal debut at Cork, where long way behind Rowdy, and has 12lb lower mark in this sphere.

runners.comment: Good form over 2m4f on heavy ground in the spring; sharper for last month's return
runners.name: Chosen Diamond

quotes.race: Overlander Horseboxes Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Chosen Diamond is a horse I didn't think I would be waiting until now to win with. I never lost faith in him. We started schooling him a month ago and I though this was his game. He was very professional and is a natural jumper - Eddie Cawley, trainer

runners.spotlight: Winning chaser had good form in 2m4f hurdles on heavy in the spring, winning at Fairyhouse and second at Navan; should be sharper for last month's return over fences; headgear back on is a plus.

runners.comment: Maiden's best run was last time when narrowly beaten in 24-runner handicap at Cork; up 4lb
runners.name: Rowdy
runners.spotlight: Maiden's best run was last time when prominent throughout and narrowly beaten in 24-runner handicap at Cork (2m4f, soft to heavy); up 4lb, and in grade, but should be involved.

runners.comment: Course winner over extended 2m6f (yielding) in March; well beaten last two starts
runners.name: Aleish Lass
runners.spotlight: Course winner over extended 2m6f (yielding) in March and placed over 3m next time; well beaten last two starts (over fences latest) and looks opposable on first run since July.

runners.comment: 2m4f on testing ground looks his thing and last run may have come too soon
runners.name: Without Exception

quotes.race: Festival 2025 Group Tickets From 27 Euros Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: My lad races lazily but when I started to get after Without Exception after the second-last he seemed to be picking up and picking up. Philip (Rothwell) said ride him wide and I did, it worked out anyway. The ground at Down Royal last time was too quick, these conditions suited - Tiernan Power Roche, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.spotlight: 2m4f on testing ground suits him; won at Punchestown early in the year and second at Fairyhouse last month; poor run last time may have come too soon; trainer and jockey took this in 2023.

runners.comment: Won over 2m7f (heavy) at Thurles last year and second over 3m next time; out of form since
runners.name: Cloudy Fountain
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m7f (heavy) at Thurles last year and second over 3m next time; been out of form over hurdles and fences since; after long layoff, tailed off here last month; back on a good mark, at least.

runners.comment: Showed ability in points; 3lb wrong for handicap debut; shrewd yard
runners.name: Kanog Bay
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in points early in the year; beaten around 45l in all three maidens; 3lb wrong for handicap debut; shrewd yard and one to note if there's market support.

runners.comment: Won three times for the late Edward O'Grady; been off over a year, testing ground a worry
runners.name: Gwan Tadhg

quotes.race: Randox Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground went a bit soft for us, so it probably wasn't the best of Gwan Tadhg today. He kind of laboured at the finish, but it was nice for him to win again - Mark McDonagh, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won three times for the late Edward O'Grady during a good spell of form in late summer of 2023; has been off over a year and, although he has run well fresh before, testing ground won't help him.

runners.comment: Stayed on well to make the frame at Naas  in mid-December; could go well if doesn't bounce
runners.name: King Kali
runners.spotlight: Listowel festival winner last year and, after nearly 15 months off, stayed on well to make the frame at Naas in mid-December; this run comes quick enough, so the 'bounce' factor is a risk, but he's lightly raced for his age and should handle the ground.

runners.comment: Good fourth at Galway festival in 2023 but not seen since, ground will be against him too
runners.name: Trebizond

quotes.race: Boyle Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Trebizond has plenty of gears and I rode him for a bit of toe today. He has been a bit unlucky and deserved that. He missed the last a bit but he galloped to the line in fairness to him - Dylan Robinson, rider.

runners.spotlight: Maiden winner for Henry de Bromhead and won twice for Mike Smith in Britain; good fourth at Galway festival in 2023 but not seen since and ground will be against him too; stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: He got there in the end at Roscommon. Dylan [Robinson] was very confident on him and he picked up really well for him after the last. He has a nice turn of foot and we'll keep an eye out for something suitable for him in the coming weeks. 24-10-21

runners.breeder: S C E A Team Hogdala France, High Valley Equine Ltd
runners.comment: Unfortunate not to win a point and has shown up relatively well in maidens; can improve
runners.name: Peaceinthevalley
runners.spotlight: Unfortunate not to win a point and has shown up relatively well in maidens (only 4-1 for Naas contest two runs back); represents powerful connections and every chance an opening mark of 105 could be lenient.

runners.comment: Mid-division on stable debut at Navan and testing ground won't help his cause
runners.name: Metamorpheus
runners.spotlight: Winless under all codes since winning a maiden hurdle almost three years ago; mid-division on stable debut at Navan and testing ground won't help his cause; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to run Metamorpheus in the Boodles provided he sneaks in. 25-02-23

runners.comment: Respectable run on handicap debut at Cork, not quite getting home over 2m4f
runners.name: Is Charlie Around
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in maidens at Clonmel and respectable run on handicap debut at Cork last time, not quite getting home over 2m4f when beaten around 20l; tongue-tie goes on and this trip might be a better fit for him.

runners.comment: Prominent racer comes here in good form; handles soft, should be okay on this terrain
runners.name: Wardens Whisper
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer was touched off here last Christmas before winning at Cork; placed twice this term and his run at Galway in October was particularly creditable; handles soft, should be okay on this terrain.

runners.comment: Smart bumper form a couple of years ago and could be on a nice mark for handicap debut
runners.name: Big Dee

quotes.race: Ladbrokes (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Big Dee is one we like an awful lot. He got outsprinted at Listowel when he was green and babyish. He settled better today. Horses like these are great for a yard like mine and I think we'll stay in bumpers for now - Eoin McCarthy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart bumper form a couple of years ago; fell on hurdling debut and quiet maiden runs since; can be free, so will need to settle, but could be on a nice mark for handicap debut.

runners.comment: Middle maiden run at Down Royal makes him of interest on handicap debut; yard in form
runners.name: Rackemandstackem
runners.spotlight: Another handicap debutant and represents a powerful yard that is back in form; his middle maiden run, in Down Royal contest won by Royal Bond runner-up Blake, makes him of interest.

runners.comment: Has run well to a point in his last couple of maidens and should come on from Navan outing
runners.name: Fighting Falcon
runners.spotlight: Has run well to a point in his last couple of maidens and should come on for first run of the year at Navan; handicap debut.

runners.comment: Won a couple of hurdles on heavy in 2022; not a bad run last time at Naas
runners.name: Marelly

quotes.race: Racing TV Rated Novice Hurdle (In Memory Of Andrew McNamara)
quotes.quote: Marelly did that well. He goes well on the deep ground and he's two from two over it now - Eoin Christopher McCarthy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a couple of hurdles on heavy in 2022, including at this festival meeting; winless since and well exposed now; mark continues to fall, not a bad run last time at Naas and conditions will suit.

runners.comment: Winner over 2m3f (good) at Downpatrick last year; fair runs in chases lately
runners.name: Kilbrin Rocco

quotes.race: Grant Bros Developments Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kilbrin Rocco is a nice horse. We were happy in Thurles last time, beaten 20l but he was staying on and Adrian Heskin said he will win races - Mick Winters, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Big-priced winner over 2m3f (good) at Downpatrick last year for Michael Winters; hasn't made the frame since but fair runs in Clonmel handicap chases lately, including on soft last month; good second over fences here on Friday.

runners.comment: Long-standing maiden but plenty of creditable runs; drops back to 2m; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Blue Reed
runners.spotlight: Long-standing maiden but plenty of creditable runs; twice runner-up over 2m4f on testing ground early in the year, not as good since; generally races over farther, drops back to 2m here with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Maiden runs were respectable but has struggled in handicaps;  needs to up her game
runners.name: The Sugarhill Lady
runners.owner: Eamon Leahy & Seamus Oriordan & Carmel Walsh
runners.spotlight: Maiden runs were respectable but has struggled in handicaps; her half-sister Millstream Lady continues to progress for yard but this 5yo needs to up her game.

runners.comment: Maiden has been touched off twice in handicaps; best form on yielding; 1lb wrong
runners.name: Shes On Line
runners.spotlight: Maiden was touched off on the inner track here last year and at Clonmel in October; finished sore when disappointing here last month; best form on yielding; one of three runners for yard; 1lb wrong.

15:41.race_name: D & J Glazing Novice Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Winning chaser stays much farther but handled drop back to 2m when scoring at Naas; up 7lb
runners.name: River Vale

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The form of the race at Listowel has worked out. It's great to give Shane [Fitzgerald] a winner as he made horses for us and he's never ridden River Vale before so I'm delighted. He's a great jockey and is a big asset as he carries no lead. I was a bit concerned about the ground but the horse jumped well. The ground was a concern, it was beautiful ground but I'd say he'd want it a bit softer - Michael Winters, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winning chaser stays much farther but handled drop back to 2m when landing handicap hurdle at Naas (soft to heavy) last time; good second here over 2m3f last Christmas and should go well again.

runners.comment: 1m4f winner last year but out of form under both codes this year
runners.name: Paradise Lost
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner on soft last year but out of form under both codes this year and has been well held in handicap hurdles so far.

runners.comment: Scored under this rider at Thurles (2m, good to yielding); up 7lb for that win
runners.name: Harrys Dream

quotes.race: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Harry's Dream had been placed in bumpers and ran very well in a maiden hurdle, but then disappointed. He ran a good race the last day and I'd say racing down the hill helped today. He struggles on good ground because of his confirmation, and struggles on heavy due to his wind. He'll stay doing what he's doing now - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Early promise in heavy-ground bumpers and placed in Gowran maiden hurdle last year; had dropped 9lb from initial mark when scoring under this rider at Thurles (2m, good to yielding); back up 7lb for that win.

runners.comment: Much improved on second handicap start when not beaten far at Galway (2m, yielding)
runners.name: Kellys Cosmos
