runners.spotlight: Just fair form in maidens but much improved on second handicap start when not beaten far at Galway (2m, yielding) in October; form has worked out quite well and should be more to come from him; testing ground is an imponderable.

runners.comment: Second in a bumper on soft; best hurdles run when fifth (beaten 6.5l) in Listowel handicap
runners.name: Gaoithe Glory
runners.spotlight: Good second in Listowel bumper on soft last year and best hurdles run when fifth (beaten 6.5l) in a handicap at that track in September; has had a break and could have more to offer for local yard.

runners.comment: Ran well in a couple of heavy-ground maidens; may have needed the run at Naas last time
runners.name: Taketwotoone
runners.spotlight: Second in a point and ran well in a couple of heavy-ground maiden hurdles, once here; after eight months off, ran like she needed it when long way behind River Vale at Naas.

runners.comment: Has twice run well in Clonmel handicaps, beaten a little over 2l each time; tongue-tie
runners.name: Sheriffhill

prev_owners.owner: Paul G Murphy & M J Nixon & J G Reilly

runners.spotlight: Maiden was formerly with Terence O'Brien; has twice run well in Clonmel handicaps for current trainer, beaten a little over 2l each time; handled heavy when fourth over 2m3f last time; should have a race in him before long; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: One of a couple of 3yos in here; fair efforts on last two starts against his own age group
runners.name: Cumberland River
runners.spotlight: One of a couple of 3yos in here, getting 15lb weight-for-age; fair efforts on last two outings against his own age group; could well be competitive in first handicap if handling ground which will be new to him.

runners.comment: Showed a bit more last time when beaten 20l in Clonmel maiden on heavy; first handicap
runners.name: Kofino
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit more last time when beaten 20l in Clonmel maiden on heavy; first handicap.

runners.comment: Modest Flat performer in Britain; has shown handicap-winning potential on last two starts
runners.name: Burlington House

prev_owners.owner: The Sarkar Family & Newsells Park Stud

runners.spotlight: Modest Flat performer in Britain; has shown winning potential on first two starts in handicap hurdles, fifth in a big field over this trip at Navan and a closer fourth at Clonmel (2m3f, heavy).

runners.comment: Hadn't shown much until last time when well-backed favourite at Cork; drop to 2m may help
runners.name: Diamond Dollar
runners.spotlight: Hadn't shown much, and had dropped 12lb from initial mark, until well-backed favourite at Cork (2m4f, soft to heavy) where he travelled into it well before fading to be beaten 6l; drop to 2m may help and no weight on his back.

runners.comment: Chased home subsequent improver on hurdling debut in the summer; yet to build on that
runners.name: Felicity Smoak
runners.owner: E Dillon & B Power & J J Whelan & K R Waplington
runners.spotlight: Second over 1m2f off 58 and chased home subsequent improver on hurdling debut in the summer; both of those runs were on nice ground; yet to build on that good start over flights and well held in heavy-ground handicap last month.

runners.comment: Modest form so far including in first two handicaps; drops back in trip; blinkered
runners.name: Fourcardrun
runners.spotlight: Modest form so far including in first two handicaps; drops back in trip; blinkered.

runners.comment: Well held in three maidens; hood goes on for handicap debut;  yard does quite well here
runners.name: Sunrise Strider
runners.spotlight: Well held in three maidens; hood goes on for handicap debut; yard does quite well at this venue.

runners.comment: Modest form on the level and similar story over hurdles, including in first two handicaps
runners.name: Nobody
runners.spotlight: Modest form on the level and similar story over hurdles, including in first two handicaps.

runners.comment: 6f course winner in September; strong chance back down in class
runners.name: Motor
runners.spotlight: Got the season off to a flyer with a comfortable 6f win here in September; held in higher grade next time but should find this company more manageable; strong chance back down in class.

runners.comment: Impressed with front-running success on debut over 6f here last month; obvious contender
runners.name: Salon S
runners.owner: 24/25 Frankie Lor Fu Chuen Trainer Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Impressed with front-running success on debut over 6f here last month, scoring with plenty in hand; 7lb rise demands more but he looks the type to improve; good prospect.

runners.comment: Took a step forward from his debut when a good second over 6f at Happy Valley this month
runners.name: Turin Champions
runners.owner: Dr Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung, Tsoi Huk Yam & Ken Huang Jian Hua
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward from his debut when a good second over 6f at Happy Valley three weeks ago; still learning but has shown enough ability to be taken seriously.

runners.comment: Has started awkwardly in his last couple of barrier trials and has shown only modest form
runners.name: Blasted Talent
runners.spotlight: Has started awkwardly in his last couple of barrier trials and has shown only modest form; will need to have the start figured out to stand any chance on today's debut.

runners.comment: Has shown promise in recent trials, notably when second last time; consult market
runners.name: Chill Partners
runners.spotlight: AUD$100,000 yearling; has shown promise in recent trials, notably when second last time; consult market.

runners.breeder: L F Amodeo, P L Amodeo Et Al
runners.comment: Offered little at big odds on debut here last month and finished tailed off
runners.name: Crossborderdude
runners.owner: Hung Sut Chung, Wu Haibo & Ken Hung Kam Lung
runners.spotlight: Offered little at big odds on debut here last month and finished tailed off; likely to need more time.

runners.comment: Showed promise in Australian trials but local trials haven't been so good
runners.name: Gorgeous Victory
runners.spotlight: Sold for AUD$120,000 at the 2024 Inglis Ready2Race sale after a steady breeze-up; showed promise in Australian trials but local trials haven't been so good.

runners.comment: Finished down the field on debut here over 6f last month; blinkers now added
runners.name: Jolly Brilliant
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field on debut here over 6f last month; should come on for the experience but can only be watched for now; blinkers added.

runners.comment: Well beaten on last season's debut but stayed on for second behind Salon S here last month
runners.name: Super Dragon
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in his only start last season but shaped encouragingly when staying on for second behind Salon S over 6f here last month; entitled to get closer at today's weights and respected despite a tricky draw.

runners.comment: Beaten a fair margin in both runs so far and has yet to show enough to be of interest
runners.name: Falcon Hunter
runners.spotlight: Beaten a fair margin in both runs so far and has yet to show enough to be of interest; this step up in trip needs to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Not disgraced when seventh on debut but failed to go on from that here last time
runners.name: Forever Fancy
runners.owner: James Lau Chi Wing, Lau Kai Tai & Michelle Lau Wing Sheung
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when seventh on debut but failed to go on from that here last time; others make stronger appeal for win purposes.

runners.comment: Finished well held in both starts so far (6f/7f)
runners.name: Star Elegance
runners.spotlight: Finished well held in both starts so far (6f/7f); needs to find significant improvement before becoming of interest.

runners.comment: Improved form when third on seasonal debut but didn't back it up last time
runners.name: Mazing Grace
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on his only run last term; returned with a better effort when third in September but didn't back that up last time and it's hard to know what to expect today.

runners.comment: Promising fifth in a novice on debut last season but hasn't progressed
runners.name: Just Follow Me
runners.spotlight: Promising fifth in a novice on debut last season but hasn't progressed in two runs this term; surely capable of better at some stage but others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on seasonal return over 6f here in September but form has dipped since
runners.name: Dashing Maurison
runners.spotlight: Encouraging fourth on seasonal return over 6f here in September but form has dipped since; needs to turn things around.

runners.comment: Well beaten in both starts so far and showed little encouragement
runners.name: Super Goldendragon
runners.owner: Yip Shu Bun & Jonathan Chok Shee Feng
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in both starts so far and showed little encouragement.

05:30.race_name: Tai Long Tsui Handicap (Div I) (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course A+3) (Turf)

runners.comment: Well down the field on seasonal debut and drawn wide today
runners.name: Lucky Twin Stars
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form on final outing last season but looked desperately in need of the run when down the field on his return three weeks ago; quickly dropped into Class 4 and needs to show more.

runners.comment: Went very close over C&D on seasonal debut; high on the shortlist from stall 1
runners.name: Aurio

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Love Racing Et Al

runners.spotlight: Made amends for a low-key finish to last season when narrowly denied over C&D on his reappearance; 2lb higher for that effort but he remains high on the shortlist from stall 1.

runners.comment: Ran on strongly to cause 83-1 surprise at Happy Valley last month; may progress again
runners.name: Team Team Folks
runners.spotlight: Offered little in four runs last season but ran on strongly to cause 83-1 surprise at Happy Valley last month; up 7lb and drawn wide again today but might have more improvement to come.

runners.comment: Failed to get seriously involved on debut in October but wasn't beaten far and can improve
runners.name: Duke Of Orange
runners.spotlight: Failed to get seriously involved when midfield on debut in October but wasn't beaten far and should improve for the experience.

runners.comment: Related to smart Australian sprinters; ran on fairly well in latest trial; consult market.
runners.name: Exceptional Santos
runners.spotlight: Related to smart Australian sprinters; ran on fairly well in his latest trial; sports hood/tongue-tie on debut; consult market.

runners.comment: Has not shown a great deal in recent trials; makes very limited appeal on official debut
runners.name: General Redwood
runners.spotlight: Has not shown a great deal in recent trials and makes very limited appeal on official debut; tongue-tie/cheekpieces fitted.

runners.comment: Moderate in recent trials and may need longer trips to be seen to best effect
runners.name: I Excelle
runners.spotlight: Out of a six-time winner and by proven sire Turn Me Loose; moderate in recent trials and may need longer trips to be seen to best effect.

runners.comment: Well backed on debut three weeks ago and shaped nicely with a close third over C&D
runners.name: Vigor Eye
runners.spotlight: Well backed on debut three weeks ago and shaped nicely with a close third over C&D; looks a useful prospect and demands plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Can feature if in the right mood but the draw is tricky
runners.name: Little Monster
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent so far but showed promise when second over 5f here two starts back; can feature if in the same mood but the draw is tricky.

runners.comment: Narrowly denied at huge odds on debut but has gone the wrong way since
runners.name: Victory Champion
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied at huge odds on debut but has gone the wrong way since.

runners.comment: Ran okay on debut at a price but failed to build on it next time out; back from a layoff
runners.name: Flying Amani
runners.spotlight: Ran okay on debut at a price but failed to build on it next time out; returns from 279-day layoff with questions to answer.

runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D on penultimate outing; a possible if fully tuned up after break
runners.name: Loveisintheair
runners.spotlight: Suggested a breakthrough was coming last term, notably when a close second on his penultimate outing over C&D; considered if ready to roll following the season break.

runners.comment: C&D winner in September but has found things tougher since and is drawn wide today
runners.name: Groovy Feeling
runners.owner: Dr Anthony W K Chow & Michael Tong Hing Yuen
runners.spotlight: Strong-finishing winner over C&D on return in September but has found life tougher off his revised mark since, and has wide draw today.

runners.comment: Second over 6f two starts ago and may not have been suited by drop back to 5f last time
runners.name: Snowthorn
runners.spotlight: Produced a career best when second over 6f at Happy Valley last month; drop back to the minimum trip last time didn't suit and return to this distance should help.

runners.comment: Four-time dirt winner; looks opposable back on turf
runners.name: Daily Trophy
runners.owner: Peter Cheng & Jerry Cheng Chun Ho
runners.spotlight: Habitual dirt runner who claimed his fourth victory on that surface in October; looks opposable back on turf, though.

runners.breeder: G W Holdings A T F The Edwina Trust
runners.comment: Safely held in all three starts so far and continues to look one for the longer term
runners.name: Conrad The Great
runners.owner: Tam Man Wai, Wilson Tam Man Shu & Dr Tam Po Chor
runners.spotlight: Safely held in all three starts so far and continues to look one for the longer term; needs plenty more assistance from the handicapper.

runners.comment: Has struggled in Group races this season but should find this company more manageable
runners.name: Sword Point
runners.spotlight: Dual winner in this grade last season and highly tried in Pattern company since, including Group 2 level; has failed to make an impression this term but should find this much more manageable today.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Held twice off this mark since winning seasonal debut; needs to kick on again
runners.name: Lo Rider

quotes.race: Paddy Power "From The Horse's Mouth Podcast" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Sharinay is a progressive horse, a good sound horse and is getting better with racing. The step up in trip suited and he is improving with that. He relaxed lovely and picked up. He has an entry in the Meld Stakes - Michael Halford, co-trainer

quotes.race: Welcome To Cork Racecourse Mallow Maiden
quotes.quote: Sharinay had been working well at home. He quickened well and hit the line well, that looks to be a good trip for him - Michael Halford, co-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made a bright start to the campaign when opening his account over the extended mile at Happy Valley in September; held off his revised mark in two outings since so more is now required.

runners.comment: Placed in 1m Group 3 here in November and subsequent Group 1 defeat easily overlooked
runners.name: Ka Ying Generation

quotes.race: Book Online At DundalkStadium.com Maiden
quotes.quote: Teutates has a lovely turn of foot. He was green out of the gates so I was bit further back than ideal but it rode like a good race. He came into the straight lovely and I saw a gap and he sprinted away. It was a nice performance and he will definitely get further, he's only learning - Paddy Harnett, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Returned with a strong fourth in Group 3 company over 1m here in November before looking outclassed in a Group 1 event last time; this is more his level and a bold bid can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Backed up last month's Happy Valley win with good second off new mark this month
runners.name: Awesome Fluke

prev_owners.owner: S Saric, Mrs J C Saric Et Al

runners.spotlight: Scored narrowly over 1m1f at Happy Valley last month and backed that up with a solid effort off his revised mark two weeks ago; consistent and clearly in good heart, serious player once more.

runners.comment: Placed over 1m1f on recent Hong Kong debut and open to plenty of improvement
runners.name: Numbers
runners.owner: 23/24 Frankie Lor Fu Chuen Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: A Rakowski, M D Sullivan Et Al

runners.spotlight: Caught the eye on Hong Kong debut when making much of the running before being headed late over 1m1f at Happy Valley; finished a good third that day and looks open to plenty of improvement.

runners.comment: In red-hot form since the break, landing back-to-back C&D wins in convincing style
runners.name: Winning Wing
runners.spotlight: In red-hot form since the break, landing back-to-back C&D wins in convincing style; up a further 6lb but has momentum on his side and commands plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Dual winner last season but has failed to recapture that form in three runs this term
runners.name: Noisy Boy

prev_owners.owner: D M Richards, R M Richards & Ms E L Mitchell

runners.spotlight: Dual winner last season but has failed to recapture that form in three runs this term; others arrive in better heart and he's overlooked for win purposes.

runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D in October but form has dipped again since
runners.name: Bravehearts
runners.spotlight: Showed promise early last term and returned to form with a near-miss over C&D in October; however, hasn't backed that effort up in two starts since and needs to bounce back again.

runners.comment: Shaped encouragingly on return but has taken backward steps since; 3lb wrong today
runners.name: Gentlemen Legacy

prev_owners.owner: Mrs K L Cumming, P Cumming Et Al

runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a Class 3 success; shaped encouragingly on return but has taken backward steps since; this looks a tough task from 3lb out of the weights.

runners.breeder: Sarl De Chambure Haras Detreham & Sas Ecurie Vivaldi
runners.comment: Second to Foremost Teddy here on recent dirt debut; might progress again
runners.name: Hailtothevictors
runners.owner: Graham Kot Li Heng & Amy Chau
runners.spotlight: First sign of ability on dirt debut when 3l second to Foremost Teddy, despite slow start, over 1m three weeks ago; now 8lb better off with the winner; could progress again.

runners.breeder: Hallmark Stud Ltd & Trevor Hurley Trust
runners.comment: Has modest strike-rate, and finished only sixth on all three previous dirt starts
runners.name: Soaring Bronco
runners.owner: Simon Yung Yun Sang, Tang Ka Nin Et Al
runners.spotlight: Broke duck at 16th attempt in March but 12 more defeats have followed, and he finished only sixth on all three previous dirt starts.

runners.comment: Made low-key seasonal debut over 6f but this trip is more suitable and Zac Purton rides
runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.spotlight: Now 12lb lower than for only local win, over this C&D two years ago; made low-key seasonal/stable this month but moves back up to a more suitable trip today and the booking of Zac Purton catches the eye.

runners.breeder: Gestut Zur Kuste Ag & Riviera Equine
runners.comment: Winless since May 2024 and has yet to shine on this surface
runners.name: Atomic Beauty

quotes.race: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Atomic Jones is a real horse for next year over a mile plus. He's a big huge baby and I didn't expect to be running him this year, never mind winning two - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Barronstown Stud Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Atomic Jones came here a big raw horse but obviously he was good enough to do that. Colin said he loved the ground and he will be a trip horse for next year - Shane Lyons, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winless since May 2024 and had three of these rivals in front of him when fifth over 1m on dirt three weeks ago; has yet to shine on this surface.

runners.comment: Out of form lately but on a good mark and can't be ruled out
runners.name: Meepmeep
runners.spotlight: Only win came off 4lb higher mark over 1m in April; badly out of form in his last two starts but clearly capable of better and removal of blinkers may help.

runners.comment: Came good 1m with turf win this month and this C&D also suits; may be best fresh, though
runners.name: Family Fortune
runners.owner: Tony Stradmoor, Billy Li Sze Kuen Et Al
runners.spotlight: Came good at 17th attempt with 1m turf win 17 days ago; raised 6lb but was runner-up over this C&D in April; possible he is at his best when fresh, so quick return is a concern.

runners.comment: Opened account with front-running dirt win this month; can make another bold bid
runners.name: Foremost Teddy
runners.owner: Tse Ming Yee & Emily Tse Wing Man
runners.spotlight: Switch to front-running paid off when breaking his maiden at the 27th attempt by 3l over 1m on dirt here three weeks ago; now 8lb higher but there is no other obvious leader so another big run is likely.

runners.comment: Five-time turf winner but badly out of form lately and not yet proven on dirt
runners.name: Smart Beauty
runners.spotlight: Five-time turf winner but badly out of form lately and has not appeared to appreciate dirt on three previous attempts.

runners.comment: Scored over 1m3f on turf last month but this is only his second dirt run in 55 starts
runners.name: Super Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Ended 26-month win drought with convincing Happy Valley 1m3f victory last month but this trip is a bare minimum for him and he's trying dirt for the only the second time in 55 starts.

runners.breeder: Mrs J M & T M Henderson
runners.comment: Placed behind Foremost Teddy on dirt here this month but overall record not convincing
runners.name: Phantom Cyclone

prev_owners.owner: A Best, K Best Et Al

runners.spotlight: Equalled his best finish in 18 local runs when third to Foremost Teddy over 1m on dirt here last time; it's impossible to be confident he will build on that but this slightly longer trip is a positive.

runners.comment: Behind four of today's opponents last time and his career record is just 1-35
runners.name: Go Go Go
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a lowly mark but was behind four of today's opponents last time and his career record is just 1-35.

runners.comment: Yet to finish in top six in 13 career starts and likely to be among the outsiders as usual
runners.name: All Eyes On Me
runners.owner: Enrico Chow Yue Hin & Jennifer Ng Mau Yee
runners.spotlight: Yet to finish in the top six in 13 career starts and likely to be among the outsiders as usual.

runners.comment: Held by a handful of these rivals on the form of a recent 1m dirt meeting and is now 0-16
runners.name: Bingo Babe
runners.owner: Charmaine Wong Kam Mei & Chan Fu Ho
runners.spotlight: Held by a handful of these rivals on the form of a recent 1m dirt meeting and is now 0-16.

runners.comment: 30-race maiden who was off colour when last seen
runners.name: Mr Aladdin
runners.spotlight: 30-race maiden who has finished second three times off much higher marks than today's but was off colour when last seen.

runners.breeder: Mrs C N Taylor & Taylor Family Trust
runners.comment: Dual turf winner but not yet proven on dirt and would appeal more over further
runners.name: Leather Master
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner last term who stays 1m3f and was a fair fourth over that trip last time; 1m1f not ideal and he has no previous form on this surface.

runners.comment: Yet to win in 18 local tries and may be better suited by shorter trips
runners.name: Von Baer

quotes.race: tote Are Online Too At tote.co.uk Racing League 16 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Von Baer just wandered around quite a lot. I was left in front a long way from home. I didn't really want to be as forward as I ended up being through the race and he was lonely from the three [furlong] pole onwards. I was just trying to keep his mind focussed in the right direction but he was always pulling out enough and he's obviously a pretty smart horse. I think he won despite the track - he did feel a bit unbalanced in the first half of the race - but the cut in the ground probably helped and he's still very lightly raced so there's plenty left to come - Saffie Osborne, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Yet to win in 18 local tries and may be better suited by shorter trips but has dropped to a good mark if he can repeat his British forrm.

07:00.race_name: Tai Long Tsui Handicap (Div II) (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course A+3) (Turf)

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who has won over C&D and encountered traffic when third last time
runners.name: Packing Phoenix
runners.spotlight: Debut C&D scorer who flopped next time before redeeming himself with a good third in another C&D event a fortnight ago (lacked room early in home straight); leading contender.

runners.comment: Pulled off a 59-1 heist on his C&D debut three weeks ago, holding on by a short head
runners.name: Embrace Aberdeen
runners.spotlight: Pulled off a 59-1 heist on his C&D debut three weeks ago, holding on by a short head with three of these rivals behind him; now 6lb higher; showed a good attitude last time and should not be underestimated.

runners.comment: Inconsistent since win in April but last month's run might have brought him on
runners.name: Sky Cap
runners.spotlight: Has run well only once from five tries since winning off 2lb lower mark in April but was strong in the betting last time and should be all the better for that run (his first in five and a half months).

runners.comment: Flopped on seasonal debut but looked a good prospect last term and remains lightly raced
runners.name: Mount Everest
runners.spotlight: Looked a fair prospect last season (won over C&D on debut off 5lb lower mark); disappointed on only start this term but may be back in good heart now following seven weeks away.

runners.comment: Yet to strike form after three runs this season
runners.name: Master Phoenix
runners.spotlight: Posted four solid efforts around a year ago but has not repeated that form in three tries since returning from seven-month layoff, albeit latest run was slightly more encouraging.

runners.comment: Showed good speed before finishing second in his last two trials; official debut today
runners.name: Cloud Nine
runners.spotlight: Hails from a useful Brazilian sprinting family and has shown plenty of speed before finishing second in his last two trials; interesting newcomer who is a possible front-runner.

runners.comment: Started slowly and never in contention when a 61-1 for recent C&D debut
runners.name: Flying Christie
runners.spotlight: Started slowly and never in contention when a 61-1 for recent C&D debut.

runners.comment: Placed in two local trials but probably best watched on official debut
runners.name: Grand Mastermind
runners.spotlight: Cost AUS$240,000 as a yearling and won a soft-ground trial in Australia; placed twice from five starts in local trials without doing enough to suggest he can win at the first time of asking in an official race.

runners.comment: Outran odds of 46-1 when third of 12 over C&D on debut four weeks ago; shortlisted
runners.name: Leading Agility
runners.owner: Man Pui Kwan & Ma Pak Hung
runners.spotlight: Outran odds of 46-1 when third of 12 over C&D on debut four weeks ago; will be all the better for that experience so is one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Has not shown a great deal of ability in five local trials; overlooked on official debut

runners.spotlight: Cheaply sourced at the yearling sales in Australia and has not shown a great deal of ability in five local trial races; overlooked on official debut.

runners.comment: Has managed no better than third in six trial races; tough task on official debut
runners.name: Whowrotethatsong
runners.spotlight: Has managed no better than third in six trial races (three in New Zealand and three in Hong Kong) so it would be a surprise if he makes much impact on this official debut.

runners.breeder: Blue Gum Farm Aust Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Twice placed from four career starts (all over 6f); may not excel until upped in trip

runners.comment: Improved effort but still finished almost 4l behind Embrace Aberdeen over C&D this month
runners.name: Gastronomique
runners.spotlight: Improved effort but still finished almost 4l behind Embrace Aberdeen over C&D three weeks ago, and Zac Purton has jumped ship to ride Packing Phoenix today.

runners.comment: Yet to finish closer than eighth in five career outings; cheekpieced added today
runners.name: Dash

runners.comment: Needs to have progressed a good deal from his seventh on debut at Happy Valley
runners.name: Leather Goods
runners.spotlight: Needs to have progressed a good deal from his seventh on debut at Happy Valley (6f) if he is to be a factor.

runners.breeder: G W & Mrs M W Simon

Star Chan Iu Seng, Simon Chan Cham Man Et Al

runners.name: Robot Star

runners.comment: Struggled over C&D on debut in February and not seen since

runners.breeder: Bred To Win Thoroughbreds Pty Ltd

runners.comment: Out-of-form sprinter who has stamina to prove on this dirt debut

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Francis Meynell is one we have taken our time with. He will improve plenty for this and for what he has done at home. I might pitch him into something like the Flying Childers - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Out-of-form sprinter who has stamina to prove on this dirt debut; best to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D this month and didn't run badly over 6f a week later
runners.name: Wonderstar
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D in October and was placed over C&D at start of this month; didn't run badly from awkward draw at Happy Valley (6f) on latest outing and features prominently in calculations.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on last two appearances and has another good draw today
runners.name: Fast Responder
runners.owner: Hong Kong St John Presidents Club Syndicate

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't that confident beforehand (because of the ground), but Inquisitively is a very tough horse. He took the lead and grabbed the race from the get go. When I saw three horses in line halfway through the race I was a bit worried, but as William says he breathes very well and relaxes. When he asked him to quicken up he put it to bed very nicely. I think he is a five-furlong horse, but we will probably have to try the six (furlongs) later down the line. He was sold to go to Hong Kong, but he worked very well at mine so I asked if I could run him at York. He ran at York and won, and we decided to go for one more today. I would love to keep him, but we will have to speak to the owner. You have a question mark on the Breeders' Cup obviously. It is a long way out and we will have to discuss. It is not out of the question - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 4yo who was placed over C&D on his last two appearances and is nicely drawn towards the stands' rail again today; likely to pose a potent threat.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo; placed twice since C&D win on seasonal debut; major player

runners.spotlight: Runner-up over 6f at Happy Valley last month but this regressive 7yo has disappointed over that C&D since and looks opposable on this rare 5f start.

runners.spotlight: Three-time turf winner who pipped Reliable Profit close home to score over C&D on recent dirt debut; 5lb higher today but has the inside draw again and remains unexposed on this surface.

runners.comment: Well down the field on last month's Hong Kong debut (turf); dirt debut today
runners.name: Shamz
runners.spotlight: Well down the field on last month's Hong Kong debut at Happy Valley (1m, turf); can only be watched on this dirt debut.

runners.comment: Well down the field on last two outings, including over C&D on dirt debut
runners.name: Young Achiever

prev_owners.owner: Uranie Sarl, Pegase Bloodstock Et Al

quotes.race: 38th Mehl-Mulhens-Rennen - German 2000 Guineas (Group 2) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Angers is a lovely big horse who had run well in France last time. The trainer has done a great job and got him spot on for this, and it's not easy travelling horses to different countries. He looked the best horse in the paddock and was by far the best horse in the race - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Made satisfactory seasonal debut in September but two down-the-field finishes have followed, the first over C&D on dirt debut; wore blinkers last time; eyeshields tried today; others have much less to prove.

runners.comment: Late-maturing dirt specialist who is the form of his life this season
runners.name: Reliable Profit
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs William Yem Wai Lai
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing dirt specialist who has been placed twice over C&D in this higher grade since his easy Class 4 win in October; lost out by only a short head to Another World on latter occasion and ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: Placed twice in October but suffered a worrying slump in form last month
runners.name: Ariel
runners.spotlight: Placed on consecutive starts in October, latterly over C&D, but suffered a worrying slump in form last month and now has questions to answer.

runners.comment: Won on AW in Ireland but has struggled on first two Hong Kong starts
runners.name: Talents Trump

prev_owners.owner: David Lestrange & Athlumney Farms Ltd & Stephen Barry

runners.spotlight: Impressed when winning on Polytrack in Ireland (1m) in February but has struggled to get competitive on both Hong Kong starts (one over C&D).

runners.comment: Narrow 6f turf winner last month; up in grade for first 1m attempt
runners.name: Everstar
runners.owner: Jackie F C Hang, Colin L P Cheung & Fredrick F C Lun
runners.spotlight: Ran on strongly for last-gasp 6f turf win last month but moves up in grade for this first attempt at 1m and was safely held on his only dirt start; drawn wide; others look much safer.

runners.comment: Not disgraced over C&D on last two starts but seems best over 6f/7f
runners.name: Mask Rider
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mainly as a sprinter in Hong Kong; not disgraced over C&D on last two appearances but yet fully to convince stamina-wise over 1m.

runners.comment: Denied clear run when placed over C&D this month; Zac Purton keeps the ride
runners.name: Allcash
runners.spotlight: Revitalised 5yo who won on turf in first-time blinkers last month and was denied a clear run when placed behind Another World over C&D in this higher grade three weeks ago; Zac Purton keeps the ride; likely contender.

runners.comment: Has mixed record this season but this C&D suits and he's on a good mark
runners.name: Endeared

quotes.race: Jenningsbet British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Endeared\ was a bit unlucky not to have won before today. He got stuck in the mud last time at Chester and everything just caught him out but I think the winner (Frankness) is a good filly. He's off to Hong Kong now and his owner Ben Wong is a big supporter of mine. He was purchased as a yearling but you have to get them qualified to run out there. That was more stressful than trying to win a Group race. I'm sure he will do very well out there - James Fanshawe, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has a rather mixed record this season but was placed over C&D in September and kept on for fifth behind Another World here three weeks ago; usually ridden very patiently; can't be ruled out off current mark.

runners.comment: Won four times over C&D last season but well below best this term
runners.name: Never Peter Out
runners.spotlight: Won four times over C&D last season and is now 2lb below his last winning mark but needs to up his game after a string of below-par runs this term.

runners.comment: C&D winner on just his second Hong Kong start but soundly beaten since
runners.name: Loch Tay
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly to win over C&D last month, his second Hong Kong start; has plenty of scope to build on that performance but was soundly beaten in C&D race won by Another World three weeks ago and it's hard to know what to expect today.

runners.comment: Placed twice over C&D this season but on career-high mark and drawn wide
runners.name: New Future Folks
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over C&D this season and didn't really have race run to suit when only eighth here last time, but remains on career-high mark and has awkward draw.

runners.comment: Career-best form when placed twice in October but didn't fire over C&D last month
runners.name: Harold Win
runners.spotlight: Career-best form when placed on consecutive outings in October (6f/7f) but didn't really fire over C&D last month and others in the line-up look better handicapped.

runners.comment: Made all twice towards end of last season but well held both starts this term
runners.name: Jumbo Treasure
runners.spotlight: Made all twice over C&D towards end of last season but well down the field on both outings this term and the handicapper hasn't budged.

runners.comment: Went very close at Happy Valley last month and has another good draw here
runners.name: Prestige Always
runners.owner: Eric Yeung Ting Fung & Angel Wong Sau Kuen

quotes.race: Claregalwayhotel.ie Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: It was a very good run at the Curragh from Mythology the last day and he had a good run there the time before that as well. He deserved to get his head in front and he will get confidence from that. We think he is a horse who can hold his own in Group company as the season goes on. He'll probably go to Deauville in two weeks for a Group race. He handles a bit of juice but I think he would be fine on better ground too - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Gained his only Hong Kong win over 7f but was placed twice over 6f at Happy Valley last month, losing out by a nose on latter occasion; remains on a workable mark and, from stall 2, he's a likely contender.

runners.breeder: B J Lindsay & Mrs J E Lindsay
runners.comment: Progressive 4yo who commands respect, despite awkward draw
runners.name: Szeryng
runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who began this season with an emphatic C&D win last month and was persistently denied a clear run when only fifth here a fortnight later; still has more improvement to come and commands respect, despite awkward draw.

runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who has made a very solid start to his Hong Kong career
runners.name: Stormy Grove
runners.owner: Lily Chan Li Lei & Marc Chan
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who made a very encouraging Hong Kong debut over 5f in October and kept on for third over C&D last month; may still have a bigger run in him; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Ended last season in good form but not at his best on sole appearance this term
runners.name: Super Infinity
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a string of good efforts over C&D but made nothing better than a satisfactory reappearance in October and has been off for another two months since; needs to get back in the groove.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten when 72-1 for Hong Kong debut here (5f) three weeks ago
runners.name: Joker Orbit
runners.owner: Tobias Chong Wing To & Ophelia Chong Kar Wing

prev_owners.owner: J D Payne & Ms A Ockwell

runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten when 72-1 for Hong Kong debut here (5f) three weeks ago and probably needs more time to acclimatise.

runners.comment: Made a low-key Hong Kong debut at Happy Valley last month
runners.name: Greater Bae
runners.spotlight: Won 5.5f maiden in Australia in March but made a low-key Hong Kong debut (albeit from tough draw) at Happy Valley last month and needs that run to have brought him on.

runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive on recent Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Starry Show
runners.spotlight: 2yo winner when based in Australia but struggled to get competitive on recent Hong Kong debut (5f).

runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner in October but held in this higher grade since; drawn wide
runners.name: Goldentronicmighty
runners.spotlight: Held on narrowly for Class 4 C&D win on seasonal debut in October but safely held when upped to this grade last month and faces a tough task from stall 14 today.

runners.comment: Made the frame on second of three HK starts but not the percentage call today
runners.name: Lucky Xander
runners.spotlight: Bettered inauspicious Hong Kong debut when keeping-on fourth at Happy Valley (5f; first-time visor) last month but was unable to land a telling blow over that C&D on latest outing and is not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Not the force of old but ran well on both starts this season and is well drawn
runners.name: Find My Love
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Dannis Lee Cheuk Yin
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but went very close at Happy Valley on seasonal debut in October and last month's fifth there was perfectly respectable; drawn on the inside here; considered each-way.

runners.comment: 2yo Group 3 winner in Australia but has struggled in Hong Kong
runners.name: Holmes A Court

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner as a 2yo in Australia but has struggled in Hong Kong (five runs) and is now eligible for a drop in grade.

runners.comment: Stayed on for fifth over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Heaving
runners.owner: Cindi Hui Ming Ming, Dr David Choy Tak Wai & Ricky C W Kay

prev_owners.owner: Rtd Racing, Pin Cushion Racing Et Al

runners.spotlight: 3-5 when based in Australia (all wins over 6f) and stayed on for fifth over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut; could have a say if that run brought him on.

runners.comment: 2-8 in Australia; makes Hong Kong debut after seven-month break
runners.name: Natural Numbers

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, R & C Legh Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who doubled his tally with a 7f handicap win in May; makes Hong Kong debut after seven-month break; probably best watched.

10:30.race_name: Race 3 - Glorious Saturday Stakes - Daaeem Incentive Race (Handicap) (Dirt)

quotes.race: Azizi Venice (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: The Camden Colt has been training superbly and we couldn't believe that he got beaten twice on the turf. We spoke to the owners and said that he was training well on the dirt, even though he has a complete turf pedigree. We were very confident coming in tonight. Ideally, we'd like to run him in the Godolphin Mile, but his handicap might not go up enough to warrant that. So we might go to the Jebel Ali Classic over 1400 metres - Bhupat Seemar, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with his effort to finish second in a handicap at Newmarket the other day. We thought he'd run well and he'll improve for that. 29-04-24

quotes.race: Al Quoz Sprint sponsored by AZIZI Developments (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'd be lying if I said we were confident beforehand. We thought possibly prize money and that would be great as Danyah has a good cruising speed. It was worth a chance but the low draw in gate five was a concern. It was funny they stayed away from the stands' side and I got a great draft into the race behind the second horse and he finished very strongly like a horse that gets further - Dane O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Business Bay Challenge Presented by Nakheel (Listed Race) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I had a nice position and once we turned in Danyah started to lengthen and grow in stature. He couldn't win from his gate (on dirt) the other night when he was drawn 16 but there's no reason why he can't go on it again - Dane O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Handicap
quotes.quote: They didn't go very quick early on and I was keen to make a move in the straight as Danyah lengthens rather than quickens. He tried hard and loved the ground - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Heed Your Hunch Handicap
quotes.quote: Danyah needs settling a bit but the yard have done a great job with him. He's got the hood on, I'd imagine that could come off in time and hopefully he'll go forward - Dane O'Neill, jockey.

runners.name: Cats By Five
runners.owner: Sh Humaid Bin Rashid Al Nuaimi

quotes.race: Ford (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I think Telemark could probably go to a mile but he has got a lot of speed so we'll have to see what William (Buick) says on this particular track - Ed Crisford, trainer, speaking to Dubai Racing.

quotes.race: Betfred City Of Doncaster Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't expecting ground like that and Telemark likes it. He's always been a horse with some talent but things haven't always dropped right for him and that ground enabled him to be seen at his best. He's done it well. The key to him is to get a little bit of cover, try to get him to switch off and then he can finish his race nicely. If you watch his last run at Goodwood he put up a pretty solid effort and this hasn't come as a big surprise - but a nice one - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Telemark was quite fancied for the Horris Hill last year, but the heavy ground and a long season took it out of him. It's really nice to see him bounce back. He's likeable and has been doing everything right at home -  Jack Mitchell, jockey.

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum
One More Moment Of Madness & Partner

stable_tour.quote: A nice, scopey horse, he ran at Wolverhampton two weeks ago but nothing went right. The course probably wasn't ideal and he'll be better on a more galloping track. He should also get a mile and a quarter. 17-04-24

runners.name: Gallantly
runners.owner: Ahmed Ebrahim Bin Aamer Al Shemeili

prev_owners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith

stable_tour.quote: He was nicely on top at the line at Chester and seems to stay well, so the King George V Stakes would look nice for him. He's improved with every start and hopefully will continue to do so. Chantilly and London City, who seems to stay very well, are others for that race. 11-06-24

runners.breeder: Jason Hall, Monte Hehnke, Joe Wheeler & Mike Rinkovsky
runners.name: Nyaar

quotes.race: Como Residences (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: As long as he jumps, Nyaar is very good. Sometimes he gets agitated and misses it half a beat. Obviously backing up after a week isn't ideal, but Carl Hodgson who rides him at home was very happy with him. He's a horse who always looks like he needs a run, because he's quite stocky - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

quotes.race: Defender 130 Outbound Edition (Maiden) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Nyaar has been crying out for [a win] and he was hitting the line well over seven so I was confident he'd get it, although he's bred to be a sprinter. He's very straightforward. He can run at Jebel Ali, or here, it doesn't really matter - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

11:30.race_name: Race 5 - New Year Fest Stakes - Daaeem Incentive Race (Handicap) (Dirt)

runners.name: Mister Saint Paul
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Bernd & Torsten Raber, Luc Josse Et Al

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Solario Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't able to teach him all that much on his debut, but today was another learning curve. Aablan is quite flamboyant in his early paces, so it's key to conserve that energy and the race couldn't have worked out much better. We were able to get some cover, which helped and he was soon nicely under control. He gets through the line well, so I was keen to let him go through his paces. He hasn't got an electric turn of foot but I knew this distance would be perfect with a stiff finish. Going further will be better for him. With this fella, a lot will depend on how he takes his races, so I don't think Charlie will be in a great rush to make a decision on a target. He's a lively character and takes a bit of managing, but the team at home have done a great job with him - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: James Doyle said to stick to seven furlongs for now with Aablan as he's not short of speed. Charlie likes this race as we have a few two-year-olds that need this trip - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Hills Estate (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Arabian Tale is a bit of an enigma and just does enough at home. On his first dirt run he was third behind Nevershow Weakness who went on to win his next two - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

runners.name: Mashkoor
runners.owner: Marwan Abdul Rahman Mohd Sharif Al Baidhaei

12:00.race_name: Race 6 - Commercial Bank Of Dubai Stakes (Handicap) (Dirt)

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports First Goalscorer Insurance Handicap
quotes.quote: Excel Power had a great run around and seems to like it around here. Hopefully that can set him up for a good winter - Luke Morris, jockey

quotes.race: Lathom Handicap
quotes.quote: It was pretty straightforward once Excel Power jumped well. He got a nice breather on the top turn and he sees out this trip well. He's a very consistent horse and it was an impressive comeback run - winning rider Hollie Doyle.

runners.name: Exculpation
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
